    - jiào
    - to teach; instruction; religion; to educate
  - 导(導)

- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 教(teach) + 导/導(guide) = instruct; teach
  - **interpretation:** Combines imparting knowledge with guiding someone’s course, emphasizing instruction paired with direction. Common in contexts where a superior or elder provides moral or practical guidance.
  - **simplification:** 「導」 was simplified to 「导」 by collapsing the complex road (辶/道) and hand (寸) components into a streamlined form, reducing strokes while retaining the guiding/leading sense.
- **examples:**

  - 父母的教导让我受益终生(父母的教導讓我受益終生)。
    - Fùmǔ de jiàodǎo ràng wǒ shòuyì zhōngshēng.
    - My parents’ guidance benefits me for life.
  - 他以身作则来教导新人(他以身作則來教導新人)。
    - Tā yǐshēn zuòzé lái jiàodǎo xīnrén.
    - He sets an example to instruct the newcomers.

### 教导(教導) → 导(導)
- **definition:** to guide; to lead; to direct; to conduct
- **pinyin:** dǎo
- **components:**
  - 巳
    - sì
    - 6th Earthly Branch; snake (zodiac)
  - 寸
    - cùn
    - inch; hand; small measure
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** simplified character
  - **description:** Simplified from 導 (道 → 巳); original 導 is phono-semantic: semantic 寸 (“hand”) + phonetic 道 (“path”).
  - **interpretation:** In the traditional form, a hand (寸) leads someone along a road (道), conveying the idea of guiding. The simplification replaces the complex 道 with 巳 to reduce strokes, keeping the hand component and core meaning while weakening the original phonetic cue.
  - **simplification:** Replaced the complex phonetic 道 with the simpler 巳 to lower stroke count while retaining the semantic 寸.
- **examples:**
  - 导游带我们参观故宫(導遊帶我們參觀故宮)。
    - Dǎoyóu dài wǒmen cānguān Gùgōng.
    - The tour guide led us to visit the Forbidden City.
  - 他负责指导新员工(他負責指導新員工)。
    - Tā fùzé zhǐdǎo xīn yuángōng.
    - He is responsible for guiding the new employees.
  - 这种材料能导电(這種材料能導電)。
    - Zhè zhǒng cáiliào néng dǎodiàn.
    - This material can conduct electricity.
### 教导(教導) → 导(導) → 巳
- **definition:** 6th Earthly Branch; snake (zodiac)
- **pinyin:** sì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram (象形): coiled snake; an alternate theory analyzes it as a foetus; graph similar to 已.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a coiled serpent, which aligns with its use as the sixth Earthly Branch associated with the Snake. Its visual similarity to 已/己 has led to historical confusion and variant explanations of the graph.
- **examples:**
  - 现在是巳时(現在是巳時)。
    - Xiànzài shì sì shí.
    - It is the Si hour (9–11 a.m.).
  - 他属蛇，对应的地支是巳(他屬蛇，對應的地支是巳)。
    - Tā shǔ shé, duìyìng de dìzhī shì sì.
    - He is of the Snake sign; the corresponding Earthly Branch is Si.
  - 农历常用十二地支记时，其中之一是巳(農曆常用十二地支記時，其中之一是巳)。
    - Nónglì cháng yòng shí’èr dìzhī jì shí, qízhōng zhī yī shì sì.
    - The lunar calendar often uses the twelve Earthly Branches to mark hours; one of them is Si.
### 教导(教導) → 导(導) → 寸
- **definition:** inch; hand; small measure
- **pinyin:** cùn
- **components:**
  - 又
    - yòu
    - again; (archaic) right hand
  - 一
    - yī
    - one
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram (指事)
  - **description:** Indicative of the position on the forearm where the pulse is palpated (寸口); the unit sense derives from the wrist-to-point distance. Compare 又, 手, 九, 爪.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a wrist/hand with a small mark showing the pulse point (寸口). From the short span used to locate that point, it generalized to the unit meaning “inch,” and as a component it often relates to hand/action or small measures.
- **examples:**
  - 这块木板只有三寸厚(這塊木板只有三寸厚)。
    - Zhè kuài mùbǎn zhǐyǒu sān cùn hòu.
    - This plank is only three inches thick.
  - 医生在我的寸口上按脉(醫生在我的寸口上按脈)。
    - Yīshēng zài wǒ de cùnkǒu shàng àn mài.
    - The doctor presses my pulse at the cun point.
  - 城市里寸土寸金(城市裡寸土寸金)。
    - Chéngshì lǐ cùn tǔ cùn jīn.
    - In the city, every inch of land is as precious as gold.
### 教导(教導) → 导(導) → 寸 → 一
- **definition:** one
- **pinyin:** yī
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** a horizontal stroke, indicating the number 'one'.
  - **interpretation:** A single horizontal line visually represents the concept of oneness. As the simplest numeral, it set the pattern for 二 and 三 by repeating the stroke to show increasing quantity.
- **examples:**

## terrible; extremely; amazing
### bùdéliǎo
---
- **definition:** terrible; extremely; amazing
- **pinyin:** bùdéliǎo
- **components:**
  - 不
    - bù
    - not;no;un-;negation

    - dé
    - obtain;get;must;complement marker
  - 了
    - liǎo
    - to finish;to understand;to be able to;to end
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** fixed phrase (negative potential complement)
  - **description:** 不(not) + 得了(can manage/finish) = cannot be handled; hence overwhelmingly great/serious.
  - **interpretation:** Originally meant something so serious it can’t be dealt with, hence ‘terrible’ or ‘disastrous’. In modern speech it also intensifies adjectives/verbs to mean ‘extremely; amazingly’ depending on context, positive or negative.
- **examples:**
  - 今天热得不得了(今天熱得不得了)。
    - Jīntiān rè de bùdéliǎo.
    - It’s extremely hot today.
  - 他高兴得不得了(他高興得不得了)。
    - Tā gāoxìng de bùdéliǎo.
    - He’s overjoyed.
  - 出了这么大的事故，麻烦不得了(出了這麼大的事故，麻煩不得了)。
    - Chūle zhème dà de shìgù, máfan bùdéliǎo.
    - With such a major accident, the trouble is immense.
### 不得了 → 不
- **definition:** not;no;un-;negation
- **pinyin:** bù
- **components:**
  - 一
    - yī
    - one
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: calyx of a flower; negation sense back-formed from 否 (口 + 不); also interpreted as a bird flying toward the sky (一).
  - **interpretation:** Originally a drawing of a flower’s calyx, the graph later acquired the meaning ‘not’ when it participated in the formation of 否 (“mouth” + 不) for negation, and that sense was transferred back to 不. The botanical meaning was reassigned to 柎, while some traditional scholars reimagined the form as a bird flying upward toward the sky line to evoke the idea of negation.
- **examples:**
  - 我不喜欢咖啡(我不喜歡咖啡)。
    - Wǒ bù xǐhuan kāfēi.
    - I don’t like coffee.
  - 今天不去学校(今天不去學校)。
    - Jīntiān bù qù xuéxiào.
    - I’m not going to school today.
  - 这不容易(這不容易)。
    - Zhè bù róngyì.
    - This is not easy.
### 不得了 → 不 → 一
- **definition:** one
- **pinyin:** yī
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** a horizontal stroke, indicating the number 'one'.
  - **interpretation:** A single horizontal line visually represents the concept of oneness. As the simplest numeral, it set the pattern for 二 and 三 by repeating the stroke to show increasing quantity.
- **examples:**
  - 我只有一本书(我只有一本書)。
    - Wǒ zhǐ yǒu yì běn shū.
    - I only have one book.
  - 他一到就给我打电话(他一到就給我打電話)。
    - Tā yí dào jiù gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
    - As soon as he arrives, he calls me.

    - Yí gè wèntí dōu méiyǒu.

### 不得了 → 得
- **definition:** obtain;get;must;complement marker
- **pinyin:** dé
- **components:**
  - 彳
    - chì
    - step; to walk
  - 贝(貝)
    - bèi
    - cowry; money
  - 又
    - yòu

- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (會意 / 会意)
  - **description:** 貝 “cowry” + 又 “hand”; 彳 was sometimes added to show the cowry was picked up on the road.
  - **interpretation:** A hand taking a cowry shell (money) pictures the act of obtaining valuables, yielding meanings like ‘to get’ or ‘to gain.’ The added step/road element highlights an action in motion, which later broadened into grammatical uses marking result or degree.
- **examples:**
  - 他汉字写得很好(他漢字寫得很好)。
    - Tā Hànzì xiě de hěn hǎo.
    - He writes Chinese characters very well.
  - 我得到了奖(我得到了獎)。
    - Wǒ dédào le jiǎng.
    - I received an award.
  - 我得走了(我得走了)。
    - Wǒ děi zǒu le.
    - I have to go now.
### 不得了 → 得 → 彳
- **definition:** step; to walk
- **pinyin:** chì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Simplified from 行: the left side of the crossroads pictogram as seen from above; cf. the top component of 辵.
  - **interpretation:** Derived by isolating the left half of 行, an overhead view of a crossroads. The form came to signify a single step and, by extension, walking; it parallels the abbreviated top of 辵 in motion-related characters.
- **examples:**
  - 他独自彳亍在小巷中(他獨自彳亍在小巷中)，思绪万千(思緒萬千)。

  - 彳是部首之一(彳是部首之一)，常见于表示行走的字(常見於表示行走的字)。
    - Chì shì bùshǒu zhī yī, chángjiàn yú biǎoshì xíngzǒu de zì.
    - Rěn is one of the radicals, often seen in characters related to walking.
  - 字典将“彳”读作“chì”(字典將「彳」讀作「chì」)，义为“行走(義為「行走)、步”(步」)。
    - Zìdiǎn jiāng “chì” dúzuò “chì”, yìwéi “xíngzǒu, bù”.
    - Dictionaries read “彳” as “chì,” meaning “to walk; step.”
### 不得了 → 得 → 贝(貝)
- **definition:** cowry; money
- **pinyin:** bèi
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – cowrie used as currency in ancient China; simplified form of 貝 in cursive script.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a cowry shell, an object that functioned as early money, which motivates the senses “cowry; money.” In the simplified set, its strokes were streamlined by adopting a cursive-style form of 貝.
  - **simplification:** Adopted the cursive-script variant of 貝, reducing strokes and complexity.
- **examples:**
  - 古代用贝(貝)当作货币(貨幣)。
    - Gǔdài yòng bèi dāngzuò huòbì.
    - In ancient times, cowries were used as currency.
  - 海滩(海灘)上有很多贝(貝)。
    - Hǎitān shang yǒu hěn duō bèi.
    - There are many shells on the beach.
  - 这串项链(這串項鍊)是用贝(貝)做的。
    - Zhè chuàn xiàngliàn shì yòng bèi zuò de.
    - This necklace is made of shells.
### 不得了 → 得 → 又
- **definition:** again; right hand
- **pinyin:** yòu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – a right hand; original form of 右; unrelated to 𠬤 (> 译). Often written as 彐 in many modern characters (e.g., 事, 聿, 雪, 急, 爭, 尹, 建).
  - **interpretation:** Early graphs depict a right hand, which later gave rise to 右 ‘right (side)’. The adverbial sense ‘again’ developed later by semantic extension. In many compounds a similar shape is written as 彐, but that is a graphic convention rather than a direct historical component here.
- **examples:**
  - 他又来了(他又來了)。
    - Tā yòu lái le.
    - He came again.
  - 请向右转(請向右轉)。
    - Qǐng xiàng yòu zhuǎn.
    - Please turn right.
  - 她又买了一本书(她又買了一本書)。
    - Tā yòu mǎi le yī běn shū.
    - She bought another book.
### 不得了 → 了
- **definition:** to finish;to understand;to be able to;to end
- **pinyin:** liǎo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: baby without arms; Shuowen says “crossing of lower legs,” Shuowen Jiezi Zhu says entangled legs; “finish” likely a sound loan; unrelated to 亨.
  - **interpretation:** Earliest graphs depict an infant with crossed or tangled legs, a simple pictorial form later repurposed in use. Verbal senses like “to finish/understand/be able to” developed via sound loan, while the original image survives only in historical explanations.
- **examples:**
  - 我终于了结了这件事(我終於了結了這件事)。
    - Wǒ zhōngyú liǎojié le zhè jiàn shì.
    - I finally settled this matter.
  - 他对历史很了解(他對歷史很了解)。
    - Tā duì lìshǐ hěn liǎojiě.
    - He understands history well.
  - 我们解决不了这个问题(我們解決不了這個問題)。
    - Wǒmen jiějué bùliǎo zhège wèntí.
    - We can’t solve this problem.

  - 古籍中偶见攴(古籍中偶見攴)，表示用棍轻敲(表示用棍輕敲)。
    - Gǔjí zhōng ǒu jiàn pū, biǎoshì yòng gùn qīng qiāo.
    - In old texts, one occasionally sees 攴, meaning to tap lightly with a stick.
  - 这个偏旁叫攴字旁(這個偏旁叫攴字旁)，多与打、教等义有关(多與打、教等義有關)。
    - Zhège piānpáng jiào pū zìpáng, duō yǔ dǎ, jiào děng yì yǒuguān.
    - This side component is called the ‘攴’ radical and often relates to meanings like hitting or teaching.
### 色魔 → 魔 → 麻 → 林
- **definition:** woods; forest
- **pinyin:** lín
- **components:**
  - 木
    - mù
    - tree; wood
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** Duplication of 木 (“tree”) to indicate multiple trees → forest; semantic: 木 + 木.
  - **interpretation:** Doubling the tree component places two trees together, evoking a grove or woods. Repetition signals plurality, so two trees generalize to a forest; adding a third 木 yields 森 for dense woods.
- **examples:**
  - 我们走进林中散步(我們走進林中散步)。
    - Wǒmen zǒu jìn lín zhōng sànbù.
    - We walked into the woods for a stroll.
  - 这片树林很安静(這片樹林很安靜)。
    - Zhè piàn shùlín hěn ānjìng.
    - This grove is very quiet.
  - 市中心高楼林立(市中心高樓林立)。
    - Shì zhōngxīn gāolóu línlì.
    - In the city center, high-rises stand in great numbers.
### 色魔 → 魔 → 麻 → 林 → 木
- **definition:** tree; wood
- **pinyin:** mù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram (象形)
  - **description:** a tree: branches on top, roots on the bottom (more visible in earlier forms).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a tree with spreading branches above and roots below, as seen clearly in early scripts. The vertical stroke is the trunk, while the short horizontal strokes became stylized limbs and roots in the regular form.
- **examples:**
  - 这张桌子是木头做的(這張桌子是木頭做的)。
    - Zhè zhāng zhuōzi shì mùtou zuò de.
    - This table is made of wood.
  - 山上长满了树木(山上長滿了樹木)。
    - Shān shang zhǎng mǎn le shùmù.
    - The mountainside is covered with trees.
  - 木材被运到工厂加工(木材被運到工廠加工)。
    - Mùcái bèi yùn dào gōngchǎng jiāgōng.
    - The timber was transported to the factory for processing.
### 色魔 → 魔 → 鬼
- **definition:** ghost; demon
- **pinyin:** guǐ
- **components:**
  - 田
    - tián
    - field
  - 儿(兒)
    - ér
    - child; son
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a kneeling figure with an ugly mask-like face (甶); a small tail-like 厶 stroke was added later.
  - **interpretation:** Originally sketched as a crouching person wearing a grotesque mask, evoking an eerie, otherworldly presence. A later tail-like stroke emphasized its creaturely form and helped distinguish it from similar shapes.
- **examples:**
  - 夜里有人说看见了鬼(夜裡有人說看見了鬼)。
    - Yè lǐ yǒu rén shuō kànjiàn le guǐ.
    - Someone said they saw a ghost at night.
  - 他被鬼故事吓得不敢睡觉(他被鬼故事嚇得不敢睡覺)。
    - Tā bèi guǐ gùshì xià de bù gǎn shuìjiào.
    - He was so scared by ghost stories that he didn’t dare to sleep.
  - 别装神弄鬼(別裝神弄鬼)，快把真相说出来(快把真相說出來)。
    - Bié zhuāngshén nòngguǐ, kuài bǎ zhēnxiàng shuō chūlai.
    - Stop putting on a spooky act and quickly tell the truth.
### 色魔 → 魔 → 鬼 → 田
- **definition:** field
- **pinyin:** tián
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: pictographic representation of a field divided into four sections.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a top-down view of a plot divided by paths or furrows, which naturally came to denote farmland. The square-with-cross motif also lent itself in some ancient contexts to a mask-like image, influencing related graphs.
- **examples:**
  - 这片田很肥沃(這片田很肥沃)。
    - Zhè piàn tián hěn féiwò.
    - This field is very fertile.
  - 他们在田里劳动(他們在田裡勞動)。
    - Tāmen zài tián lǐ láodòng.
    - They are working in the fields.
  - 春天农民在田里插秧(春天農民在田裡插秧)。
    - Chūntiān nóngmín zài tián lǐ chāyāng.
    - In spring, farmers transplant rice seedlings in the fields.
### 色魔 → 魔 → 鬼 → 儿(兒)
- **definition:** child; son
- **pinyin:** ér
- **components:**
  - 人
    - rén
    - person
  - 臼
    - jiù
    - mortar
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a standing person; radical form of 人; also simplified from 兒 by eliminating 臼
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person standing on two legs, which is why it doubles as the person radical form. In traditional 兒, an added 臼 element evoked a baby’s soft skull, but simplification removed that part, leaving only the person/legs shape.
  - **simplification:** Stroke reduction by dropping 臼 from 兒 and reusing the existing person-radical form 儿.
- **examples:**
  - 我儿子在学校(我兒子在學校)。
    - Wǒ érzi zài xuéxiào.
    - My son is at school.
  - 她是我的女儿(她是我的女兒)。
    - Tā shì wǒ de nǚ'ér.
    - She is my daughter.
  - 这些电影很适合儿童观看(這些電影很適合兒童觀看)。
    - Zhèxiē diànyǐng hěn shìhé értóng guānkàn.
    - These movies are very suitable for children to watch.
### 色魔 → 魔 → 鬼 → 儿(兒) → 臼
- **definition:** mortar
- **pinyin:** jiù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a mortar. See the original version of 舂, in which a pestle is visible on top.
  - **interpretation:** A direct drawing of a mortar, showing the bowl used for pounding. Connection to 舂 (to pound) is historical, where a pestle appears above. Similar shapes seen in 學、兒、䳔、鼠、叟 are coincidental and unrelated.
- **examples:**
  - 他用杵在臼里舂米(他用杵在臼裡舂米)。
    - Tā yòng chǔ zài jiù lǐ chōng mǐ.
    - He uses a pestle to pound rice in the mortar.
  - 这个石臼很重(這個石臼很重)。
    - Zhège shíjiù hěn zhòng.
    - This stone mortar is very heavy.
  - 实验室里常用研钵和研杵(實驗室裡常用研鉢和研杵)。
    - Shíyànshì lǐ cháng yòng yánbō hé yánchǔ.
    - In laboratories, a mortar and pestle are commonly used.

## picture; map; plan
### tú
---
- **definition:** picture; map; plan
- **pinyin:** tú
- **components:**
  - 啚
    - bǐ
    - remote areas; territory (early form of 鄙)
  - 冬
    - dōng
    - winter
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (會意)
  - **description:** semantic: 囗 ‘walled city’ + 啚 (early form of 鄙, ‘remote areas/territory’); simplified 啚 → 冬.
  - **interpretation:** An enclosure 囗 surrounds 啚, evoking a bounded territory, which extends to the sense of a map, picture, or plan of an area. In simplification, 啚 was replaced by the simpler 冬 to cut strokes while preserving the enclosed-area silhouette and meaning.
  - **simplification:** 啚 was replaced with the graphically simpler 冬 to reduce stroke count and ease writing; the change is shape-based rather than phonetic.
- **examples:**
  - 请看地图(請看地圖)，路线很清楚(路線很清楚)。
    - Qǐng kàn dìtú, lùxiàn hěn qīngchǔ.
    - Please look at the map; the route is very clear.
  - 我画了一张图(我畫了一張圖)。
    - Wǒ huà le yì zhāng tú.
    - I drew a picture/diagram.
  - 我们按图施工(我們按圖施工)，计划如期完成(計劃如期完成)。
    - Wǒmen àn tú shīgōng, jìhuà rúqī wánchéng.
    - We built according to the plan, and the project was completed on schedule.
### 图(圖) → 啚
- **definition:** remote areas; territory (early form of 鄙)
- **pinyin:** bǐ
- **components:**
  - 㐭
    - lǐn
    - granary; storehouse
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 囗 ‘city boundary’ + 㐭 ‘granary’; original form of 鄙.
  - **interpretation:** Enclosure for a city boundary pairs with a granary to picture a storehouse located beyond the walls, evoking the outskirts or countryside. By extension it came to mean the borderland or remote areas, and was later standardized as 鄙.
- **examples:**
  - 将军奉命巡边，远至啚地(將軍奉命巡邊，遠至啚地)。
    - Jiāng jūn fèng mìng xún biān, yuǎn zhì bǐ dì.
    - The general was ordered to patrol the borders, reaching the remote outlands.
  - 乡民在啚地屯粮，以备荒年(鄉民在啚地屯糧，以備荒年)。
    - Xiāng mín zài bǐ dì tún liáng, yǐ bèi huāng nián.
    - Villagers stockpiled grain in the outlands to prepare for years of famine.
  - 古籍记载，此处本为啚，后并入郡县(古籍記載，此處本為啚，後併入郡縣)。
    - Gǔ jí jì zǎi, cǐ chù běn wéi bǐ, hòu bìng rù jùn xiàn.
    - Ancient records note that this place was once the borderland, later incorporated into a commandery and county.
### 图(圖) → 啚 → 㐭
- **definition:** granary; storehouse
- **pinyin:** lǐn
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a granary.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts the outline of an ancient grain store, likely with a container and supporting structure. Over time the strokes were stylized, but it still evokes a storage bin used for harvested grain.
- **examples:**
  - 村里有一座㐭(村裡有一座㐭)。
    - Cūn lǐ yǒu yī zuò lǐn.
    - There is a granary in the village.
  - 秋收时，农夫把稻谷搬进㐭(秋收時，農夫把稻穀搬進㐭)。
    - Qiūshōu shí, nóngfū bǎ dàogǔ bān jìn lǐn.
    - At harvest time, the farmers move the rice into the granary.
  - 他们把粮食储存在㐭里(他們把糧食儲存在㐭裡)。
    - Tāmen bǎ liángshi chǔcún zài lǐn lǐ.
    - They store the grain in the granary.
### 图(圖) → 冬
- **definition:** winter
- **pinyin:** dōng
- **components:**
  - 夂
    - zhǐ
    - end
  - 日
    - rì
    - day; sun
  - 仌
    - bīng
    - ice
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound; phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** phonetic: 夂 (zhǐ, “end”) + semantic: 日 (“day”) or 仌 (“ice”); also analyzed as ideogrammic.
  - **interpretation:** Often read as depicting the end of the day/year or the presence of ice, evoking the cold season. The element 夂 supplies the sound (OC *tuːŋ, aligning with dōng) and also hints at finality.
- **examples:**
  - 冬天很冷(冬天很冷)。
    - Dōngtiān hěn lěng.
    - Winter is very cold.
  - 我喜欢冬至吃饺子(我喜歡冬至吃餃子)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan dōngzhì chī jiǎozi.
    - I like to eat dumplings at the Winter Solstice.
  - 冬季常下雪(冬季常下雪)。
    - Dōngjì cháng xiàxuě.
    - It often snows in winter.
### 图(圖) → 冬 → 夂
- **definition:** end
- **pinyin:** zhǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a footprint pointing downward; cf. 夊 (variant). Shuowen: two legs (𠂊) + trailing stroke (㇏), ‘approach from behind’.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a downward-moving footprint, evoking slow, trailing motion or proceeding from behind. Traditional analyses also read it as two legs with a following stroke, matching the idea of approaching from the rear.
- **examples:**
  - 这个字的部首是夂(這個字的部首是夂)。
    - Zhège zì de bùshǒu shì zhǐ.
    - The radical of this character is 夂.
  - 夂部常表示行走或缓慢前进的意思(夂部常表示行走或緩慢前進的意思)。
    - Zhǐ bù cháng biǎoshì xíngzǒu huò huǎnmàn qiánjìn de yìsi.
    - The 夂 radical often conveys the idea of walking or moving slowly.
  - 在字典里，夂和夊要区分清楚(在字典裡，夂和夊要區分清楚)。
    - Zài zìdiǎn lǐ, zhǐ hé suī yào qūfēn qīngchu.
    - In dictionaries, 夂 and 夊 must be clearly distinguished.
### 图(圖) → 冬 → 日
- **definition:** day; sun
- **pinyin:** rì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** The sun; a dot or line was added in the centre to distinguish it from similar graphs (e.g., 囗, early form of 丁); compare earlier forms with the Sun symbol (☉) and the Egyptian hieroglyph 𓇳.
  - **interpretation:** Early forms depicted a round sun, later marked with a central stroke or dot to prevent confusion with similar enclosed shapes. Its form closely echoes the solar symbol ☉ and parallels sun pictographs found in other ancient scripts.
- **examples:**
  - 我每天写日记(我每天寫日記)。
    - Wǒ měi tiān xiě rìjì.
    - I write in my diary every day.
  - 今天是星期日(今天是星期日)。
    - Jīntiān shì xīngqīrì.
    - Today is Sunday.
  - 旭日东升(旭日東昇)，海面一片金光(海面一片金光)。
    - Xùrì dōngshēng, hǎimiàn yí piàn jīnguāng.
    - As the rising sun ascends in the east, the sea gleams with golden light.
### 图(圖) → 冬 → 仌
- **definition:** ice
- **pinyin:** bīng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Two blocks of ice; next to a character they are compressed and stylized as 冫 (unrelated to 氵 and 次).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts two chunks of ice, conveying the meaning directly through image. When used as a left-side component in other characters, it reduces to 冫, the ice radical, distinct from the water radical 氵.
- **examples:**
  - 杯子里放着一块仌(杯子裡放著一塊仌)。
    - Bēizi lǐ fàngzhe yí kuài bīng.
    - There is a piece of ice in the cup.
  - 冬天到了，河面结成仌(冬天到了，河面結成仌)。
    - Dōngtiān dào le, hémiàn jiéchéng bīng.
    - Winter has arrived, and the river surface has formed ice.
  - 他在仌上滑倒(他在仌上滑倒)。
    - Tā zài bīng shàng huádǎo.
    - He slipped on the ice.

## attempt; try; intend
### qǐtú
---
- **definition:** attempt; try; intend
- **pinyin:** qǐtú
- **components:**
  - 企
    - qǐ
    - stand on tiptoe; expect; plan; enterprise
  - 图(圖)
    - tú
    - diagram/map; picture; plan/seek; attempt
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 企 ‘to stand on tiptoe; plan; expect’ + 图/圖 ‘plan; scheme; attempt’ = intend/attempt (often with ulterior motive).
  - **interpretation:** Combines a sense of reaching/aspiring with planning or scheming, yielding ‘to attempt; intend’, commonly with a negative or clandestine undertone. Often contrasts with neutral 尝试/嘗試.
  - **simplification:** 圖 → 图: interior components were reduced to a simpler form to ease writing while preserving pronunciation and meaning; 企 unchanged.
- **examples:**
  - 他企图通过作弊获得高分(他企圖通過作弊獲得高分)。
    - Tā qǐtú tōngguò zuòbì huòdé gāofēn.
    - He attempted to get a high score by cheating.
  - 警方挫败了一伙人企图抢劫银行的计划(警方挫敗了一伙人企圖搶劫銀行的計劃)。
    - Jǐngfāng cuòbài le yì huǒ rén qǐtú qiǎngjié yínháng de jìhuà.
    - The police foiled a gang’s plan to rob a bank.
  - 他企图逃跑但被当场抓住(他企圖逃跑但被當場抓住)。
    - Tā qǐtú táopǎo dàn bèi dāngchǎng zhuāzhù.
    - He tried to run away but was caught on the spot.
### 企图(企圖) → 企
- **definition:** stand on tiptoe; expect; plan; enterprise
- **pinyin:** qǐ
- **components:**
  - 人
    - rén
    - person
  - 止
    - zhǐ
    - foot; stop
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** 人 (“person”) + 止 (“foot”) — a person standing on tiptoes.
  - **interpretation:** Combines a person and a foot to depict someone stretching upward on tiptoe, conveying the act of reaching or looking ahead. This concrete image extends to abstract senses like expecting or planning, and further to institutional meanings in words such as 企业.

  - 他踮起脚跟(他踮起腳跟)，企望远处的灯塔(企望遠處的燈塔)。
    - Tā diǎnqǐ jiǎogēn, qǐwàng yuǎnchù de dēngtǎ.
    - He stood on tiptoe, looking expectantly toward the distant lighthouse.
  - 这家企业正在扩大海外业务(這家企業正在擴大海外業務)。
    - Zhè jiā qǐyè zhèngzài kuòdà hǎiwài yèwù.
    - This enterprise is expanding its overseas operations.
  - 他企图用谎言掩盖事实(他企圖用謊言掩蓋事實)。

### 企图(企圖) → 企 → 人

- **pinyin:** rén
- **etymology:**

  - **description:** pictogram: side view of a standing man, highlighting an arm and a leg; left-side form 亻.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person in profile, with one stroke suggesting the torso/arm and the other the leg, hence the slightly splayed shape. In compounds it often appears as the left-hand form 亻 to mark human-related meaning; not to be confused with 彳.
- **examples:**

  - 我认识很多人(我認識很多人)。
    - Wǒ rènshi hěn duō rén.
    - I know many people.
  - 这里有三个人(這裡有三個人)。
    - Zhèlǐ yǒu sān gè rén.
    - There are three people here.
### 企图(企圖) → 企 → 止

    - Stop here; do not enter without invitation.
  - 药到病除，疼痛已止(藥到病除，疼痛已止)。
    - Yào dào bìng chú, téngtòng yǐ zhǐ.
    - With the right medicine, the illness is cured and the pain has stopped.

  - **interpretation:** An enclosure 囗 surrounds 啚, evoking a bounded territory, which extends to the sense of a map, picture, or plan of an area. In simplification, 啚 was replaced by the simpler 冬 to cut strokes while preserving the enclosed-area silhouette and meaning.

### 企图(企圖) → 图(圖) → 啚
- **definition:** remote areas; territory (early form of 鄙)
- **pinyin:** bǐ
- **components:**
  - 㐭
    - lǐn
    - granary; storehouse
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 囗 ‘city boundary’ + 㐭 ‘granary’; original form of 鄙.
  - **interpretation:** Enclosure for a city boundary pairs with a granary to picture a storehouse located beyond the walls, evoking the outskirts or countryside. By extension it came to mean the borderland or remote areas, and was later standardized as 鄙.
- **examples:**
  - 将军奉命巡边，远至啚地(將軍奉命巡邊，遠至啚地)。
    - Jiāng jūn fèng mìng xún biān, yuǎn zhì bǐ dì.
    - The general was ordered to patrol the borders, reaching the remote outlands.
  - 乡民在啚地屯粮，以备荒年(鄉民在啚地屯糧，以備荒年)。
    - Xiāng mín zài bǐ dì tún liáng, yǐ bèi huāng nián.
    - Villagers stockpiled grain in the outlands to prepare for years of famine.
  - 古籍记载，此处本为啚，后并入郡县(古籍記載，此處本為啚，後併入郡縣)。
    - Gǔ jí jì zǎi, cǐ chù běn wéi bǐ, hòu bìng rù jùn xiàn.
    - Ancient records note that this place was once the borderland, later incorporated into a commandery and county.
### 企图(企圖) → 图(圖) → 啚 → 㐭
- **definition:** granary; storehouse
- **pinyin:** lǐn
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a granary.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts the outline of an ancient grain store, likely with a container and supporting structure. Over time the strokes were stylized, but it still evokes a storage bin used for harvested grain.
- **examples:**
  - 村里有一座㐭(村裡有一座㐭)。
    - Cūn lǐ yǒu yī zuò lǐn.
    - There is a granary in the village.
  - 秋收时，农夫把稻谷搬进㐭(秋收時，農夫把稻穀搬進㐭)。
    - Qiūshōu shí, nóngfū bǎ dàogǔ bān jìn lǐn.
    - At harvest time, the farmers move the rice into the granary.
  - 他们把粮食储存在㐭里(他們把糧食儲存在㐭裡)。
    - Tāmen bǎ liángshi chǔcún zài lǐn lǐ.
    - They store the grain in the granary.
### 企图(企圖) → 图(圖) → 冬
- **definition:** winter
- **pinyin:** dōng
- **components:**
  - 夂
    - zhǐ
    - end
  - 日
    - rì
    - day; sun
  - 仌
    - bīng
    - ice
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound; phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** phonetic: 夂 (zhǐ, “end”) + semantic: 日 (“day”) or 仌 (“ice”); also analyzed as ideogrammic.
  - **interpretation:** Often read as depicting the end of the day/year or the presence of ice, evoking the cold season. The element 夂 supplies the sound (OC *tuːŋ, aligning with dōng) and also hints at finality.
- **examples:**
  - 冬天很冷(冬天很冷)。
    - Dōngtiān hěn lěng.
    - Winter is very cold.
  - 我喜欢冬至吃饺子(我喜歡冬至吃餃子)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan dōngzhì chī jiǎozi.
    - I like to eat dumplings at the Winter Solstice.
  - 冬季常下雪(冬季常下雪)。
    - Dōngjì cháng xiàxuě.
    - It often snows in winter.
### 企图(企圖) → 图(圖) → 冬 → 夂
- **definition:** end
- **pinyin:** zhǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a footprint pointing downward; cf. 夊 (variant). Shuowen: two legs (𠂊) + trailing stroke (㇏), ‘approach from behind’.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a downward-moving footprint, evoking slow, trailing motion or proceeding from behind. Traditional analyses also read it as two legs with a following stroke, matching the idea of approaching from the rear.
- **examples:**
  - 这个字的部首是夂(這個字的部首是夂)。
    - Zhège zì de bùshǒu shì zhǐ.
    - The radical of this character is 夂.
  - 夂部常表示行走或缓慢前进的意思(夂部常表示行走或緩慢前進的意思)。
    - Zhǐ bù cháng biǎoshì xíngzǒu huò huǎnmàn qiánjìn de yìsi.
    - The 夂 radical often conveys the idea of walking or moving slowly.
  - 在字典里，夂和夊要区分清楚(在字典裡，夂和夊要區分清楚)。
    - Zài zìdiǎn lǐ, zhǐ hé suī yào qūfēn qīngchu.
    - In dictionaries, 夂 and 夊 must be clearly distinguished.
### 企图(企圖) → 图(圖) → 冬 → 日
- **definition:** day; sun
- **pinyin:** rì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** The sun; a dot or line was added in the centre to distinguish it from similar graphs (e.g., 囗, early form of 丁); compare earlier forms with the Sun symbol (☉) and the Egyptian hieroglyph 𓇳.
  - **interpretation:** Early forms depicted a round sun, later marked with a central stroke or dot to prevent confusion with similar enclosed shapes. Its form closely echoes the solar symbol ☉ and parallels sun pictographs found in other ancient scripts.
- **examples:**
  - 我每天写日记(我每天寫日記)。
    - Wǒ měi tiān xiě rìjì.
    - I write in my diary every day.
  - 今天是星期日(今天是星期日)。
    - Jīntiān shì xīngqīrì.
    - Today is Sunday.
  - 旭日东升(旭日東昇)，海面一片金光(海面一片金光)。
    - Xùrì dōngshēng, hǎimiàn yí piàn jīnguāng.
    - As the rising sun ascends in the east, the sea gleams with golden light.
### 企图(企圖) → 图(圖) → 冬 → 仌
- **definition:** ice
- **pinyin:** bīng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Two blocks of ice; next to a character they are compressed and stylized as 冫 (unrelated to 氵 and 次).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts two chunks of ice, conveying the meaning directly through image. When used as a left-side component in other characters, it reduces to 冫, the ice radical, distinct from the water radical 氵.
- **examples:**
  - 杯子里放着一块仌(杯子裡放著一塊仌)。
    - Bēizi lǐ fàngzhe yí kuài bīng.
    - There is a piece of ice in the cup.
  - 冬天到了，河面结成仌(冬天到了，河面結成仌)。
    - Dōngtiān dào le, hémiàn jiéchéng bīng.
    - Winter has arrived, and the river surface has formed ice.
  - 他在仌上滑倒(他在仌上滑倒)。
    - Tā zài bīng shàng huádǎo.
    - He slipped on the ice.

## 尝试(嘗試)
---
## try; attempt
### chángshì
---
- **definition:** try; attempt
- **pinyin:** chángshì
- **components:**
  - 尝(嘗)
    - cháng
    - taste; try; experience; sample
  - 试(試)
    - shì
    - test; try; exam; experiment
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 嘗/尝 (taste; sample) + 試/试 (test; examine) = try; attempt
  - **interpretation:** Combines the idea of tasting with testing, emphasizing an initial or exploratory effort to see if something works. Common for trying methods, tasks, or approaches before committing.
  - **simplification:** Both characters were simplified to reduce stroke count and speed writing: 嘗→尝 by compressing interior components; 試→试 by changing 言 to 讠 and simplifying the right-side phonetic.
- **examples:**
  - 我想尝试这个方法(我想嘗試這個方法)。
    - Wǒ xiǎng chángshì zhège fāngfǎ.
    - I want to try this method.
  - 我们先尝试小规模测试，再决定下一步(我們先嘗試小規模測試，再決定下一步)。
    - Wǒmen xiān chángshì xiǎo guīmó cèshì, zài juédìng xià yī bù.
    - We will first try a small-scale test, then decide the next step.
  - 面对新的挑战，他愿意尝试不同的方法(面對新的挑戰，他願意嘗試不同的方法)。
    - Miànduì xīn de tiǎozhàn, tā yuànyì chángshì bùtóng de fāngfǎ.
    - Facing new challenges, he is willing to try different approaches.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 尝(嘗)
- **definition:** taste; try; experience; sample
- **pinyin:** cháng
- **components:**
  - 尚
    - shàng
    - still; yet; to esteem
  - 旨
    - zhǐ
    - purpose; decree; delicious
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 旨 ("tasty") + phonetic: 尚 (OC *djaŋ, *djaŋs)
  - **interpretation:** Meaning is guided by 旨, which signals deliciousness and the idea of tasting or trying flavors. 尚 contributes the pronunciation (cháng) and places it within the 尚 phonetic family.
  - **simplification:** Mainland simplification reduces the complex 嘗 to 尝 by compressing internal strokes and omitting extra elements, while preserving the 尚-like phonetic framework to keep the sound.
- **examples:**
  - 我想尝一尝这道菜(我想嘗一嘗這道菜)。
    - Wǒ xiǎng cháng yī cháng zhè dào cài.
    - I want to have a taste of this dish.
  - 他从未尝过失败(他從未嘗過失敗)。
    - Tā cóngwèi cháng guò shībài.
    - He has never experienced failure.
  - 请先尝一点，再决定买不买(請先嘗一點，再決定買不買)。
    - Qǐng xiān cháng yīdiǎn, zài juédìng mǎi bù mǎi.
    - Please sample a little first, then decide whether to buy.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 尝(嘗) → 尚
- **definition:** still; yet; to esteem
- **pinyin:** shàng
- **components:**
  - 八
    - bā
    - eight
  - 向
    - xiàng
    - toward; direction
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 八 + phonetic: 向
  - **interpretation:** Built with 八 as the semantic element and 向 as the phonetic, aligning with their Old Chinese readings. 八 gives a general semantic tag while 向 contributes the shàng sound; the overall layout is similar to 冋.
- **examples:**
  - 事情尚未结束(事情尚未結束)。
    - Shìqíng shàng wèi jiéshù.
    - The matter is not over yet.
  - 他尚年轻(他尚年輕)，需要指导(需要指導)。
    - Tā shàng niánqīng, xūyào zhǐdǎo.
    - He is still young and needs guidance.
  - 他崇尚简约的生活方式(他崇尚簡約的生活方式)。
    - Tā chóngshàng jiǎnyuē de shēnghuó fāngshì.
    - He esteems a simple lifestyle.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 尝(嘗) → 尚 → 八
- **definition:** eight
- **pinyin:** bā
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: two bent lines indicating “to divide”; later borrowed to mean “eight” via homophony (original sense now in 分, 別).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts two strokes diverging to suggest splitting or separation. Later became a rebus for the number eight because it shared the same sound, while the original sense lived on in 分 and 別. Not the “two hands” component found in other characters.
- **examples:**
  - 我有八本书(我有八本書)。
    - Wǒ yǒu bā běn shū.
    - I have eight books.
  - 她八岁了(她八歲了)。
    - Tā bā suì le.
    - She is eight years old.
  - 我买了八个苹果(我買了八個蘋果)。
    - Wǒ mǎi le bā gè píngguǒ.
    - I bought eight apples.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 尝(嘗) → 尚 → 向
- **definition:** toward; direction
- **pinyin:** xiàng
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** 宀 ‘house’ + 口 ‘mouth’; echoes in a place. Original form of 響; later borrowed to write 𠨍 (嚮). Similar to 冋.
  - **interpretation:** A mouth sounding under a roof evokes reverberation indoors, matching the sense later written as 響 ‘echo, sound’. By rebus borrowing the graph came to write 嚮 ‘to face, toward; direction’, which is the sense carried by modern 向.
- **examples:**
  - 我们向前走吧(我們向前走吧)。
    - Wǒmen xiàng qián zǒu ba.
    - Let’s walk forward.
  - 她向着窗户微笑(她向著窗戶微笑)。
    - Tā xiàngzhe chuānghu wēixiào.
    - She smiles toward the window.
  - 他向医院的方向跑去(他向醫院的方向跑去)。
    - Tā xiàng yīyuàn de fāngxiàng pǎo qù.
    - He ran in the direction of the hospital.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 尝(嘗) → 尚 → 向 → 口
- **definition:** mouth
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 尝(嘗) → 旨
- **definition:** purpose; decree; delicious
- **pinyin:** zhǐ
- **components:**
  - 匕
    - bǐ
    - spoon
  - 甘
    - gān
    - sweet; sweetness
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogrammic compound (會意 / 会意)
  - **description:** 會意: 匕 ‘spoon’ used to eat/drink something delicious (orig. 𠤔; cf. 嘗; unrelated to 皀). Shuowen: 形聲—phonetic 匕 + semantic 甘 (‘delicious’).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a spoon associated with tasting something flavorful, which extends to senses like “choice, fine” and later to “purport/aim” in texts. Traditional scholars also analyzed it as a phono-semantic spelling with 匕 supplying the sound and 甘 contributing the taste-related meaning.
- **examples:**
  - 我们此行旨在考察市场(我們此行旨在考察市場)。
    - Wǒmen cǐ xíng zhǐ zài kǎochá shìchǎng.
    - Our trip aims to survey the market.
  - 皇帝下达圣旨，命他回京(皇帝下達聖旨，命他回京)。
    - Huángdì xiàdá shèngzhǐ, mìng tā huí jīng.
    - The emperor issued an imperial decree, ordering him to return to the capital.
  - 报告要突出宗旨和要点(報告要突出宗旨和要點)。
    - Bàogào yào tūchū zōngzhǐ hé yàodiǎn.
    - The report should highlight the purpose and key points.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 尝(嘗) → 旨 → 匕
- **definition:** spoon
- **pinyin:** bǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – a spoon.
  - **interpretation:** A stylized drawing of a spoon with handle and bowl, later simplified into two strokes. Despite visual similarity to parts seen in 老, 眞, and 比, it developed independently and refers specifically to the utensil.
- **examples:**
  - 古人用匕进食(古人用匕進食)。
    - Gǔrén yòng bǐ jìnshí.
    - People in ancient times ate with spoons.
  - 他说“勺子”的古称是“匕”(他說「勺子」的古稱是「匕」)。
    - Tā shuō “sháozi” de gǔchēng shì “bǐ”.
    - He says the archaic term for a spoon is “匕”.
  - 出土的竹简上写有“匕”与“箸”(出土的竹簡上寫有「匕」與「箸」)。
    - Chūtǔ de zhújiǎn shàng xiě yǒu “bǐ” yǔ “zhù”.
    - The excavated bamboo slips bear the characters “匕” and “箸”.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 尝(嘗) → 旨 → 甘
- **definition:** sweet; sweetness
- **pinyin:** gān
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogram (指事)
  - **description:** Something sweet in an open mouth; original drawing 𠁿; original form of 含.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts an open mouth tasting sweetness, which directly yields the sense ‘sweet’. The early form 𠁿 later developed into 含 ‘to contain/hold in the mouth’, reflecting the same mouth-centered idea.
- **examples:**
  - 这水很甘甜(這水很甘甜)。
    - Zhè shuǐ hěn gāntián.
    - This water is very sweet.
  - 我们在田里种了甘蔗(我們在田裡種了甘蔗)。
    - Wǒmen zài tián lǐ zhòng le gānzhè.
    - We planted sugarcane in the field.
  - 他甘心为家人付出(他甘心為家人付出)。
    - Tā gānxīn wèi jiārén fùchū.
    - He is willing to make sacrifices for his family.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 试(試)
- **definition:** test; try; exam; experiment
- **pinyin:** shì
- **components:**
  - 言
    - yán
    - speech; words
  - 式
    - shì
    - pattern; style; formula
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 言 + phonetic: 式
  - **interpretation:** Combines the speech/words element 言 with the phonetic 式, indicating actions related to speaking or formal methods like trying or testing, while borrowing the shì sound from 式. The meaning aligns with evaluating or attempting through stated rules or procedures.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by replacing 言 with its simplified form 讠 while retaining the phonetic 式, reducing strokes but preserving sound and core meaning.
- **examples:**
  - 我想试一下新方法(我想試一下新方法)。
    - Wǒ xiǎng shì yíxià xīn fāngfǎ.
    - I want to try a new method.
  - 我们下周有一次数学考试(我們下週有一次數學考試)。
    - Wǒmen xià zhōu yǒu yí cì shùxué kǎoshì.
    - We have a math exam next week.
  - 科学家在实验中不断试错(科學家在實驗中不斷試錯)。
    - Kēxuéjiā zài shíyàn zhōng búduàn shìcuò.
    - Scientists keep testing by trial and error in experiments.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 试(試) → 言
- **definition:** speech; words
- **pinyin:** yán
- **components:**
  - 舌
    - shé
    - tongue
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** Ideogram: formed by adding a horizontal stroke to ancient 舌 to show tongue movement (speech). Shuowen erroneously treats it as phono-semantic: phonetic 䇂 (qiān) + semantic 口 (“mouth”).
  - **interpretation:** Built on 舌 (tongue), an added stroke marks motion, abstracting the act of speaking into a simple sign for “speech/words.” Later standardization added a dot on top and simplified the tongue shape, moving from a pictorial tongue to a conventional symbol for utterance. The Shuowen’s phono-semantic reading is a historical misinterpretation rather than the true origin.
- **examples:**
  - 请注意你的言语(請注意你的言語)。
    - Qǐng zhùyì nǐ de yányǔ.
    - Please mind your language.
  - 他发言很简短(他發言很簡短)。
    - Tā fāyán hěn jiǎnduǎn.
    - His remarks were brief.
  - 言行一致(言行一致)，方能取信于人(方能取信於人)。
    - Yán xíng yízhì, fāng néng qǔxìn yú rén.
    - Only by matching words with deeds can one gain others’ trust.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 试(試) → 言 → 舌
- **definition:** tongue
- **pinyin:** shé
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a forked tongue emerging upwards from a mouth (口)
  - **interpretation:** Graph depicts a tongue sticking up from an open mouth, with the fork hinting at the split tip. Later forms stylized the drawing, but the mouth element remains visible at the bottom; it is unrelated to 舍.
- **examples:**
  - 医生让他伸出舌头检查(醫生讓他伸出舌頭檢查)。
    - Yīshēng ràng tā shēnchū shétou jiǎnchá.
    - The doctor asked him to stick out his tongue for an exam.
  - 辣得我舌头发麻(辣得我舌頭發麻)。
    - Là de wǒ shétou fā má.
    - It’s so spicy that my tongue is numb.
  - 紧张得他舌头打结了(緊張得他舌頭打結了)。
    - Jǐnzhāng de tā shétou dǎjié le.
    - He was so nervous that his tongue got tied.
### 尝试(嘗試) → 试(試) → 式
- **definition:** pattern; style; formula
- **pinyin:** shì
- **components:**
  - 工
    - gōng
    - work; labor; craft
  - 弋
    - yì
    - to shoot; capture
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 工 (work) + phonetic: 弋
  - **interpretation:** 工 suggests ideas of work, construction, and method, pointing toward senses like pattern, standard, or procedure. 弋 supplied the sound, whose ancient pronunciation approximated that of 式; the graph later generalized to mean a fixed method, style, or formula.
- **examples:**
  - 这种教学方式很有效(這種教學方式很有效)。
    - Zhè zhǒng jiàoxué fāngshì hěn yǒuxiào.
    - This teaching method is very effective.

### 尝试(嘗試) → 试(試) → 式 → 工
- **definition:** work; labor; craft

### 尝试(嘗試) → 试(試) → 式 → 弋
- **definition:** to shoot; capture

## particle/exclamation
### a
---
- **definition:** particle/exclamation
- **pinyin:** a
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth; opening
  - 阿
    - ā
    - prefix (in names); ah
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic 口 (“mouth”) + phonetic 阿 (OC *qaːl).
  - **interpretation:** Mouth 口 signals a sound or speech-related function, while 阿 provides the phonetic clue to the reading. This aligns with its role as an interjection/particle uttered in speech, with 阿 hinting at the vowel-like sound value.
- **examples:**
  - 好美啊(好美啊)。
    - Hǎo měi a.
    - So beautiful!
  - 你来了啊(你來了啊)。
    - Nǐ lái le a.
    - Oh, you’ve come.
  - 别走啊(別走啊)。
    - Bié zǒu a.
    - Don’t go, please.
### 啊 → 口
- **definition:** mouth; opening
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 啊 → 阿
- **definition:** prefix (in names); ah
- **pinyin:** ā
- **components:**
  - 阜
    - fù
    - mound; hill; abundant
  - 可
    - kě
    - can; may; approve; acceptable
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 阜 + phonetic: 可 (OC *qaːl; 可 OC *kʰaːlʔ); originally ‘big mound’.
  - **interpretation:** Built with 阜 ‘mound’ conveying the idea of a landform, while 可 supplies the pronunciation. Its earliest sense was ‘large mound,’ later borrowed for phonetic use, giving rise to modern functions like a name/kinship prefix and in transliterations.
- **examples:**
  - 她是阿明的姐姐(她是阿明的姐姐)。
    - Tā shì Ā Míng de jiějie.
    - She is A-Ming’s older sister.
  - 孩子们都叫她阿姨(孩子們都叫她阿姨)。
    - Háizimen dōu jiào tā āyí.
    - The children all call her A-yi (auntie).
  - 我们学习阿拉伯文化(我們學習阿拉伯文化)。
    - Wǒmen xuéxí Ālābó wénhuà.
    - We study Arabic culture.
### 啊 → 阿 → 阜
- **definition:** mound; hill; abundant
- **pinyin:** fù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a row of steps on a hill; the steps remain visible in the upper part 𠂤; original form 𨸏.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts steps cut into a hillside, with the tiered strokes suggesting a path or terracing up a mound. This imagery underlies meanings like “mound” or “hill” and informs its use as the left-side radical in terrain-related characters.
- **examples:**
  - 这片土地多丘阜(這片土地多丘阜)。
    - Zhè piàn tǔdì duō qiūfù.
    - This stretch of land has many hills and mounds.
  - 村后有一座小山阜(村後有一座小山阜)。
    - Cūn hòu yǒu yī zuò xiǎo shānfù.
    - There is a small hill behind the village.
  - 工人沿着阜上的台阶缓缓登高(工人沿著阜上的台階緩緩登高)。
    - Gōngrén yánzhe fù shàng de táijiē huǎnhuǎn dēnggāo.
    - Workers slowly ascended along the steps on the hill.
### 啊 → 阿 → 可
- **definition:** can; may; approve; acceptable
- **pinyin:** kě
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth; opening
  - 丂
    - kǎo
    - exhale; breath
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic 口 + phonetic 丂 (OC *kʰluːʔ), with a reference to exhaled air; possibly originally “to sing”; cf. 訶 and 哥 (可 written twice).
  - **interpretation:** Mouth signals the domain of speech or breath, while 丂 supplies the sound and hints at exhalation. The sense likely began with vocalization and later extended to notions of permission or possibility, with related forms preserving the vocal or doubled structure.
- **examples:**
  - 我们可在这里休息(我們可在這裡休息)。
    - Wǒmen kě zài zhèlǐ xiūxi.
    - We may rest here.
  - 这个方案还可接受(這個方案還可接受)。
    - Zhège fāng'àn hái kě jiēshòu.
    - This plan is still acceptable.
  - 你这建议可行(你這建議可行)。
    - Nǐ zhè jiànyì kěxíng.
    - Your suggestion is feasible.
### 啊 → 阿 → 可 → 丂
- **definition:** exhale; breath
- **pinyin:** kǎo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** conflation
  - **description:** Conflation of several characters.
  - **interpretation:** Not a regular pictophonetic or ideogrammic formation; scribes merged features of multiple similar-looking graphs into a single standardized form. Its attested sense relates to troubled breathing, aligning its usage with notions of breath or obstruction rather than a clear semantic-phonetic decomposition.
- **examples:**
  - 奔跑过后(奔跑過後)，他丂得厉害(他丂得厲害)。
    - Bēnpǎo guòhòu, tā kǎo de lìhai.
    - After running, he was panting badly.
  - 山路陡峭(山路陡峭)，走几步就觉得丂(走幾步就覺得丂)。
    - Shānlù dǒuqiào, zǒu jǐ bù jiù juéde kǎo.
    - The mountain path is steep; after a few steps one feels out of breath.
  - 医生问他是否有丂和胸闷的症状(醫生問他是否有丂和胸悶的症狀)。
    - Yīshēng wèn tā shìfǒu yǒu kǎo hé xiōngmèn de zhèngzhuàng.
    - The doctor asked whether he had symptoms of panting and chest tightness.

  - **description:** 豆 (bean) + 豉 (fermented beans/condiment) = fermented soybeans (seasoning).

    - When steaming fish, adding a little douchi enhances the flavor.
  - 这道豆豉鸡很下饭(這道豆豉雞很下飯)。

### 豆豉 → 豆
- **definition:** bean; legumes; soybean; pulse

  - **description:** pictogram: some kind of container; later borrowed phonetically for ‘bean’; displaced Old Chinese 菽 (shū); unrelated to the bottom of 豊.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicted a lidded vessel or ceremonial container. Its sound was later borrowed to write the word for beans/legumes, supplanting the older term 菽, while the pictorial container form remained.

  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.

### 豆豉 → 豉

- **pinyin:** chǐ

  - **description:** semantic: 豆 'bean' + phonetic: 支; Shuowen orthodox form 𢻃 uses 尗 'legume; bean' instead of 豆.

### 豆豉 → 豉 → 支

### 豆豉 → 豉 → 支 → 又
- **definition:** hand; again
- **pinyin:** yòu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – a right hand; original form of 右; unrelated to 𠬤 (> 译). Often written as 彐 in many modern characters (e.g., 事, 聿, 雪, 急, 爭, 尹, 建).
  - **interpretation:** Early graphs depict a right hand, which later gave rise to 右 ‘right (side)’. The adverbial sense ‘again’ developed later by semantic extension. In many compounds a similar shape is written as 彐, but that is a graphic convention rather than a direct historical component here.

  - **description:** Originally a vertical stroke later crossed by 一; possibly a pictogram of a needle, rebus-borrowed for the word ‘ten’.

    - yī
    - one
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** ideogram: two parallel strokes; duplication of 一.
  - **interpretation:** Two horizontal lines directly depict the quantity ‘two’ as simple tally marks. It parallels 一 and 三 as incremental strokes, with historical 亖 for four, emphasizing straightforward counting by repetition.
- **examples:**
  - 今天是二月二日(今天是二月二日)。
    - Jīntiān shì èr yuè èr rì.
    - Today is February 2nd.
  - 我住在二楼(我住在二樓)。
    - Wǒ zhù zài èr lóu.
    - I live on the second floor.
  - 二加二等于四(二加二等於四)。
    - Èr jiā èr děngyú sì.
    - Two plus two equals four.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 豆 → 二 → 一
- **definition:** one
- **pinyin:** yī
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** a horizontal stroke, indicating the number 'one'.
  - **interpretation:** A single horizontal line visually represents the concept of oneness. As the simplest numeral, it set the pattern for 二 and 三 by repeating the stroke to show increasing quantity.
- **examples:**
  - 我只有一本书(我只有一本書)。
    - Wǒ zhǐ yǒu yì běn shū.
    - I only have one book.
  - 他一到就给我打电话(他一到就給我打電話)。
    - Tā yí dào jiù gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
    - As soon as he arrives, he calls me.
  - 一个问题都没有(一個問題都沒有)。
    - Yí gè wèntí dōu méiyǒu.
    - There isn’t a single problem.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 豆 → 口
- **definition:** mouth; opening
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 瓣
- **definition:** petal; segment; clove; half
- **pinyin:** bàn
- **components:**
  - 辡
    - biàn
    - dispute; distinguish
  - 瓜
    - guā
    - melon; gourd
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** phonetic 辡 + semantic 瓜 ("melon")
  - **interpretation:** 瓜 indicates the semantic field of melons/fruits, evoking seeds or slices. 辡 provides the sound and also hints at the idea of distinguishing or dividing, aligning with the meaning of a segment or part. The sense likely originated with melon seeds and broadened to petals, cloves, and other segments.
- **examples:**
  - 把蒜掰成几瓣(把蒜掰成幾瓣)。
    - Bǎ suàn bāi chéng jǐ bàn.
    - Break the garlic into a few cloves.
  - 橙子剥成一瓣一瓣(橙子剝成一瓣一瓣)。
    - Chéngzi bō chéng yí bàn yí bàn.
    - The orange is peeled into separate segments.
  - 花开了(花開了)，玫瑰有很多花瓣(玫瑰有很多花瓣)。
    - Huā kāi le, méiguī yǒu hěn duō huābàn.
    - The flowers have bloomed; a rose has many petals.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 瓣 → 辡
- **definition:** dispute; distinguish
- **pinyin:** biàn
- **components:**
  - 辛
    - xīn
    - bitter; punishment; chisel; eighth heavenly stem
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (會意)
  - **description:** Duplication of 辛: two chisels/knives marking prisoners, indicating recrimination/accusation; quarrel; debate.
  - **interpretation:** Doubling 辛 suggests two opposing instruments of punishment, evoking mutual accusation and contention. Pairing identical tools implies back-and-forth disputation and the act of distinguishing sides.
- **examples:**
  - 两人因旧怨辡不休(兩人因舊怨辡不休)。
    - Liǎng rén yīn jiùyuàn biàn bù xiū.
    - The two kept quarrelling over an old grudge.
  - 史书记载他们在廷中辡是非(史書記載他們在廷中辡是非)。
    - Shǐshū jìzǎi tāmen zài tíng zhōng biàn shìfēi.
    - Historical records note they disputed right and wrong in court.
  - 在训诂中，辡也指区分、辨别的过程(在訓詁中，辡也指區分、辨別的過程)。
    - Zài xùngǔ zhōng, biàn yě zhǐ qūfēn, biànbié de guòchéng.
    - In philology, biàn also refers to the process of distinguishing and discerning.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 瓣 → 辡 → 辛
- **definition:** bitter; punishment; chisel; eighth heavenly stem
- **pinyin:** xīn
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a tool (chisel/awl/spike) used to mark slaves and criminals; variants include 䇂 and 亲.
  - **interpretation:** An image of a sharp branding or engraving tool suggests cutting and marking, which later extended semantically to harsh, pungent qualities and to associated derivatives. It also serves as the name of the eighth Heavenly Stem in the traditional calendrical system.
- **examples:**
  - 这味药有点辛(這味藥有點辛)，不太适合孩子(不太適合孩子)。
    - Zhè wèi yào yǒudiǎn xīn, bú tài shìhé háizi.
    - This medicine tastes rather pungent/bitter and isn’t very suitable for children.
  - 你这几天工作很辛苦(你這幾天工作很辛苦)。
    - Nǐ zhè jǐ tiān gōngzuò hěn xīnkǔ.
    - You’ve been working very hard these last few days.
  - 今年的天干是辛(今年的天干是辛)，因此纪年写作辛丑(因此紀年寫作辛丑)。
    - Jīnnián de tiāngān shì xīn, yīncǐ jìnián xiězuò Xīnchǒu.
    - This year’s Heavenly Stem is Xin, so the year is written as Xinchou.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 瓣 → 瓜
- **definition:** melon; gourd
- **pinyin:** guā
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictograph: melon suspended by its vines.
  - **interpretation:** Originally a drawing of a hanging gourd with trailing vines, showing a round fruit with tendrils. The central strokes suggest the fruit, while the curved side strokes evoke the vine holding it up.
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢吃西瓜(我喜歡吃西瓜)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan chī xīguā.
    - I like to eat watermelon.
  - 南方的气候适合种瓜(南方的氣候適合種瓜)。
    - Nánfāng de qìhòu shìhé zhòng guā.
    - The southern climate is suitable for growing melons.
  - 这个瓜还没熟(這個瓜還沒熟)，先别摘(先別摘)。
    - Zhège guā hái méi shú, xiān bié zhāi.
    - This melon isn’t ripe yet; don’t pick it yet.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 酱(醬)
- **definition:** sauce; paste; thick soy/bean paste; condiment
- **pinyin:** jiàng
- **components:**
  - 酉
    - yǒu
    - wine; alcohol; the 10th Earthly Branch
  - 将(將)
    - jiāng
    - to lead; will; about to; take (coverb)
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 酉 + phonetic: 将(將)
  - **interpretation:** 酉 signals fermentation, alcoholic liquids, and by extension condiments, pointing to the meaning of a fermented sauce. 将/將 contributes the sound jiang and helps form the word family, while the overall structure keeps the flavor-related sense.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by replacing the phonetic 將 with its simplified form 将 (⿰丬夕), reducing strokes while preserving pronunciation and the original phono-semantic structure.
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢吃辣酱(我喜歡吃辣醬)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan chī làjiàng.
    - I like to eat spicy sauce.
  - 她把面条拌上豆瓣酱(她把麵條拌上豆瓣醬)。
    - Tā bǎ miàntiáo bàn shàng dòubànjiàng.
    - She tossed the noodles with doubanjiang.
  - 这道菜需要加一点酱油(這道菜需要加一點醬油)。
    - Zhè dào cài xūyào jiā yīdiǎn jiàngyóu.
    - This dish needs a little soy sauce.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 酱(醬) → 酉
- **definition:** wine; alcohol; the 10th Earthly Branch
- **pinyin:** yǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram (象形)
  - **description:** A wine vessel with a pointed bottom; original character for 酒.
  - **interpretation:** It depicts a pointed-bottom wine vessel used in antiquity, which had to be set in a stand or into the ground. As the original graph for 酒 ‘alcohol’, it became associated with fermented beverages and later designated the tenth Earthly Branch.
- **examples:**
  - 现在是酉时(現在是酉時)。
    - Xiànzài shì yǒu shí.
    - It is the You hour (around 5–7 p.m.).
  - 地支的第十位是酉(地支的第十位是酉)。
    - Dìzhī de dì shí wèi shì yǒu.
    - The tenth Earthly Branch is You.
  - 卯酉之间代表东西方向(卯酉之間代表東西方向)。
    - Mǎo-yǒu zhījiān dàibiǎo dōngxī fāngxiàng.
    - The span from Mao to You represents the east–west direction.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 酱(醬) → 将(將)
- **definition:** to lead; will; about to; take (coverb)
- **pinyin:** jiāng
- **components:**
  - 爿
    - qiáng
    - bed; small table
  - 肉
    - ròu
    - meat
  - 寸
    - cùn
    - inch; hand
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** phonetic 爿 + semantic 肉 (‘meat’) + semantic 寸 (‘hand’) — offering meat as tribute; ⺼ is on its side (resembles 夕), and 爿 may also suggest a cutting board/altar.
  - **interpretation:** A hand presenting meat suggests offering or bringing something forward, which underlies senses like ‘to lead/bring’ and later ‘will’. 爿 supplies the sound and can also evoke the board or altar on which the meat is set.
  - **simplification:** 将 streamlines 將 by keeping the phonetic 爿 as its left-side form 丬, reducing ⺼ to 夕, and dropping 寸, preserving pronunciation cues while cutting strokes.
- **examples:**
  - 我将去北京(我將去北京)。
    - Wǒ jiāng qù Běijīng.
    - I will go to Beijing.
  - 他将书放在桌上(他將書放在桌上)。
    - Tā jiāng shū fàng zài zhuō shàng.
    - He put the book on the table.
  - 他是将军(他是將軍)。
    - Tā shì jiāngjūn.
    - He is a general.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 酱(醬) → 将(將) → 爿
- **definition:** bed; small table
- **pinyin:** qiáng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a bed; original form of 牀; in 臧 it appears as a contracted form.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts the side view of a bedframe, hence its association with beds and flat furniture. It later ceased to be used as the standard word for ‘bed’ and survives mainly as a graphic element, including a shortened form inside 臧.
- **examples:**
  - 古文字里，爿像床的形状(古文字裡，爿像床的形狀)。
    - Gǔ wénzì lǐ, qiáng xiàng chuáng de xíngzhuàng.
    - In ancient scripts, 爿 resembles the shape of a bed.
  - 在臧字中，爿写成简略的形体(在臧字中，爿寫成簡略的形體)。
    - Zài Zāng zì zhōng, qiáng xiě chéng jiǎnlüè de xíngtǐ.
    - In the character 臧, 爿 is written in a contracted form.
  - 它原是牀字，后来分化为偏旁用在许多字里(它原是牀字，後來分化為偏旁用在許多字裡)。
    - Tā yuán shì chuáng zì, hòulái fēnhuà wéi piānpáng yòng zài xǔduō zì lǐ.
    - It was originally the character for ‘bed’ (牀) and later became a side component used in many characters.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 酱(醬) → 将(將) → 肉
- **definition:** meat
- **pinyin:** ròu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: ribs/section of meat; stylized as 月 when beside a phonetic, and as 𱼀 or 夕 inside some characters.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts the cross-section of flesh with ribs or a slice of meat. In compounds it often appears as a component written like 月, or reduced to 𱼀/夕, which can be mistaken for the moon component but actually signals ‘meat/flesh.’
- **examples:**
  - 我不吃猪肉(我不吃豬肉)。
    - Wǒ bù chī zhūròu.
    - I don't eat pork.
  - 这道菜肉很多，很鲜嫩(這道菜肉很多，很鮮嫩)。
    - Zhè dào cài ròu hěn duō, hěn xiānnèn.
    - This dish has a lot of meat; it's very tender.
  - 受伤后，他手上的肉裂开了(受傷後，他手上的肉裂開了)。
    - Shòushāng hòu, tā shǒushang de ròu liè kāi le.
    - After being injured, the flesh on his hand split open.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 酱(醬) → 将(將) → 寸
- **definition:** inch; hand
- **pinyin:** cùn
- **components:**
  - 又
    - yòu
    - again; (archaic) right hand
  - 一
    - yī
    - one
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram (指事)
  - **description:** Indicative of the position on the forearm where the pulse is palpated (寸口); the unit sense derives from the wrist-to-point distance. Compare 又, 手, 九, 爪.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a wrist/hand with a small mark showing the pulse point (寸口). From the short span used to locate that point, it generalized to the unit meaning “inch,” and as a component it often relates to hand/action or small measures.
- **examples:**
  - 这块木板只有三寸厚(這塊木板只有三寸厚)。
    - Zhè kuài mùbǎn zhǐyǒu sān cùn hòu.
    - This plank is only three inches thick.
  - 医生在我的寸口上按脉(醫生在我的寸口上按脈)。
    - Yīshēng zài wǒ de cùnkǒu shàng àn mài.
    - The doctor presses my pulse at the cun point.
  - 城市里寸土寸金(城市裡寸土寸金)。
    - Chéngshì lǐ cùn tǔ cùn jīn.
    - In the city, every inch of land is as precious as gold.
### 豆瓣酱(豆瓣醬) → 酱(醬) → 将(將) → 寸 → 又
- **definition:** again; (archaic) right hand
- **pinyin:** yòu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – a right hand; original form of 右; unrelated to 𠬤 (> 译). Often written as 彐 in many modern characters (e.g., 事, 聿, 雪, 急, 爭, 尹, 建).
  - **interpretation:** Early graphs depict a right hand, which later gave rise to 右 ‘right (side)’. The adverbial sense ‘again’ developed later by semantic extension. In many compounds a similar shape is written as 彐, but that is a graphic convention rather than a direct historical component here.
- **examples:**
  - 他又来了(他又來了)。
    - Tā yòu lái le.
    - He came again.
  - 请向右转(請向右轉)。
    - Qǐng xiàng yòu zhuǎn.
    - Please turn right.
  - 她又买了一本书(她又買了一本書)。
    - Tā yòu mǎi le yī běn shū.
    - She bought another book.

## 预定

## schedule; book
### yùdìng
---
- **definition:** schedule; book
- **pinyin:** yùdìng
- **components:**
  - 预(預)
    - yù
    - beforehand; in advance; anticipate; prepare
  - 定
    - dìng
    - set; decide; fix; certain
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 预(advance) + 定(set/fix) = set in advance → schedule; book.
  - **interpretation:** Indicates fixing or arranging something ahead of time. Commonly used for reservations, bookings, and scheduling.
  - **simplification:** Traditional 預定 → Simplified 预定: 預 was simplified to 预 by reducing the 頁 component (頁→页) and streamlining strokes; 定 is unchanged.
- **examples:**
  - 我们已经预定了明天的会议(我們已經預定了明天的會議)。
    - Wǒmen yǐjīng yùdìng le míngtiān de huìyì.
    - We have already scheduled tomorrow’s meeting.
  - 请帮我预定两张去上海的火车票(請幫我預定兩張去上海的火車票)。
    - Qǐng bāng wǒ yùdìng liǎng zhāng qù Shànghǎi de huǒchē piào.
    - Please help me book two train tickets to Shanghai.
  - 这家餐厅需要提前预定(這家餐廳需要提前預定)。
    - Zhè jiā cāntīng xūyào tíqián yùdìng.
    - This restaurant requires advance reservation.
### 预定 → 预(預)
- **definition:** beforehand; in advance; anticipate; prepare
- **pinyin:** yù
- **components:**
  - 予
    - yǔ
    - to give; I, me (archaic)
  - 页(頁)
    - yè
    - page; head
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 頁 + phonetic: 予
  - **interpretation:** Combines 予 as the sound component with 頁 ‘head/page’ as the meaning component, evoking ideas kept in mind or arranged ahead of time. The sense naturally extends to anticipating, preparing, and doing things in advance, while 予 carries the pronunciation.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by replacing the semantic component 頁 with its simplified form 页 to reduce strokes, following the common component change 頁→页 while retaining the phonetic 予.
- **examples:**
  - 我们提前预约了酒店(我們提前預約了酒店)。
    - Wǒmen tíqián yùyuē le jiǔdiàn.
    - We made a hotel reservation in advance.
  - 项目预计下个月完成(項目預計下個月完成)。
    - Xiàngmù yùjì xià gè yuè wánchéng.
    - The project is expected to be completed next month.
  - 出发前请做好预备(出發前請做好預備)。
    - Chūfā qián qǐng zuò hǎo yùbèi.
    - Please make preparations before setting out.
### 预定 → 预(預) → 予
- **definition:** to give; I, me (archaic)
- **pinyin:** yǔ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** rebus (phonetic loan)
  - **description:** Originally written as 呂 (OC *ɡ·raʔ), phonetically borrowed for “I; give”; later a 亅 was added as a distinguishing mark and the form was heavily stylized.
  - **interpretation:** Meaning was borrowed for its sound from 呂, a classic jiajie (phonetic loan). To avoid confusion with 呂, scribes appended a hook-like 亅 and the graph gradually simplified into its present shape.
- **examples:**
  - 依法予以处罚(依法予以處罰)。
    - Yīfǎ yǔyǐ chǔfá.
    - Punishment will be imposed according to the law.
  - 特此予以批准(特此予以批准)。
    - Tècǐ yǔyǐ pīzhǔn.
    - Hereby approved.
  - 对违规者予以警告(對違規者予以警告)。
    - Duì wéiguī zhě yǔyǐ jǐnggào.
    - A warning will be given to the violators.
### 预定 → 预(預) → 页(頁)
- **definition:** page; head
- **pinyin:** yè
- **components:**
  - 首
    - shǒu
    - head; first
  - 卩
    - jié
    - seal; kneeling person
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形): 首 + 卩 – head of a kneeling person, emphasising “head”.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a kneeling figure with the head highlighted, conveying the idea of 'head'. Later it was borrowed to write 'page/sheet' (via the popular form of 葉), while the original 'head' sense survives mainly in the radical and historical usage.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by adopting the cursive-derived graph 页 from 頁, reducing strokes for easier writing; meaning remained the same.
- **examples:**
  - 请翻到第三页(請翻到第三頁)。
    - Qǐng fān dào dì sān yè.
    - Please turn to page three.
  - 这本书的页码印错了(這本書的頁碼印錯了)。
    - Zhè běn shū de yèmǎ yìn cuò le.
    - The page numbers in this book were misprinted.
  - 这个网页打不开(這個網頁打不開)。
    - Zhège wǎngyè dǎ bù kāi.
    - This webpage won’t open.
### 预定 → 预(預) → 页(頁) → 首
- **definition:** head; first
- **pinyin:** shǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram of an animal head with a long mouth and horns; later standardized from 𩠐 with hair 巛 simplified to 丷.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a head seen from the front, with hair or mane on top and a protruding snout, which motivated the meaning ‘head’. As writing was regularized, the hair lines were reduced from 巛 to two dots 丷, and the sense broadened to ‘first’ in the sense of the foremost or leader.
- **examples:**
  - 她在比赛中夺得首位(她在比賽中奪得首位)。
    - Tā zài bǐsài zhōng duó dé shǒuwèi.
    - She took first place in the competition.
  - 首都北京历史悠久(首都北京歷史悠久)。

### 预定 → 预(預) → 页(頁) → 卩

  - **type:** pictogram

  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person kneeling in profile, with the bent leg and upright torso stylized into the compact form. As a component it often signals the seal/kneeling-person radical in right-side positions, without implying any relation to look-alikes such as 欠 or 女.
- **examples:**
  - 古文字里，"卩"像侧身跪着的人(古文字裡，"卩"像側身跪著的人)。

    - In ancient scripts, "卩" looks like a person kneeling in profile.
  - 在现代汉字中，卩多作部首，常放在字的右侧(在現代漢字中，卩多作部首，常放在字的右側)。
    - Zài xiàndài hànzì zhōng, jié duō zuò bùshǒu, cháng fàng zài zì de yòucè.
    - In modern Chinese characters, 卩 mostly functions as a radical, often placed on the right side.
  - 例如，即、却等字都含有卩(例如，即、卻等字都含有卩)。

### 预定 → 定

  - **description:** semantic: 宀 + phonetic: 正
  - **interpretation:** Shelter under a roof evokes the idea of something settled or established, while 正 provides the sound and hints at correctness or alignment. The combination suggests fixing or deciding so that matters are set in place and certain.
- **examples:**
  - 我们定了周末见面的时间(我們定了週末見面的時間)。

  - 价格已经定下来了(價格已經定下來了)。
    - Jiàgé yǐjīng dìng xiàlái le.

  - 他一定能按时到(他一定能按時到)。

### 预定 → 定 → 正
- **definition:** upright; correct; straight
- **pinyin:** zhèng
- **components:**
  - 丁
    - dīng
    - nail; fourth heavenly stem
  - 止
    - zhǐ
    - stop; foot
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic 止 (“foot”) + phonetic 丁; original form of 征 “to go on long campaign”.
  - **interpretation:** The graphic combines the idea of a foot (movement, marching) with 丁 to cue the sound zhèng. Early use referred to marching on campaign, with the top horizontal stroke reflecting a compressed 丁 in later forms. Meanings later shifted and broadened to senses like straight, proper, and correct.
- **examples:**
  - 他的为人很正(他的為人很正)。
    - Tā de wéirén hěn zhèng.

  - 请把画挂正(請把畫掛正)。

### 预定 → 定 → 正 → 丁
- **definition:** nail; fourth heavenly stem
- **pinyin:** dīng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形); different theories exist; see also 旦
  - **interpretation:** Often explained as the silhouette of a nail or spike, or a simple vertical post with a cap-like head. Its extremely simple form was later borrowed to label the fourth Heavenly Stem, and by administrative extension it came to denote an adult male for census/tax purposes.
- **examples:**
  - 甲乙丙丁是天干的前四位(甲乙丙丁是天干的前四位)。
    - Jiǎ Yǐ Bǐng Dīng shì tiāngān de qián sì wèi.
    - Jiǎ, Yǐ, Bǐng, Dīng are the first four of the Heavenly Stems.
  - 他出生在丁亥年(他出生在丁亥年)。
    - Tā chūshēng zài Dīnghài nián.

### 预定 → 定 → 正 → 止
- **definition:** stop; foot
- **pinyin:** zhǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a footprint pointing up (originally “foot”), later stylized as 龰; oracle forms show three toes and a sole.
  - **interpretation:** A footprint with toes pointing upward represents the foot. The sense broadened from the physical foot to the act of halting one’s step, hence “to stop”; the specific ‘toe’ meaning was preserved in 趾.
- **examples:**

  - 此处止步，非请勿入(此處止步，非請勿入)。
    - Cǐ chù zhǐbù, fēi qǐng wù rù.
    - Stop here; do not enter without invitation.
  - 药到病除，疼痛已止(藥到病除，疼痛已止)。
    - Yào dào bìng chú, téngtòng yǐ zhǐ.
    - With the right medicine, the illness is cured and the pain has stopped.

## scrambled eggs

    - chǎo

  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 炒 (stir-fry) + 蛋 (egg) = stir-fried egg(s) → scrambled eggs.
  - **interpretation:** Literally “stir-fried egg,” referring to eggs cooked by stir-frying, i.e., scrambled eggs. Often implies quickly cooked, soft curds and may include seasonings or add-ins.
- **examples:**

  - 他用小火慢慢炒蛋，口感更嫩(他用小火慢慢炒蛋，口感更嫩)。
    - Tā yòng xiǎohuǒ mànman chǎodàn, kǒugǎn gèng nèn.
    - He uses low heat to slowly scramble the eggs; the texture is more tender.
  - 这家餐厅的炒蛋很香，很滑(這家餐廳的炒蛋很香，很滑)。

### 炒蛋 → 炒
- **definition:** to stir-fry; to fry; to sauté; to speculate (market)
- **pinyin:** chǎo
- **components:**
  - 火
    - huǒ
    - fire
  - 少
    - shǎo
    - few; little
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 火 + phonetic: 少 (OC *hmjewʔ, *hmjews)
  - **interpretation:** 火 signals heat and cooking, pointing to actions involving frying or sautéing. 少 contributes the sound, and the sense extends metaphorically to ‘stir up’ in contexts like market speculation.
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢炒菜(我喜歡炒菜)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan chǎo cài.

  - 她把米饭炒成蛋炒饭(她把米飯炒成蛋炒飯)。
    - Tā bǎ mǐfàn chǎo chéng dànchǎofàn.
    - She fried the rice into egg fried rice.
  - 他喜欢在牛市里炒股(他喜歡在牛市裡炒股)。
    - Tā xǐhuan zài niúshì lǐ chǎogǔ.

### 炒蛋 → 炒 → 火
- **definition:** fire
- **pinyin:** huǒ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram (象形)
  - **description:** Pictographic representation of a fire; written as 灬 at the bottom of characters; original form retained in 灸; related shapes in 叟 (top, original) and 赤 (bottom).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a flame with tongues of fire rising upward, which is why the shape is simple and angular. When used as a component at the bottom of other characters, it appears as the variant 灬 to fit the overall structure.
- **examples:**
  - 火很旺，别靠太近(火很旺，別靠太近)。
    - Huǒ hěn wàng, bié kào tài jìn.
    - The fire is blazing; don't get too close.
  - 厨房着火了，马上打电话报警(廚房著火了，馬上打電話報警)。

### 炒蛋 → 炒 → 少
- **definition:** few; little
- **pinyin:** shǎo
- **components:**
  - 小
    - xiǎo
    - small; little
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: four dots (like grains of sand) indicating “a few, a little”; phonetically borrowed from 小 (“small,” depicted by three dots). Unrelated to 步.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicted a small cluster of dots, evoking a tiny quantity such as grains of sand, hence the sense “few; little.” Its form and sound link to 小, which also shows small marks and means “small,” but it is not connected to 步/歲 despite visual resemblance.
- **examples:**
  - 我们的时间很少(我們的時間很少)。

    - Jīntiān lái de rén hěn shǎo.

  - 他话不多(他話不多)，笑得也少(笑得也少)。

  - **description:** pictogram: three small marks/dots representing smallness; later the dots elongated; Shuowen misread it as 会意: 八 + 丨.
  - **interpretation:** Three short strokes portray a tiny object or the idea of smallness. As the script evolved, the dots were drawn as short lines, which led to the later but incorrect analysis of 八 plus 丨.
- **examples:**

    - Xiǎo wèntí yě yào zhòngshì.

  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: foot 止 with a leg/thigh on top; similar to 足; unrelated to the bottom of 是 (which is 止 on oracle bones).
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicts a leg above a foot, producing an image close to 足. It was later extended and borrowed as a measure word for bolts of cloth, while its resemblance to the lower part of 是 is accidental since that part derives from 止.

### 炒蛋 → 蛋 → 疋 → 止
- **definition:** to stop; pictograph of a foot
- **pinyin:** zhǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a footprint pointing up (originally “foot”), later stylized as 龰; oracle forms show three toes and a sole.
  - **interpretation:** A footprint with toes pointing upward represents the foot. The sense broadened from the physical foot to the act of halting one’s step, hence “to stop”; the specific ‘toe’ meaning was preserved in 趾.
- **examples:**
  - 请立即停止前进(請立即停止前進)。
    - Qǐng lìjí tíngzhǐ qiánjìn.
    - Please stop advancing immediately.
  - 此处止步，非请勿入(此處止步，非請勿入)。
    - Cǐ chù zhǐbù, fēi qǐng wù rù.

  - 药到病除，疼痛已止(藥到病除，疼痛已止)。

### 炒蛋 → 蛋 → 虫
- **definition:** insect; worm
- **pinyin:** chóng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a snake; later borrowed for 蟲/虫 (worms, insects). Traditional 蟲: ideogrammic compound, triplication of 虫.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicting a snake, the graph was later repurposed to write ‘insect/bug/worm’, while the traditional form 蟲 triples 虫 to suggest many small crawlies. The original snake sense was reassigned to 虺.
  - **simplification:** Borrowing and stroke reduction: simplified Chinese replaced 蟲 with the older, simpler 虫 to reduce strokes and standardize usage; the snake meaning moved to 虺.
