## wonton
### húntun
---
- **definition:** wonton
- **pinyin:** húntun
- **components:**
  - 馄(餛)
    - hún
    - wonton; wonton dumpling
  - 饨(飩)
    - tún
    - wonton; dumpling; small soup dumpling
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 馄(餛) + 饨(飩) = wonton (stuffed dumpling).
  - **interpretation:** A traditional Chinese stuffed dumpling often served in broth; both characters are semantic-phonetic with the “food” radical. The second syllable is commonly neutralized in Mandarin (hún·tun), and folk etymology sometimes connects it with 混沌 (hùndùn) due to similar sound.
  - **simplification:** Both characters simplified the food radical 飠 to 饣 while retaining their phonetic parts (昆, 屯), yielding 馄 and 饨.
- **examples:**
  - 我最爱吃馄饨(我最愛吃餛飩)。
    - Wǒ zuì ài chī húntun.
    - I love eating wontons the most.
  - 这家店的馄饨皮很薄(這家店的餛飩皮很薄)，汤也很鲜(湯也很鮮)。
    - Zhè jiā diàn de húntun pí hěn báo, tāng yě hěn xiān.
    - The wonton wrappers at this shop are very thin, and the soup is very fresh.
  - 他点了一碗虾仁馄饨(他點了一碗蝦仁餛飩)，配上海青菜(配上海青菜)。
    - Tā diǎn le yì wǎn xiārén húntun, pèi Shànghǎi qīngcài.
    - He ordered a bowl of shrimp wontons, served with Shanghai greens.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛)
- **definition:** wonton; wonton dumpling
- **pinyin:** hún
- **components:**
  - 食
    - shí
    - food; to eat
  - 昏
    - hūn
    - dusk; dark; confused
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 饣/飠 (“food”) + phonetic: 昏 (hūn).
  - **interpretation:** Food component signals something edible, while 昏 guides the pronunciation toward hún. Together they label a food item, later specialized to mean wonton dumplings.
  - **simplification:** The food component was simplified from 飠 to 饣; the phonetic 昏 was unchanged.
- **examples:**
  - 我想吃一碗馄饨(我想吃一碗餛飩)。
    - Wǒ xiǎng chī yì wǎn húntun.
    - I want to eat a bowl of wontons.
  - 这家店的馄饨特别鲜美(這家店的餛飩特別鮮美)。
    - Zhè jiā diàn de húntun tèbié xiānměi.
    - The wontons at this shop are especially delicious.
  - 他点了馄饨汤和小笼包(他點了餛飩湯和小籠包)。
    - Tā diǎnle húntun tāng hé xiǎo lóng bāo.
    - He ordered wonton soup and soup dumplings.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食
- **definition:** food; to eat
- **pinyin:** shí
- **components:**
  - 亼
    - jí
    - gather; assemble
  - 艮
    - gèn
    - Gen trigram; to stop; stubborn
  - 皀
    - jí
    - fragrant; smell (orig. bowl on a stand)
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a mouth (亼) over a bowl of rice on a stand (皀); current form is 亼 + 艮. Shuowen: phono-semantic (phonetic 亼 + semantic 皀; see 𠊊).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a mouth positioned above a bowl of food, directly evoking the act of eating and the idea of provisions. The later graphic shift made the lower pictorial bowl resemble 艮, but its original element was 皀, and the similarity to 艮 or 良 is incidental.
- **examples:**
  - 这家店的食物很新鲜(這家店的食物很新鮮)。
    - Zhè jiā diàn de shíwù hěn xīnxiān.
    - The food at this shop is very fresh.
  - 按时饮食有助于健康(按時飲食有助於健康)。
    - Ànshí yǐnshí yǒu zhù yú jiànkāng.
    - Eating on schedule helps with health.
  - 这种蘑菇不可食用(這種蘑菇不可食用)。
    - Zhè zhǒng mógu bù kě shíyòng.
    - This kind of mushroom is not edible.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 亼
- **definition:** gather; assemble
- **pinyin:** jí
- **components:**
  - 入
    - rù
    - enter
  - 一
    - yī
    - one
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
  - 今
    - jīn
    - now; today
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (會意)
  - **description:** 入 + 一; alternatively an upside-down 口 + archaic 今.
  - **interpretation:** Combining 'enter' with 'one' sketches things converging toward a single point, evoking the idea of gathering. Another analysis sees a mouth shape with an early form of 今, suggesting a call or order that brings people together.
- **examples:**
  - 我们在广场集合(我們在廣場集合)。
    - Wǒmen zài guǎngchǎng jíhé.
    - We assemble in the square.
  - 收到通知后，大家很快聚集起来(收到通知後，大家很快聚集起來)。
    - Shōudào tōngzhī hòu, dàjiā hěn kuài jùjí qǐlái.
    - After receiving the notice, everyone quickly gathered.
  - 会议开始前，请先集中注意力(會議開始前，請先集中注意力)。
    - Huìyì kāishǐ qián, qǐng xiān jízhōng zhùyìlì.
    - Before the meeting begins, please focus your attention.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 亼 → 入
- **definition:** enter
- **pinyin:** rù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** Ideogram (指事) — an arrowhead indicating “to enter”; compare 人.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicts a pointed wedge or arrowhead moving inward, conveying the action of going in. Its form resembles 人 but with a tighter, inward-tapering shape that emphasizes entry rather than a person.
- **examples:**
  - 禁止入内(禁止入內)。
    - jìnzhǐ rùnèi.
    - No entry.
  - 他考入北京大学(他考入北京大學)。
    - tā kǎorù běijīng dàxué.
    - He was admitted to Peking University.
  - 请入座(請入座)。
    - qǐng rùzuò.
    - Please be seated.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 亼 → 一
- **definition:** one
- **pinyin:** yī
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** a horizontal stroke, indicating the number 'one'.
  - **interpretation:** A single horizontal line visually represents the concept of oneness. As the simplest numeral, it set the pattern for 二 and 三 by repeating the stroke to show increasing quantity.
- **examples:**
  - 我只有一本书(我只有一本書)。
    - Wǒ zhǐ yǒu yì běn shū.
    - I only have one book.
  - 他一到就给我打电话(他一到就給我打電話)。
    - Tā yí dào jiù gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
    - As soon as he arrives, he calls me.
  - 一个问题都没有(一個問題都沒有)。
    - Yí gè wèntí dōu méiyǒu.
    - There isn’t a single problem.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 亼 → 口
- **definition:** mouth
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 亼 → 今
- **definition:** now; today
- **pinyin:** jīn
- **components:**
  - 曰
    - yuē
    - to say; to speak
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth; opening
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** Inverted 曰 (“to speak”), yielding a form like 亼 with an added bottom stroke; the inverted ‘mouth’ signifies ‘not to speak’. Another view: it depicts something in the mouth (cf. 噤, 吟), with 含 as a derivative of the original word.
  - **interpretation:** Graphically portrays the idea of speech being suppressed or something held in the mouth. The form was later associated by sound with the temporal word meaning ‘now; today’, which became the primary modern sense.
- **examples:**
  - 今后我们要多联系(今後我們要多聯繫)。
    - Jīnhòu wǒmen yào duō liánxì.
    - From now on we should stay in touch more.
  - 从今以后再也不迟到(從今以後再也不遲到)。
    - Cóng jīn yǐhòu zàiyě bù chídào.
    - From today onward I will never be late again.
  - 如今很少有人写信了(如今很少有人寫信了)。
    - Rújīn hěn shǎo yǒu rén xiě xìn le.
    - Nowadays few people write letters.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 亼 → 今 → 曰
- **definition:** to say; to speak
- **pinyin:** yuē
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
  - 一
    - yī
    - one
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** mouth 口 with word/breath 一 coming out
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a mouth with a short stroke representing breath or words emerging, conveying the act of speaking. Used as a verb of quotation in Classical Chinese and seen in fixed patterns like 子曰.
- **examples:**
  - 子曰：“学而时习之(子曰：「學而時習之)，不亦说乎？”(不亦說乎？」)
    - Zǐ yuē: “Xué ér shí xí zhī, bù yì yuè hū?”
    - Confucius said, “Is it not a pleasure to learn and practice at due times?”
  - 甲曰：“可以。”乙曰：“不可。”(甲曰：「可以。」乙曰：「不可。」)
    - Jiǎ yuē: “Kěyǐ.” Yǐ yuē: “Bùkě.”
    - A said, “Okay.” B said, “No.”
  - 此地名曰桃花源(此地名曰桃花源)。
    - Cǐ dì míng yuē Táohuāyuán.
    - This place is called Peach Blossom Spring.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 艮
- **definition:** Gen trigram; to stop; stubborn
- **pinyin:** gèn
- **components:**
  - 目
    - mù
    - eye
  - 人
    - rén
    - person
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** 目 “eye” + 人 “person” — a person looking back, expressing disobedience/limit.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts someone turning the eye back, evoking hesitation, checking oneself, or being held at a boundary. This image underlies senses like stopping, restraint, and the Gen trigram’s stillness.
- **examples:**
  - 《易经》中的艮卦象征止与山(《易經》中的艮卦象徵止與山)。
    - «Yìjīng» zhōng de Gèn guà xiàngzhēng zhǐ yǔ shān.
    - In the Yijing, the Gen trigram symbolizes stopping and the mountain.
  - 他猛然回头而止步(他猛然回頭而止步)，正合艮之意(正合艮之意)。
    - Tā měngrán huítóu ér zhǐbù, zhèng hé Gèn zhī yì.
    - He suddenly looked back and stopped, which perfectly matches the sense of gen.
  - 风水罗盘上有艮位(風水羅盤上有艮位)，代表东北方(代表東北方)。
    - Fēngshuǐ luópán shàng yǒu Gèn wèi, dàibiǎo dōngběi fāng.
    - On a feng shui compass there is the Gen position, representing the northeast.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 艮 → 目
- **definition:** eye
- **pinyin:** mù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: human eye, now rotated 90 degrees; compare Egyptian hieroglyph 𓁹
  - **interpretation:** Originally a drawing of an eye; in regular script it was turned to fit the square writing frame. As a component, its variant 罒 often signals “net” in compounds like 罪 or 罗, while 目 itself usually carries the sense of seeing or an item/entry.
- **examples:**
  - 我们的目标很明确(我們的目標很明確)。
    - Wǒmen de mùbiāo hěn míngquè.
    - Our goal is very clear.
  - 请查看目录(請查看目錄)。
    - Qǐng chákàn mùlù.
    - Please check the table of contents.
  - 你的目的是什么(你的目的是什麼)？
    - Nǐ de mùdì shì shénme?
    - What is your purpose?
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 艮 → 人
- **definition:** person
- **pinyin:** rén
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: side view of a standing man, highlighting an arm and a leg; left-side form 亻.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person in profile, with one stroke suggesting the torso/arm and the other the leg, hence the slightly splayed shape. In compounds it often appears as the left-hand form 亻 to mark human-related meaning; not to be confused with 彳.
- **examples:**
  - 他是一个很好的人(他是一個很好的人)。
    - Tā shì yí gè hěn hǎo de rén.
    - He is a very good person.
  - 我认识很多人(我認識很多人)。
    - Wǒ rènshi hěn duō rén.
    - I know many people.
  - 这里有三个人(這裡有三個人)。
    - Zhèlǐ yǒu sān gè rén.
    - There are three people here.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 食 → 皀
- **definition:** fragrant; smell (orig. bowl on a stand)
- **pinyin:** jí
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a bowl of rice on a stand; part of the radical 食; unrelated to 良 and 旨.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a rice bowl set on a stand, an early food-related image that later associated with smell and fragrance in usage. Also serves historically as a component within the food radical 食, without any etymological link to 良 or 旨 despite visual resemblance.
- **examples:**
  - 此酒甚皀，香气四溢(此酒甚皀，香氣四溢)。
    - Cǐ jiǔ shèn jí, xiāngqì sìyì.
    - This wine is very fragrant, and its aroma spreads everywhere.
  - 花开时院中皆皀(花開時院中皆皀)。
    - Huā kāi shí yuàn zhōng jiē jí.
    - When the flowers bloom, the courtyard is filled with fragrance.
  - 皀字本为象形，像托座上的饭碗(皀字本為象形，像托座上的飯碗)。
    - Jí zì běn wéi xiàngxíng, xiàng tuōzuò shàng de fànwǎn.
    - The graph was originally pictographic, resembling a rice bowl on a stand.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 昏
- **definition:** dusk; dark; confused
- **pinyin:** hūn
- **components:**
  - 氏
    - shì
    - clan; family name
  - 氐
    - dī
    - Di (ancient people); base; foundation
  - 日
    - rì
    - sun; day
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** ideogrammic: 氏 + 日 (sun), or abbreviated 氐 + 日 (sun) — the sun lowering/going down.
  - **interpretation:** Combines 日 ‘sun’ with 氏/氐 suggesting something low or descending, picturing the sun sinking toward the horizon. From the scene of twilight come senses of darkening and, metaphorically, mental dimness or confusion.
- **examples:**
  - 天色将昏(天色將昏)，我们赶紧回家(我們趕緊回家)。
    - Tiānsè jiāng hūn, wǒmen gǎnjǐn huíjiā.
    - It’s getting dark; let’s hurry home.
  - 他脑子发昏(他腦子發昏)，做事糊里糊涂(做事糊裡糊塗)。
    - Tā nǎozi fā hūn, zuòshì húlihútú.
    - He felt muddle‑headed and did things confusedly.
  - 傍晚天空渐昏(傍晚天空漸昏)，路上灯光亮起(路上燈光亮起)。
    - Bàngwǎn tiānkōng jiàn hūn, lùshang dēngguāng liàngqǐ.
    - At dusk the sky darkens, and the streetlights come on.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 昏 → 氏
- **definition:** clan; family name
- **pinyin:** shì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形): various interpretations—e.g., a man bending to sow, a clan emblem on a stick, the root of a tree, a spoon/mallet; in bronze forms a dot inside the vertical stroke later became a horizontal 一 and the vertical stroke curved.
  - **interpretation:** A schematic mark or figure associated with lineage, hence the meanings ‘clan; family name’. Over time, scribal changes converted the inner dot to a short horizontal and rounded the main stroke, yielding the modern shape.
- **examples:**
  - 在族谱中，他被记为李氏(在族譜中，他被記為李氏)。
    - Zài zúpǔ zhōng, tā bèi jì wéi Lǐshì.
    - In the genealogy, he is recorded as of the Li clan.
  - 考古报告提到出土木简上写有“某氏”(考古報告提到出土木簡上寫有「某氏」)。
    - Kǎogǔ bàogào tí dào chūtǔ mùjiǎn shang xiě yǒu “mǒu shì”.
    - An archaeological report mentions wooden slips inscribed with “a certain clan.”
  - 古代区分姓与氏，姓为本，氏为支(古代區分姓與氏，姓為本，氏為支)。
    - Gǔdài qūfēn xìng yǔ shì, xìng wéi běn, shì wéi zhī.
    - In antiquity, xìng and shì were distinguished: xìng was the root lineage, shì the branch.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 昏 → 氐
- **definition:** Di (ancient people); base; foundation
- **pinyin:** dī
- **components:**
  - 氏
    - shì
    - clan; family; surname
  - 一
    - yī
    - one
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形): 氏 (“clan; bowing figure”) + 一; 氏 with an empty circle (then a line, now a line or point) beneath, perhaps a bowing figure sowing or a tree root marked at the bottom.
  - **interpretation:** A depiction of 氏 with a mark below, evoking either a bowed person engaged in sowing or the base of a tree with a mark. This imagery aligns with senses related to “base/foundation” and later provided a phonetic/graphic source for related characters.
- **examples:**
  - 氐人是中国古代的一个民族(氐人是中國古代的一個民族)。
    - Dīrén shì Zhōngguó gǔdài de yí gè mínzú.
    - The Di were an ancient ethnic group in China.
  - 历史文献中常提到氐族在西北的活动(歷史文獻中常提到氐族在西北的活動)。
    - Lìshǐ wénxiàn zhōng cháng tí dào Dīzú zài xīběi de huódòng.
    - Historical texts often mention the activities of the Di people in the northwest.
  - 字形像氏下加一点，或指树根之底(字形像氏下加一點，或指樹根之底)。
    - Zìxíng xiàng shì xià jiā yì diǎn, huò zhǐ shùgēn zhī dǐ.
    - The form looks like shi with an added dot below, possibly indicating the base of a tree.
### 馄饨 → 馄(餛) → 昏 → 日
- **definition:** sun; day
- **pinyin:** rì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** The sun; a dot or line was added in the centre to distinguish it from similar graphs (e.g., 囗, early form of 丁); compare earlier forms with the Sun symbol (☉) and the Egyptian hieroglyph 𓇳.
  - **interpretation:** Early forms depicted a round sun, later marked with a central stroke or dot to prevent confusion with similar enclosed shapes. Its form closely echoes the solar symbol ☉ and parallels sun pictographs found in other ancient scripts.
- **examples:**
  - 我每天写日记(我每天寫日記)。
    - Wǒ měi tiān xiě rìjì.
    - I write in my diary every day.
  - 今天是星期日(今天是星期日)。
    - Jīntiān shì xīngqīrì.
    - Today is Sunday.
  - 旭日东升(旭日東昇)，海面一片金光(海面一片金光)。
    - Xùrì dōngshēng, hǎimiàn yí piàn jīnguāng.
    - As the rising sun ascends in the east, the sea gleams with golden light.
### 馄饨 → 饨(飩)
- **definition:** wonton; dumpling; small soup dumpling
- **pinyin:** tún
- **components:**
  - 屯
    - tún
    - to station; camp; gather
  - 食
    - shí
    - food; to eat
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 饣/食 (“food”) + phonetic: 屯 (tún).
  - **interpretation:** Food/meal semantic component marks a culinary sense. The phonetic 屯 supplies the pronunciation tún and ties it to its phonetic family. In usage it refers to wontons, a kind of small dumpling commonly eaten in soup.
  - **simplification:** Traditional 飩 was simplified by reducing the semantic component 食 to the radical form 饣; the phonetic component 屯 was kept unchanged.
- **examples:**
  - 今天中午我点了一碗馄饨汤(今天中午我點了一碗餛飩湯)。
    - Jīntiān zhōngwǔ wǒ diǎn le yì wǎn húntun tāng.
    - I ordered a bowl of wonton soup for lunch.
  - 上海的馄饨皮薄馅多(上海的餛飩皮薄餡多)，味道很鲜(味道很鮮)。
    - Shànghǎi de húntun pí báo xiàn duō, wèidào hěn xiān.
    - Shanghai-style wontons have thin wrappers and lots of filling, and they taste very fresh.
  - 他喜欢在家自己包馄饨(他喜歡在家自己包餛飩)，配上香醋和辣油(配上香醋和辣油)。
    - Tā xǐhuān zài jiā zìjǐ bāo húntun, pèi shàng xiāngcù hé làyóu.
    - He likes to wrap wontons at home, served with aromatic vinegar and chili oil.
### 馄饨 → 饨(飩) → 屯
- **definition:** to station; camp; gather
- **pinyin:** tún
- **components:**
  - 屮
    - chè
    - sprout
  - 一
    - yī
    - one; horizontal line
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a plant sprout (屮) with a dot in the middle, later transformed into a horizontal line; compare the top component of 春 in early forms.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a young shoot pushing up through the soil, with an added stroke emphasizing the sprout. The dot evolved into a horizontal line over time, paralleling early forms seen atop 春.
- **examples:**
  - 军队在边境屯兵(軍隊在邊境屯兵)。
    - Jūnduì zài biānjìng tún bīng.
    - The army garrisoned troops at the border.
  - 他在松花江边的一个小屯长大(他在松花江邊的一個小屯長大)。
    - Tā zài Sōnghuājiāng biān de yí gè xiǎo tún zhǎngdà.
    - He grew up in a small hamlet by the Songhua River.
  - 朝廷在北地实行屯田(朝廷在北地實行屯田)。
    - Cháotíng zài běidì shíxíng tún tián.
    - The court implemented garrison-farming in the north.
### 馄饨 → 饨(飩) → 屯 → 屮
- **definition:** sprout
- **pinyin:** chè
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形): a sprout emerging from the ground.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a shoot pushing up through the soil: the horizontal stroke suggests the ground, while the central vertical stroke and side strokes evoke the stem and small leaves. Early oracle and bronze forms closely resemble a budding plant.
- **examples:**
  - 在甲骨文中，屮表示植物的嫩芽(在甲骨文中，屮表示植物的嫩芽)。
    - Zài jiǎgǔwén zhōng, chè biǎoshì zhíwù de nènyá.
    - In oracle script, 屮 represents a plant sprout.
  - 春天雨后，田里冒出许多嫩芽，像“屮”的形状(春天雨後，田裡冒出許多嫩芽，像「屮」的形狀)。
    - Chūntiān yǔ hòu, tián lǐ mào chū xǔduō nènyá, xiàng “chè” de xíngzhuàng.
    - After spring rains, many sprouts emerge in the fields, resembling the shape of “屮”.
  - 屮在古文字中象征嫩芽与新生(屮在古文字中象徵嫩芽與新生)。
    - Chè zài gǔ wénzì zhōng xiàngzhēng nènyá yǔ xīnshēng.
    - In ancient scripts, 屮 symbolizes sprouts and new life.

## Chinese cabbage
### dàbáicài
---
- **definition:** Chinese cabbage
- **pinyin:** dàbáicài
- **components:**
  - 大
    - dà
    - big;great;major;eldest
  - 白
    - bái
    - white;pure;clear;plain
  - 菜
    - cài
    - vegetable;greens;dish;cuisine
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 大(big) + 白(white) + 菜(vegetable) = big white vegetable (Chinese cabbage).
  - **interpretation:** Literally names the pale, elongated cabbage common in North China; contrasts with 小白菜, which refers to bok choy/Shanghai pak choi.
- **examples:**
  - 我买了一颗大白菜(我買了一顆大白菜)。
    - Wǒ mǎi le yì kē dà báicài.
    - I bought a head of Chinese cabbage.
  - 大白菜可以炒着吃(大白菜可以炒著吃)，也可以做泡菜(也可以做泡菜)。
    - Dà báicài kěyǐ chǎo zhe chī, yě kěyǐ zuò pàocài.
    - Chinese cabbage can be stir-fried, and it can also be made into pickles.
  - 北方冬天常腌大白菜(北方冬天常醃大白菜)。
    - Běifāng dōngtiān cháng yān dà báicài.
    - In northern China, people often pickle Chinese cabbage in winter.
### 大白菜 → 大
- **definition:** big;great;major;eldest
- **pinyin:** dà
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a person facing forward; original form of 夫, later phonetically borrowed for “big”.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicts a human figure viewed from the front, not necessarily with exaggerated outstretched arms. The graph was later borrowed to write the word pronounced dà ‘big’, while 夫 specialized for ‘man’. The modern shape still evokes a torso with two legs and an arm stroke.
- **examples:**
  - 这个房间很大(這個房間很大)。
    - Zhège fángjiān hěn dà.
    - This room is very big.
  - 他是我们家最大的孩子(他是我們家最大的孩子)。
    - Tā shì wǒmen jiā zuì dà de háizi.
    - He is the eldest child in our family.
  - 大学开学了(大學開學了)。
    - Dàxué kāixué le.
    - The university term has begun.
### 大白菜 → 白
- **definition:** white;pure;clear;plain
- **pinyin:** bái
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram; proposed depictions include a thumb (original of 拇/擘) or an acorn, with “white” from the acorn’s inside; unrelated to the top of 原.
  - **interpretation:** Most scholars treat it as a simple drawing, perhaps of a thumb or an acorn. If the acorn view is right, the sense “white” comes from the pale interior revealed when the shell is opened. Over time it generalized to the color and to notions of purity and clarity.
- **examples:**
  - 这件衣服很白(這件衣服很白)。
    - Zhè jiàn yīfu hěn bái.
    - This piece of clothing is very white.
  - 他为人清白(他為人清白)。
    - Tā wéirén qīngbái.
    - He is upright and innocent.
  - 合同白纸黑字，不能反悔(合同白紙黑字，不能反悔)。
    - Hétong bái zhǐ hēi zì, bùnéng fǎnhuǐ.
    - The contract is in black and white; you can’t go back on it.
### 大白菜 → 菜
- **definition:** vegetable;greens;dish;cuisine
- **pinyin:** cài
- **components:**
  - 采
    - cǎi
    - to pick; gather
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 艹 (“grass; plant”) + phonetic: 采.
  - **interpretation:** The grass/plant radical signals a meaning related to vegetation and edible greens. 采 supplies the sound for cài and also hints at the idea of picking or gathering plants.
- **examples:**
  - 我去市场买菜(我去市場買菜)。
    - Wǒ qù shìchǎng mǎi cài.
    - I’m going to the market to buy vegetables.
  - 这道菜很辣(這道菜很辣)。
    - Zhè dào cài hěn là.
    - This dish is very spicy.
  - 我喜欢川菜(我喜歡川菜)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan Chuāncài.
    - I like Sichuan cuisine.
### 大白菜 → 菜 → 采
- **definition:** to pick; gather
- **pinyin:** cǎi
- **components:**
  - 爪
    - zhǎo
    - claw; hand
  - 木
    - mù
    - wood; tree
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (会意)
  - **description:** semantic: 爫 ‘hand’ + 木 ‘tree’ (hand picking from a tree); current form reflects composition 2.
  - **interpretation:** A hand reaching down over a tree conveys the act of plucking fruit or leaves. The form standardized as 爫 over 木, preserving the idea of gathering by hand.
  - **simplification:** Traditional for this sense is 採; PRC simplified 採 → 采 by dropping the hand radical 扌, reusing the older base form and reducing strokes.
- **examples:**
  - 春天农民到茶园采茶叶(春天農民到茶園採茶葉)。
    - Chūntiān nóngmín dào cháyuán cǎi cháyè.
    - In spring, farmers go to the tea gardens to pick tea leaves.
  - 孩子们在树林里采蘑菇(孩子們在樹林裡採蘑菇)。
    - Háizimen zài shùlín lǐ cǎi mógu.
    - The children gather mushrooms in the woods.
  - 她清晨去山上采野花(她清晨去山上採野花)。
    - Tā qīngchén qù shān shang cǎi yěhuā.
    - She goes to the mountains at dawn to pick wildflowers.
### 大白菜 → 菜 → 采 → 爪
- **definition:** claw; hand
- **pinyin:** zhǎo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – a hand grabbing from above (earlier forms from the side); compare 手, 寸, 九.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts an overhead view of fingers curved downward in a grasping motion, originally representing a human hand. The sense broadened to include animal claws, which is why it now names claws/talons and functions as the ‘claw’ radical in many compounds.
- **examples:**
  - 猫的爪子很锋利(貓的爪子很鋒利)。
    - Māo de zhuǎzi hěn fēnglì.
    - A cat’s claws are very sharp.
  - 我买了一包鸡爪当小吃(我買了一包雞爪當小吃)。
    - Wǒ mǎile yī bāo jīzhuǎ dāng xiǎochī.
    - I bought a bag of chicken feet as a snack.
  - 地上有一串小狗的爪印(地上有一串小狗的爪印)。
    - Dì shàng yǒu yī chuàn xiǎogǒu de zhuǎyìn.
    - There is a trail of puppy paw prints on the ground.
### 大白菜 → 菜 → 采 → 木
- **definition:** wood; tree
- **pinyin:** mù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram (象形)
  - **description:** a tree: branches on top, roots on the bottom (more visible in earlier forms).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a tree with spreading branches above and roots below, as seen clearly in early scripts. The vertical stroke is the trunk, while the short horizontal strokes became stylized limbs and roots in the regular form.
- **examples:**
  - 这张桌子是木头做的(這張桌子是木頭做的)。
    - Zhè zhāng zhuōzi shì mùtou zuò de.
    - This table is made of wood.
  - 山上长满了树木(山上長滿了樹木)。
    - Shān shang zhǎng mǎn le shùmù.
    - The mountainside is covered with trees.
  - 木材被运到工厂加工(木材被運到工廠加工)。
    - Mùcái bèi yùn dào gōngchǎng jiāgōng.
    - The timber was transported to the factory for processing.

## Chinese broccoli
### gàilán
---
- **definition:** Chinese broccoli
- **pinyin:** gàilán
- **components:**
  - 芥
    - jiè
    - mustard; mustard greens; tiny; trifle
  - 蓝(藍)
    - lán
    - blue; indigo; indigo plant; azure
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 芥(mustard/Brassica) + 蓝/藍(indigo/blue; used in plant names) = a Brassica leafy vegetable (Chinese broccoli).
  - **interpretation:** Names a Brassica oleracea cultivar with thick stems and broad leaves, common in southern Chinese cuisines. In Mandarin it’s pronounced jièlán; the form gàilán reflects Cantonese gai3 laan4.
  - **simplification:** 蓝 is the simplified form of 藍; 芥 is unchanged. (A variant writes it as 芥兰/芥蘭 in some regions.)
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢清炒芥蓝(我喜歡清炒芥藍)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan qīngchǎo jièlán.
    - I like stir-frying Chinese broccoli with just oil and garlic.
  - 粤菜里，芥蓝常和牛肉一起炒(粵菜裡，芥藍常和牛肉一起炒)。
    - Yuècài lǐ, jièlán cháng hé niúròu yìqǐ chǎo.
    - In Cantonese cuisine, Chinese broccoli is often stir-fried with beef.
  - 市场上新鲜的芥蓝很脆甜(市場上新鮮的芥藍很脆甜)。
    - Shìchǎng shang xīnxiān de jièlán hěn cuìtián.
    - Fresh Chinese broccoli at the market is crisp and sweet.
### 芥蓝 → 芥
- **definition:** mustard; mustard greens; tiny; trifle
- **pinyin:** jiè
- **components:**
  - 艸
    - cǎo
    - grass; plant
  - 介
    - jiè
    - between; introduce; shell/armor
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 艸 ‘grass, plant’ + phonetic: 介 (OC *kreːds).
  - **interpretation:** Combines the grass semantic component to mark it as a plant with 介 providing the sound. The compound originally referred to a type of plant, which fits the meanings related to mustard and mustard greens.
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢在饺子里蘸点芥末(我喜歡在餃子裡蘸點芥末)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan zài jiǎozi lǐ zhàn diǎn jièmò.
    - I like dipping my dumplings in a bit of mustard.
  - 秋天我们种芥菜做腌菜(秋天我們種芥菜做醃菜)。
    - Qiūtiān wǒmen zhòng jiècài zuò yāncài.
    - In autumn we plant mustard greens to make pickles.
  - 这点损失不过是芥子之微，不必在意(這點損失不過是芥子之微，不必在意)。
    - Zhè diǎn sǔnshī bùguò shì jièzǐ zhī wēi, búbì zàiyì.
    - This loss is trivial, as tiny as a mustard seed—don’t worry about it.
### 芥蓝 → 芥 → 艸
- **definition:** grass; plant
- **pinyin:** cǎo
- **components:**
  - 屮
    - chè
    - sprout; shoot
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – grass blades; duplication of 屮 (“grass”).
  - **interpretation:** Shows multiple blades sprouting by doubling 屮, evoking a patch of grass or vegetation. The graphic later served as the grass radical atop many characters and relates to the original top of 春 in its early form (萅).
  - **simplification:** As a component it was standardized to the two-stroke 艹 for stroke economy and print clarity; as an independent word in modern Chinese, it is replaced by 草.
- **examples:**
  - 古文中常写作“艸”，今作“草”(古文中常寫作「艸」，今作「草」。)
    - Gǔwén zhōng cháng xiězuò “cǎo”, jīn zuò “cǎo”.
    - In classical texts it was often written as “艸”, while today it is written “草”.
  - 春天里，草木茂盛(春天裡，艸木茂盛)。
    - Chūntiān lǐ, cǎomù màoshèng.
    - In spring, plants flourish.
  - 农夫割草(農夫割艸)。
    - Nóngfū gē cǎo.
    - The farmer cuts the grass.
### 芥蓝 → 芥 → 艸 → 屮
- **definition:** sprout; shoot
- **pinyin:** chè
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形): a sprout emerging from the ground.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a shoot pushing up through the soil: the horizontal stroke suggests the ground, while the central vertical stroke and side strokes evoke the stem and small leaves. Early oracle and bronze forms closely resemble a budding plant.
- **examples:**
  - 在甲骨文中，屮表示植物的嫩芽(在甲骨文中，屮表示植物的嫩芽)。
    - Zài jiǎgǔwén zhōng, chè biǎoshì zhíwù de nènyá.
    - In oracle script, 屮 represents a plant sprout.
  - 春天雨后，田里冒出许多嫩芽，像“屮”的形状(春天雨後，田裡冒出許多嫩芽，像「屮」的形狀)。
    - Chūntiān yǔ hòu, tián lǐ mào chū xǔduō nènyá, xiàng “chè” de xíngzhuàng.
    - After spring rains, many sprouts emerge in the fields, resembling the shape of “屮”.
  - 屮在古文字中象征嫩芽与新生(屮在古文字中象徵嫩芽與新生)。
    - Chè zài gǔ wénzì zhōng xiàngzhēng nènyá yǔ xīnshēng.
    - In ancient scripts, 屮 symbolizes sprouts and new life.
### 芥蓝 → 芥 → 介
- **definition:** between; introduce; shell/armor
- **pinyin:** jiè
- **components:**
  - 人
    - rén
    - person
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogrammic compound (會意 / 会意)
  - **description:** 人 (“person”) + two marks encompassing, indicating “in between”; folk etymology interprets the two marks as armor parts.
  - **interpretation:** Shows a person situated between two boundaries, yielding the core sense of being in the middle or between. By extension it developed uses like introduce (to place someone between parties) and was later associated with armor/shell through folk or literary reinterpretation.
- **examples:**
  - 这条河介于两座城市之间(這條河介於兩座城市之間)。
    - Zhè tiáo hé jièyú liǎng zuò chéngshì zhī jiān.
    - This river lies between two cities.
  - 老师介绍了新同学(老師介紹了新同學)。
    - Lǎoshī jièshào le xīn tóngxué.
    - The teacher introduced the new student.
  - 贝类的介壳很坚硬(貝類的介殼很堅硬)。
    - Bèilèi de jièké hěn jiānyìng.
    - The shells of mollusks are very hard.
### 芥蓝 → 芥 → 介 → 人
- **definition:** person
- **pinyin:** rén
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: side view of a standing man, highlighting an arm and a leg; left-side form 亻.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person in profile, with one stroke suggesting the torso/arm and the other the leg, hence the slightly splayed shape. In compounds it often appears as the left-hand form 亻 to mark human-related meaning; not to be confused with 彳.
- **examples:**
  - 他是一个很好的人(他是一個很好的人)。
    - Tā shì yí gè hěn hǎo de rén.
    - He is a very good person.
  - 我认识很多人(我認識很多人)。
    - Wǒ rènshi hěn duō rén.
    - I know many people.
  - 这里有三个人(這裡有三個人)。
    - Zhèlǐ yǒu sān gè rén.
    - There are three people here.
### 芥蓝 → 蓝(藍)
- **definition:** blue; indigo; indigo plant; azure
- **pinyin:** lán
- **components:**
  - 监(監)
    - jiān/jiàn
    - to supervise; to inspect; prison
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 艸 ‘grass’ + phonetic: 監; simplified from 藍 (監 → 监).
  - **interpretation:** Grass radical points to a plant, aligning with the indigo plant used to make blue dye. 監 provides the sound, and its simplified form 监 preserves the phonetic cue while reducing strokes.
  - **simplification:** The phonetic component 監 was simplified to 监 to reduce stroke count and align with the general simplification of 監→监, while keeping the grass semantic.
- **examples:**
  - 我最喜欢蓝色(我最喜歡藍色)。
    - Wǒ zuì xǐhuan lánsè.
    - I like blue the most.
  - 她穿着一件蓝裙子(她穿著一件藍裙子)。
    - Tā chuānzhe yí jiàn lán qúnzi.
    - She is wearing a blue skirt.
  - 天空一片湛蓝(天空一片湛藍)。
    - Tiānkōng yī piàn zhànlán.
    - The sky is a deep blue.
### 芥蓝 → 蓝(藍) → 监(監)
- **definition:** to supervise; to inspect; prison
- **pinyin:** jiān/jiàn
- **components:**
  - 卧(臥)
    - wò
    - to lie down
  - 皿
    - mǐn
    - dish; vessel
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (會意)
  - **description:** 臥 ("a person with an emphasized eye") + 皿 ("container"): a person looking into a container; simplified from 監 (臣 → 〢), compare 览.
  - **interpretation:** Shows someone leaning over and peering into a vessel, evoking careful inspection and oversight. This visual idea motivates meanings like supervising, examining, and by extension the place of confinement where supervision is enforced.
  - **simplification:** Reduced the top 臣 element to two vertical strokes (〢) to cut strokes and mirror the pattern seen in 览, easing handwriting.
- **examples:**
  - 他在监狱工作(他在監獄工作)。
    - Tā zài jiānyù gōngzuò.
    - He works in a prison.
  - 政府加强监管市场(政府加強監管市場)。
    - Zhèngfǔ jiāqiáng jiānguǎn shìchǎng.
    - The government is strengthening market supervision.
  - 警察监视嫌犯(警察監視嫌犯)。
    - Jǐngchá jiānshì xiánfàn.
    - The police monitor the suspect.
### 芥蓝 → 蓝(藍) → 监(監) → 卧(臥)
- **definition:** to lie down
- **pinyin:** wò
- **components:**
  - 臣
    - chén
    - minister; subject
  - 人
    - rén
    - person
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (会意)
  - **description:** Ideogrammic compound: 臣 (“eye pointing down”) + 人 (“person”).
  - **interpretation:** Combines a downward-looking eye with a person to picture someone in a reclining posture. The imagery evokes closed or lowered eyes over a person at rest, hence the sense of lying down.
  - **simplification:** Top component 臣 was streamlined in the simplified form 卧 to reduce strokes while preserving the overall posture-with-person idea; 人 below was retained.
- **examples:**
  - 他因病卧床(他因病臥床)。
    - Tā yīn bìng wò chuáng.
    - He is bedridden due to illness.
  - 请你卧倒(請你臥倒)，医生要检查(醫生要檢查)。
    - Qǐng nǐ wòdǎo, yīshēng yào jiǎnchá.
    - Please lie down; the doctor needs to examine you.
  - 猫喜欢侧卧在阳光下(貓喜歡側臥在陽光下)。
    - Māo xǐhuān cèwò zài yángguāng xià.
    - The cat likes to lie on its side in the sun.
### 芥蓝 → 蓝(藍) → 监(監) → 卧(臥) → 臣
- **definition:** minister; subject
- **pinyin:** chén
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a vertical eye looking downward; the 'eye' sense appears when used as a component (e.g., 臨, 監).
  - **interpretation:** A downward-looking eye evokes subordination or being overseen, which broadened to meanings like servant, subject, and minister. As a component it retains the sense of viewing or overseeing, especially of looking down from above.
- **examples:**
  - 皇帝召见群臣(皇帝召見群臣)。
    - Huángdì zhàojiàn qúnchén.
    - The emperor summoned the courtiers.
  - 他被任命为财政大臣(他被任命為財政大臣)。
    - Tā bèi rènmìng wéi cáizhèng dàchén.
    - He was appointed finance minister.
  - 在古代，臣子必须对君主尽忠(在古代，臣子必須對君主盡忠)。
    - Zài gǔdài, chénzǐ bìxū duì jūnzhǔ jìn zhōng.
    - In ancient times, subjects had to be loyal to their ruler.
### 芥蓝 → 蓝(藍) → 监(監) → 皿
- **definition:** dish; vessel
- **pinyin:** mǐn
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: empty container/chalice; handles conjoined in the modern form
  - **interpretation:** Depicts an empty vessel, like a bowl or chalice seen from above. Over time, the side handles merged into the compact dish shape used today.
- **examples:**
  - 这些玻璃器皿需要小心清洗(這些玻璃器皿需要小心清洗)。
    - Zhèxiē bōli qìmǐn xūyào xiǎoxīn qīngxǐ.
    - These glass vessels need to be cleaned carefully.
  - 科学家把样本放进培养皿观察(科學家把樣本放進培養皿觀察)。
    - Kēxuéjiā bǎ yàngběn fàngjìn péiyǎng mǐn guānchá.
    - The scientist placed the sample in a Petri dish to observe it.
  - 厨房里的器皿摆放得很整齐(廚房裡的器皿擺放得很整齊)。
    - Chúfáng lǐ de qìmǐn bǎifàng de hěn zhěngqí.
    - The kitchen vessels are arranged very neatly.

## 扫码
---
## scan a code
### sǎomǎ
---
- **definition:** scan a code
- **pinyin:** sǎomǎ
- **components:**
  - 扫(掃)
    - sǎo
    - to sweep; to scan; to brush over; to eliminate
  - 码(碼)
    - mǎ
    - code; number; yard (unit); to stack/pile
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 扫(sweep/scan) + 码(code/number) = scan a code.
  - **interpretation:** Common in modern tech and commerce for scanning QR or barcodes, often with a smartphone. Usually implies actions like payment, login, registration, or access verification.
  - **simplification:** Both characters were simplified in the PRC to reduce strokes: 掃→扫 by simplifying the right component; 碼→码 by using the simplified 马 and a simpler left form, matching widespread digital-era usage.
- **examples:**
  - 请先扫码支付(請先掃碼支付)。
    - Qǐng xiān sǎomǎ zhīfù.
    - Please scan the code to pay first.
  - 进门前(進門前)，保安让我扫码登记(保安讓我掃碼登記)。
    - Jìn mén qián, bǎo'ān ràng wǒ sǎomǎ dēngjì.
    - Before entering, the guard asked me to scan the code to register.
  - 打开相机对准二维码(打開相機對準二維碼)，轻轻一扫就能完成登录(輕輕一掃就能完成登錄)。
    - Dǎkāi xiàngjī duìzhǔn èrwéimǎ, qīngqīng yī sǎo jiù néng wánchéng dēnglù.
    - Open the camera and aim at the QR code; a quick scan can complete the login.
### 扫码 → 扫(掃)
- **definition:** to sweep; to scan; to brush over; to eliminate
- **pinyin:** sǎo
- **components:**
  - 手
    - shǒu
    - hand
  - 帚
    - zhǒu
    - broom
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (会意)
  - **description:** semantic: 手 ‘hand’ + 帚 ‘broom’.
  - **interpretation:** A hand holding a broom conveys the action of sweeping. The meaning derives purely from combining two meaningful parts, which later extended to senses like scanning or brushing over.
  - **simplification:** Simplified from 掃 by removing the 冖 and 巾 elements within 帚 to reduce strokes, paralleling patterns like 妇 from 婦.
- **examples:**
  - 我在客厅扫地(我在客廳掃地)。
    - Wǒ zài kètīng sǎo dì.
    - I sweep the floor in the living room.
  - 清洁工每天打扫办公室(清潔工每天打掃辦公室)。
    - Qīngjié gōng měitiān dǎsǎo bàngōngshì.
    - The cleaner tidies up the office every day.
  - 用手机扫描二维码(用手機掃描二維碼)。
    - Yòng shǒujī sǎomiáo èrwéimǎ.
    - Use a phone to scan the QR code.
### 扫码 → 扫(掃) → 手
- **definition:** hand
- **pinyin:** shǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: hand and fingers; five digits, with top stroke as bent middle finger and horizontal strokes as fingers.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a human hand: the top stroke stands for a bent middle finger, and the horizontal strokes stand for the remaining fingers. In contrast to related claw forms that show three digits, it consistently presents a five‑finger human hand.
- **examples:**
  - 我手上有伤口(我手上有傷口)。
    - Wǒ shǒu shàng yǒu shāngkǒu.
    - I have a wound on my hand.
  - 请举起右手(請舉起右手)。
    - Qǐng jǔ qǐ yòu shǒu.
    - Please raise your right hand.
  - 他动手做饭(他動手做飯)。
    - Tā dòngshǒu zuò fàn.
    - He started cooking by hand.
### 扫码 → 扫(掃) → 帚
- **definition:** broom
- **pinyin:** zhǒu
- **components:**
  - 聿
    - yù
    - brush; to write
  - 巾
    - jīn
    - cloth; towel
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a broom with bristles on top and a tied handle below; modern form resembles roughly 肀 + 冖 + 巾 (top like 聿/肀/彐).
  - **interpretation:** Originally a drawn image of a broom—bristles above and a bound handle below. Later forms made the top look like components such as 聿/肀/彐 over a cloth-like 巾, but these are visual resemblances rather than functional phonetic or semantic parts.
- **examples:**
  - 她拿起扫帚(她拿起掃帚)，开始打扫院子(開始打掃院子)。
    - Tā ná qǐ sào zhǒu, kāi shǐ dǎ sǎo yuàn zi.
    - She picked up the broom and began to clean the yard.
  - 他用扫帚把地上的落叶扫成一堆(他用掃帚把地上的落葉掃成一堆)。
    - Tā yòng sào zhǒu bǎ dì shàng de luò yè sǎo chéng yī duī.
    - He used a broom to sweep the fallen leaves on the ground into a pile.
  - 请把扫帚放回墙角(請把掃帚放回牆角)。
    - Qǐng bǎ sào zhǒu fàng huí qiáng jiǎo.
    - Please put the broom back in the corner.
### 扫码 → 扫(掃) → 帚 → 聿
- **definition:** brush; to write
- **pinyin:** yù
- **components:**
  - 又
    - yòu
    - again; right hand
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram or ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** hand (又) holding a brush (𰀁); originally referred to 筆 ‘writing brush’; later jiajie (rebus) for 聿 ‘thereupon’.
  - **interpretation:** A right hand gripping a writing brush vividly depicts the act of writing. Its graph first named the brush itself and was later borrowed to represent the adverbial sense “thereupon/then” in classical usage.
- **examples:**
  - 古人以聿书竹帛(古人以聿書竹帛)。
    - Gǔrén yǐ yù shū zhúbó.
    - The ancients used a brush to write on bamboo and silk.
  - 他执聿临池练字(他執聿臨池練字)。
    - Tā zhí yù línchí liànzì.
    - He holds the brush by the water to practice calligraphy.
  - 史官持聿记事(史官持聿記事)。
    - Shǐguān chí yù jìshì.
    - The scribe holds a brush to record events.
### 扫码 → 扫(掃) → 帚 → 聿 → 又
- **definition:** again; right hand
- **pinyin:** yòu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – a right hand; original form of 右; unrelated to 𠬤 (> 译). Often written as 彐 in many modern characters (e.g., 事, 聿, 雪, 急, 爭, 尹, 建).
  - **interpretation:** Early graphs depict a right hand, which later gave rise to 右 ‘right (side)’. The adverbial sense ‘again’ developed later by semantic extension. In many compounds a similar shape is written as 彐, but that is a graphic convention rather than a direct historical component here.
- **examples:**
  - 他又来了(他又來了)。
    - Tā yòu lái le.
    - He came again.
  - 请向右转(請向右轉)。
    - Qǐng xiàng yòu zhuǎn.
    - Please turn right.
  - 她又买了一本书(她又買了一本書)。
    - Tā yòu mǎi le yī běn shū.
    - She bought another book.
### 扫码 → 扫(掃) → 帚 → 巾
- **definition:** cloth; towel
- **pinyin:** jīn
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – hanging piece of cloth.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a cloth draped and hanging, with the long stroke as the edge and the shorter strokes suggesting the folds. The image conveys a towel or piece of fabric suspended from a line or rod.
- **examples:**
  - 我用湿毛巾擦脸(我用濕毛巾擦臉)。
    - Wǒ yòng shī máojīn cā liǎn.
    - I use a wet towel to wipe my face.
  - 她戴着红色的头巾(她戴著紅色的頭巾)。
    - Tā dài zhe hóngsè de tóujīn.
    - She is wearing a red headscarf.
  - 冬天出门要围上围巾(冬天出門要圍上圍巾)。
    - Dōngtiān chūmén yào wéi shàng wéijīn.
    - In winter, put on a scarf before going out.
### 扫码 → 码(碼)
- **definition:** code; number; yard (unit); to stack/pile
- **pinyin:** mǎ
- **components:**
  - 石
    - shí
    - stone
  - 马(馬)
    - mǎ
    - horse
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 石 (stone; rock) + phonetic: 馬 (OC *mraːʔ).
  - **interpretation:** Combines the stone semantic element with the phonetic 馬 to convey the reading mǎ. The stone component suggests concreteness or stacking (as in piling stones), while later senses like “number/code” and the unit “yard” developed through phonetic extension.
  - **simplification:** Replaced the phonetic component 馬 with its simplified form 马 while retaining 石; a right-side phonetic simplification.
- **examples:**
  - 请把代码发给我(請把代碼發給我)。
    - Qǐng bǎ dàimǎ fā gěi wǒ.
    - Please send me the code.
  - 一码等于三英尺(一碼等於三英尺)。
    - Yī mǎ děngyú sān yīngchǐ.
    - One yard equals three feet.
  - 把箱子码整齐(把箱子碼整齊)。
    - Bǎ xiāngzi mǎ zhěngqí.
    - Stack the boxes neatly.
### 扫码 → 码(碼) → 石
- **definition:** stone
- **pinyin:** shí
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a stone beneath a cliff (厂); the cliff later became 丆. Sometimes interpreted as a cave set into a cliff.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a rock under an overhanging cliff, directly conveying the idea of stone. Over time the cliff component 厂 was stylized into 丆; some traditions read the scene as a cave in a cliff, still pointing to rock and earth.
- **examples:**
  - 他捡起一块石头(他撿起一塊石頭)。
    - Tā jiǎnqǐ yí kuài shítou.
    - He picked up a stone.
  - 这些矿石含有丰富的铁(這些礦石含有豐富的鐵)。
    - Zhèxiē kuàngshí hányǒu fēngfù de tiě.
    - These ores contain abundant iron.
  - 他姓石(他姓石)。
    - Tā xìng Shí.
    - His surname is Shi.
### 扫码 → 码(碼) → 马(馬)
- **definition:** horse
- **pinyin:** mǎ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a horse with head facing left and flowing mane; in bronze, the head simplified to 目; legs evolved into four dots 灬 (unrelated to 火). Simplified 马 from 馬 via cursive script.
  - **interpretation:** Originally a sketch of a horse that gradually stylized its head and legs into simple strokes. Modern simplification to 马 follows a cursive handwriting form, compressing the body and abstracting the legs into a single sweeping shape.
  - **simplification:** Reduced from 馬 based on cursive (草书) form to speed writing, cutting strokes from about 10 to 3 and standardized in the PRC.
- **examples:**
  - 那匹马跑得很快(那匹馬跑得很快)。
    - Nà pǐ mǎ pǎo de hěn kuài.
    - That horse runs very fast.
  - 他骑马去学校(他騎馬去學校)。
    - Tā qí mǎ qù xuéxiào.
    - He rides a horse to school.
  - 马上开始比赛(馬上開始比賽)。
    - Mǎshàng kāishǐ bǐsài.
    - The competition will start right away.

## Da’an District, Taipei
### Dà’ān Qū
---
- **definition:** Da’an District, Taipei
- **pinyin:** Dà’ān Qū
- **components:**
  - 大
    - dà
    - big; great; major; very
  - 安
    - ān
    - peace; safe; quiet; settle
  - 区(區)
    - qū
    - area; district; region; ward
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word (toponym)
  - **description:** 大 (great) + 安 (peace) + 区 (district) = 'Great Peace District' (Da’an District).
  - **interpretation:** Literally 'Great Peace District'. An auspicious place name for a Taipei administrative district conveying stability and well‑being.
  - **simplification:** Only 區 → 区 was simplified in Mainland Chinese to reduce strokes; Taiwan keeps the traditional 區.
- **examples:**
  - 我住在台北市大安区(我住在臺北市大安區)。
    - Wǒ zhù zài Táiběi Shì Dà’ān Qū.
    - I live in Taipei’s Da’an District.
  - 大安区有许多大学和公园(大安區有許多大學和公園)。
    - Dà’ān Qū yǒu xǔduō dàxué hé gōngyuán.
    - Da’an District has many universities and parks.
  - 我们在大安森林公园散步(我們在大安森林公園散步)。
    - Wǒmen zài Dà’ān Sēnlín Gōngyuán sànbù.
    - We take a walk in Da’an Forest Park.
### 大安区 → 大
- **definition:** big; great; major; very
- **pinyin:** dà
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a person facing forward; original form of 夫, later phonetically borrowed for “big”.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicts a human figure viewed from the front, not necessarily with exaggerated outstretched arms. The graph was later borrowed to write the word pronounced dà ‘big’, while 夫 specialized for ‘man’. The modern shape still evokes a torso with two legs and an arm stroke.
- **examples:**
  - 这个房间很大(這個房間很大)。
    - Zhège fángjiān hěn dà.
    - This room is very big.
  - 他是我们家最大的孩子(他是我們家最大的孩子)。
    - Tā shì wǒmen jiā zuì dà de háizi.
    - He is the eldest child in our family.
  - 大学开学了(大學開學了)。
    - Dàxué kāixué le.
    - The university term has begun.
### 大安区 → 安
- **definition:** peace; safe; quiet; settle
- **pinyin:** ān
- **components:**
  - 女
    - nǚ
    - woman
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 宀 'house' + 女 'kneeling woman' → at ease, safe
  - **interpretation:** A roof over a woman evokes the image of someone calmly settled at home, conveying safety and peace. Early forms depict a seated woman under a roof as a symbol of domestic tranquility and being at ease.
- **examples:**
  - 我在家很安心(我在家很安心)。
    - Wǒ zài jiā hěn ānxīn.
    - I feel at ease at home.
  - 这里很安静(這裡很安靜)。
    - Zhèlǐ hěn ānjìng.
    - It is very quiet here.
  - 请你放心，孩子们很安全(請你放心，孩子們很安全)。
    - Qǐng nǐ fàngxīn, háizimen hěn ānquán.
    - Please rest assured; the children are safe.
### 大安区 → 安 → 女
- **definition:** woman
- **pinyin:** nǚ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a woman with breasts kneeling or standing; modern form reversed from oracle forms, with the enclosed area as the remnant of the right breast and the left breast lost.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a female figure with a curved torso and a remaining breast, historically shown kneeling and later flipped to face right in standard script. Graphically related to 母 and 毋, which retain more breast/nipple detail, while the similar-looking 卩 is unrelated.
- **examples:**
  - 她是一个勇敢的女人(她是一個勇敢的女人)。
    - Tā shì yí gè yǒnggǎn de nǚrén.
    - She is a brave woman.
  - 他们有一个可爱的女儿(他們有一個可愛的女兒)，正在上小学(正在上小學)。
    - Tāmen yǒu yí gè kě'ài de nǚ'ér, zhèngzài shàng xiǎoxué.
    - They have a lovely daughter who is in primary school.
  - 这家公司的女员工很多(這家公司的女員工很多)，工作表现很出色(工作表現很出色)。
    - Zhè jiā gōngsī de nǚ yuángōng hěn duō, gōngzuò biǎoxiàn hěn chūsè.
    - This company has many female employees, and their work performance is outstanding.
### 大安区 → 区(區)
- **definition:** area; district; region; ward
- **pinyin:** qū
- **components:**
  - 品
    - pǐn
    - goods; product; grade; many
  - 乂
    - yì
    - to regulate; to govern; mow
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (會意 / 会意)
  - **description:** semantic: 匸 + 品 (simplified from 區 with 品 → 乂)
  - **interpretation:** Enclosure 匸 contains many people 品, evoking a bounded place such as a district or area. The simplification swaps 品 for 乂 to reduce strokes while still suggesting contents within a boundary, so the meaning remains ‘area/region; to divide into areas’.
  - **simplification:** Replaced the inner component 品 with 乂 to reduce stroke count; a graphic simplification without phonetic intent.
- **examples:**
  - 我住在这个区(我住在這個區)。
    - Wǒ zhù zài zhège qū.
    - I live in this district.
  - 这个城市分为五个区(這個城市分為五個區)。
    - Zhège chéngshì fēn wéi wǔ gè qū.
    - This city is divided into five districts.
  - 请把教室分区(請把教室分區)。
    - Qǐng bǎ jiàoshì fēnqū.
    - Please divide the classroom into zones.
### 大安区 → 区(區) → 品
- **definition:** goods; product; grade; many
- **pinyin:** pǐn
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth; opening
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** Triplication of 口, representing various objects. Also occurs in 區.
  - **interpretation:** Three mouths or containers arranged together conveys a collection of items, leading to senses like goods and products. The tripled form also suggests abundance and categorization, extending to meanings such as many and grade when evaluating items.
- **examples:**
  - 商店里的商品很多(商店裡的商品很多)，价格公道(價格公道)。
    - Shāngdiàn lǐ de shāngpǐn hěn duō, jiàgé gōngdào.
    - The store has many goods, and the prices are fair.
  - 他懂得品茶(他懂得品茶)，分得出上品和下品(分得出上品和下品)。
    - Tā dǒngdé pǐn chá, fēn dé chū shàngpǐn hé xiàpǐn.
    - He knows how to appreciate tea and can distinguish top grade from low grade.
  - 这家厂的产品分为三等品(這家廠的產品分為三等品)。
    - Zhè jiā chǎng de chǎnpǐn fēn wéi sān děngpǐn.
    - This factory’s products are divided into three grades.
### 大安区 → 区(區) → 品 → 口
- **definition:** mouth; opening
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 大安区 → 区(區) → 乂
- **definition:** to regulate; to govern; mow
- **pinyin:** yì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: cutting tool (knife/sickle); some ancient forms look like large scissors; original ‘mow/cut weed’ sense preserved in 刈; unrelated to 爻; cf. 辛
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a cutting implement, so meanings focus on cutting or trimming and extend metaphorically to governing or bringing order. Ancient forms resembling large scissors underscore the idea of clipping weeds to tidy the field. Despite visual similarity, it is not related to 爻.
- **examples:**
  - 天下乂安(天下乂安)。
    - Tiānxià yì'ān.
    - All under heaven is well governed and peaceful.
  - 良臣能乂民(良臣能乂民)。
    - Liáng chén néng yì mín.
    - A worthy minister can govern the people.
  - 秋收时(秋收時)，农夫以镰刀乂草(農夫以鐮刀乂草)。
    - Qiūshōu shí, nóngfū yǐ liándāo yì cǎo.
    - At harvest time, the farmer cuts the grass with a sickle.

## 酱(醬)

## sauce
### jiàng
---
- **definition:** sauce
- **pinyin:** jiàng
- **components:**
  - 酉
    - yǒu
    - wine; alcohol; the 10th Earthly Branch
  - 将(將)
    - jiāng
    - to lead; will; about to; take (coverb)
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 酉 + phonetic: 将(將)
  - **interpretation:** 酉 signals fermentation, alcoholic liquids, and by extension condiments, pointing to the meaning of a fermented sauce. 将/將 contributes the sound jiang and helps form the word family, while the overall structure keeps the flavor-related sense.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by replacing the phonetic 將 with its simplified form 将 (⿰丬夕), reducing strokes while preserving pronunciation and the original phono-semantic structure.
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢吃辣酱(我喜歡吃辣醬)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan chī làjiàng.
    - I like to eat spicy sauce.
  - 她把面条拌上豆瓣酱(她把麵條拌上豆瓣醬)。
    - Tā bǎ miàntiáo bàn shàng dòubànjiàng.
    - She tossed the noodles with doubanjiang.
  - 这道菜需要加一点酱油(這道菜需要加一點醬油)。
    - Zhè dào cài xūyào jiā yīdiǎn jiàngyóu.
    - This dish needs a little soy sauce.
### 酱(醬) → 酉
- **definition:** wine; alcohol; the 10th Earthly Branch
- **pinyin:** yǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram (象形)
  - **description:** A wine vessel with a pointed bottom; original character for 酒.
  - **interpretation:** It depicts a pointed-bottom wine vessel used in antiquity, which had to be set in a stand or into the ground. As the original graph for 酒 ‘alcohol’, it became associated with fermented beverages and later designated the tenth Earthly Branch.
- **examples:**
  - 现在是酉时(現在是酉時)。
    - Xiànzài shì yǒu shí.
    - It is the You hour (around 5–7 p.m.).
  - 地支的第十位是酉(地支的第十位是酉)。
    - Dìzhī de dì shí wèi shì yǒu.
    - The tenth Earthly Branch is You.
  - 卯酉之间代表东西方向(卯酉之間代表東西方向)。
    - Mǎo-yǒu zhījiān dàibiǎo dōngxī fāngxiàng.
    - The span from Mao to You represents the east–west direction.
### 酱(醬) → 将(將)
- **definition:** to lead; will; about to; take (coverb)
- **pinyin:** jiāng
- **components:**
  - 爿
    - qiáng
    - bed; small table
  - 肉
    - ròu
    - meat
  - 寸
    - cùn
    - inch; hand
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** phonetic 爿 + semantic 肉 (‘meat’) + semantic 寸 (‘hand’) — offering meat as tribute; ⺼ is on its side (resembles 夕), and 爿 may also suggest a cutting board/altar.
  - **interpretation:** A hand presenting meat suggests offering or bringing something forward, which underlies senses like ‘to lead/bring’ and later ‘will’. 爿 supplies the sound and can also evoke the board or altar on which the meat is set.
  - **simplification:** 将 streamlines 將 by keeping the phonetic 爿 as its left-side form 丬, reducing ⺼ to 夕, and dropping 寸, preserving pronunciation cues while cutting strokes.
- **examples:**
  - 我将去北京(我將去北京)。
    - Wǒ jiāng qù Běijīng.
    - I will go to Beijing.
  - 他将书放在桌上(他將書放在桌上)。
    - Tā jiāng shū fàng zài zhuō shàng.
    - He put the book on the table.
  - 他是将军(他是將軍)。
    - Tā shì jiāngjūn.
    - He is a general.
### 酱(醬) → 将(將) → 爿
- **definition:** bed; small table
- **pinyin:** qiáng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram — a bed; original form of 牀; appears contracted in 臧.
  - **interpretation:** It originated as a drawing of a bed frame and later served as the left-side component in forms like 牀 (simplified as 床). Inside 臧 it is written in a contracted side-form.
- **examples:**
  - 这个部件叫“爿”，常出现在左边(這個部件叫「爿」，常出現在左邊)。
    - Zhège bùjiàn jiào “qiáng”, cháng chūxiàn zài zuǒbiān.
    - This component is called “qiáng” and often appears on the left.
  - 在“牀”字里，左边写作爿，简化后写作广(在「牀」字裡，左邊寫作爿，簡化後寫作廣)。
    - Zài “chuáng” zì lǐ, zuǒbiān xiězuò qiáng, jiǎnhuà hòu xiězuò guǎng.
    - In the character “牀,” the left side is written as 爿; after simplification it is written as 广.
  - 在“臧”字中，爿写成丬，是其约形(在「臧」字中，爿寫成丬，是其約形)。
    - Zài “zāng” zì zhōng, qiáng xiěchéng “丬”, shì qí yuēxíng.
    - In the character “臧,” 爿 is written as the contracted side-form 丬.
### 酱(醬) → 将(將) → 肉
- **definition:** meat
- **pinyin:** ròu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: ribs/section of meat; stylized as 月 when beside a phonetic, and as 𱼀 or 夕 inside some characters.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts the cross-section of flesh with ribs or a slice of meat. In compounds it often appears as a component written like 月, or reduced to 𱼀/夕, which can be mistaken for the moon component but actually signals ‘meat/flesh.’
- **examples:**
  - 我不吃猪肉(我不吃豬肉)。
    - Wǒ bù chī zhūròu.
    - I don't eat pork.
  - 这道菜肉很多，很鲜嫩(這道菜肉很多，很鮮嫩)。
    - Zhè dào cài ròu hěn duō, hěn xiānnèn.
    - This dish has a lot of meat; it's very tender.
  - 受伤后，他手上的肉裂开了(受傷後，他手上的肉裂開了)。
    - Shòushāng hòu, tā shǒushang de ròu liè kāi le.
    - After being injured, the flesh on his hand split open.
### 酱(醬) → 将(將) → 寸
- **definition:** inch; hand
- **pinyin:** cùn
- **components:**
  - 又
    - yòu
    - again; (archaic) right hand
  - 一
    - yī
    - one
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram (指事)
  - **description:** Indicative of the position on the forearm where the pulse is palpated (寸口); the unit sense derives from the wrist-to-point distance. Compare 又, 手, 九, 爪.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a wrist/hand with a small mark showing the pulse point (寸口). From the short span used to locate that point, it generalized to the unit meaning “inch,” and as a component it often relates to hand/action or small measures.
- **examples:**
  - 这块木板只有三寸厚(這塊木板只有三寸厚)。
    - Zhè kuài mùbǎn zhǐyǒu sān cùn hòu.
    - This plank is only three inches thick.
  - 医生在我的寸口上按脉(醫生在我的寸口上按脈)。
    - Yīshēng zài wǒ de cùnkǒu shàng àn mài.
    - The doctor presses my pulse at the cun point.
  - 城市里寸土寸金(城市裡寸土寸金)。
    - Chéngshì lǐ cùn tǔ cùn jīn.
    - In the city, every inch of land is as precious as gold.
### 酱(醬) → 将(將) → 寸 → 又
- **definition:** again; (archaic) right hand
- **pinyin:** yòu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – a right hand; original form of 右; unrelated to 𠬤 (> 译). Often written as 彐 in many modern characters (e.g., 事, 聿, 雪, 急, 爭, 尹, 建).
  - **interpretation:** Early graphs depict a right hand, which later gave rise to 右 ‘right (side)’. The adverbial sense ‘again’ developed later by semantic extension. In many compounds a similar shape is written as 彐, but that is a graphic convention rather than a direct historical component here.
- **examples:**
  - 他又来了(他又來了)。
    - Tā yòu lái le.
    - He came again.
  - 请向右转(請向右轉)。
    - Qǐng xiàng yòu zhuǎn.
    - Please turn right.
  - 她又买了一本书(她又買了一本書)。
    - Tā yòu mǎi le yī běn shū.
    - She bought another book.
### 酱(醬) → 将(將) → 寸 → 一
- **definition:** one
- **pinyin:** yī
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** a horizontal stroke, indicating the number 'one'.
  - **interpretation:** A single horizontal line visually represents the concept of oneness. As the simplest numeral, it set the pattern for 二 and 三 by repeating the stroke to show increasing quantity.
- **examples:**
  - 我只有一本书(我只有一本書)。
    - Wǒ zhǐ yǒu yì běn shū.
    - I only have one book.
  - 他一到就给我打电话(他一到就給我打電話)。
    - Tā yí dào jiù gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
    - As soon as he arrives, he calls me.
  - 一个问题都没有(一個問題都沒有)。
    - Yí gè wèntí dōu méiyǒu.
    - There isn’t a single problem.

## shopping mall
### shāngchǎng
---
- **definition:** shopping mall
- **pinyin:** shāngchǎng
- **components:**
  - 商
    - shāng
    - commerce; business; to discuss; quotient
  - 场(場)
    - chǎng
    - field; place/venue; classifier for events; scene
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 商 (commerce; trade) + 场/場 (field; place) = marketplace/shopping venue.
  - **interpretation:** Combines the idea of commerce with a place, indicating a venue for buying and selling; in modern usage, refers to a shopping mall.
  - **simplification:** 場 → 场 by simplifying the phonetic component 昜 across the series (e.g., 揚→扬, 陽→阳, 湯→汤), reducing strokes and unifying forms; 商 unchanged.
- **examples:**
  - 这家商场很大(這家商場很大)。
    - Zhè jiā shāngchǎng hěn dà.
    - This mall is very big.
  - 周末我们去商场看电影(週末我們去商場看電影)，顺便购物(順便購物)。
    - Zhōumò wǒmen qù shāngchǎng kàn diànyǐng, shùnbiàn gòuwù.
    - On the weekend we go to the mall to watch a movie and do some shopping.
  - 商场今天打折(商場今天打折)，人山人海(人山人海)。
    - Shāngchǎng jīntiān dǎzhé, rénshān rénhǎi.
    - The mall has discounts today; it’s packed with people.
### 商场(商場) → 商
- **definition:** commerce; business; to discuss; quotient
- **pinyin:** shāng
- **components:**
  - 尚
    - shàng
    - still; yet; esteem
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 口 ‘mouth; speech’ + phonetic: 尚 (shàng).
  - **interpretation:** 尚 contributes the shang sound, while 口 evokes speaking, negotiation, and discussion. The commercial sense likely developed from the idea of talking/bargaining, and other stories such as the ‘wine vessel on a table’ are regarded as folk etymology.
- **examples:**
  - 他在商场工作(他在商場工作)。
    - Tā zài shāngchǎng gōngzuò.
    - He works at a shopping mall / in commerce.
  - 我们先商量一下再决定(我們先商量一下再決定)。
    - Wǒmen xiān shāngliang yīxià zài juédìng.
    - Let’s discuss it first and then decide.
  - 8除以2的商是4(8除以2的商是4)。
    - Bā chú yǐ èr de shāng shì sì.
    - The quotient of 8 divided by 2 is 4.
### 商场(商場) → 商 → 尚
- **definition:** still; yet; esteem
- **pinyin:** shàng
- **components:**
  - 八
    - bā
    - eight
  - 向
    - xiàng
    - toward; direction
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 八 + phonetic: 向
  - **interpretation:** Built with 八 as the semantic element and 向 as the phonetic, aligning with their Old Chinese readings. 八 gives a general semantic tag while 向 contributes the shàng sound; the overall layout is similar to 冋.
- **examples:**
  - 事情尚未结束(事情尚未結束)。
    - Shìqíng shàng wèi jiéshù.
    - The matter is not over yet.
  - 他尚年轻(他尚年輕)，需要指导(需要指導)。
    - Tā shàng niánqīng, xūyào zhǐdǎo.
    - He is still young and needs guidance.
  - 他崇尚简约的生活方式(他崇尚簡約的生活方式)。
    - Tā chóngshàng jiǎnyuē de shēnghuó fāngshì.
    - He esteems a simple lifestyle.
### 商场(商場) → 商 → 尚 → 八
- **definition:** eight
- **pinyin:** bā
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: two bent lines indicating “to divide”; later borrowed to mean “eight” via homophony (original sense now in 分, 別).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts two strokes diverging to suggest splitting or separation. Later became a rebus for the number eight because it shared the same sound, while the original sense lived on in 分 and 別. Not the “two hands” component found in other characters.
- **examples:**
  - 我有八本书(我有八本書)。
    - Wǒ yǒu bā běn shū.
    - I have eight books.
  - 她八岁了(她八歲了)。
    - Tā bā suì le.
    - She is eight years old.
  - 我买了八个苹果(我買了八個蘋果)。
    - Wǒ mǎi le bā gè píngguǒ.
    - I bought eight apples.
### 商场(商場) → 商 → 尚 → 向
- **definition:** toward; direction
- **pinyin:** xiàng
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** 宀 ‘house’ + 口 ‘mouth’; echoes in a place. Original form of 響; later borrowed to write 𠨍 (嚮). Similar to 冋.
  - **interpretation:** A mouth sounding under a roof evokes reverberation indoors, matching the sense later written as 響 ‘echo, sound’. By rebus borrowing the graph came to write 嚮 ‘to face, toward; direction’, which is the sense carried by modern 向.
- **examples:**
  - 我们向前走吧(我們向前走吧)。
    - Wǒmen xiàng qián zǒu ba.
    - Let’s walk forward.
  - 她向着窗户微笑(她向著窗戶微笑)。
    - Tā xiàngzhe chuānghu wēixiào.
    - She smiles toward the window.
  - 他向医院的方向跑去(他向醫院的方向跑去)。
    - Tā xiàng yīyuàn de fāngxiàng pǎo qù.
    - He ran in the direction of the hospital.
### 商场(商場) → 商 → 尚 → 向 → 口
- **definition:** mouth
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 商场(商場) → 场(場)
- **definition:** field; place/venue; classifier for events; scene
- **pinyin:** chǎng
- **components:**
  - 土
    - tǔ
    - earth; soil
  - 昜
    - yáng
    - to raise; bright
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 土 (“earth”) + phonetic: 昜 (OC *laŋ); simplified: 昜 → 𠃓
  - **interpretation:** 土 contributes the sense of ground or earth, aligning with meanings like field and place. The phonetic 昜 provides the sound basis for the reading; in the simplified form, its role is retained by a reduced shape 𠃓 that preserves the phonetic cue while cutting strokes.
  - **simplification:** The traditional phonetic 昜 was replaced by a streamlined component 𠃓 to reduce stroke count while keeping 土 for meaning and a recognizable phonetic element.
- **examples:**
  - 我们在体育场看比赛(我們在體育場看比賽)。
    - Wǒmen zài tǐyùchǎng kàn bǐsài.
    - We watched a game at the stadium.
  - 今晚有一场大雨(今晚有一場大雨)。
    - Jīnwǎn yǒu yì chǎng dàyǔ.
    - There will be a heavy rain tonight.
  - 电影的第一场很精彩(電影的第一場很精彩)。
    - Diànyǐng de dì-yī chǎng hěn jīngcǎi.
    - The first scene of the movie is excellent.
### 商场(商場) → 场(場) → 土
- **definition:** earth; soil
- **pinyin:** tǔ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a lump of clay on the ground or on a potter’s wheel; the central dot was later stylized into a short horizontal stroke.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a clod of earth resting on the ground, later streamlined into a vertical line with top and bottom bars. The upper bar developed from an earlier dot to distinguish it from similar graphs.
- **examples:**
  - 这里的土很干(這裡的土很乾)。
    - Zhèlǐ de tǔ hěn gān.
    - The soil here is very dry.
  - 他把一把土撒在花盆里(他把一把土撒在花盆裡)。
    - Tā bǎ yì bǎ tǔ sǎ zài huāpén lǐ.
    - He sprinkled a handful of soil into the flowerpot.
  - 建房前要先检测土质(建房前要先檢測土質)。
    - Jiàn fáng qián yào xiān jiǎncè tǔzhì.
    - Before building a house, the soil quality must be tested.
### 商场(商場) → 场(場) → 昜
- **definition:** to raise; bright
- **pinyin:** yáng
- **components:**
  - 日
    - rì
    - sun; day
  - 丂
    - kǎo
    - to pant; obstructed breath
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** 日 “sun” + 丂 + 彡 — rays of the sun over a tree branch.
  - **interpretation:** Shows the sun with its rays spreading above a branch, evoking light streaming out and an upward motion. This imagery underlies senses like “bright” and “to raise/lift.”
- **examples:**
  - 旌旗既昜，鼓角齐鸣。(旌旗既昜，鼓角齊鳴。)
    - Jīngqí jì yáng, gǔjiǎo qí míng.
    - Once the banners are raised, horns and drums sound together.
  - 东山初日既昜，雾气渐散。(東山初日既昜，霧氣漸散。)
    - Dōngshān chūrì jì yáng, wùqì jiàn sàn.
    - As the first sun over the eastern hills brightens, the mist gradually disperses.
  - 清晨日色昜，行人早起。(清晨日色昜，行人早起。)
    - Qīngchén rìsè yáng, xíngrén zǎo qǐ.
    - At dawn the sunlight is bright, and travelers rise early.
### 商场(商場) → 场(場) → 昜 → 日
- **definition:** sun; day
- **pinyin:** rì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** The sun; a dot or line was added in the centre to distinguish it from similar graphs (e.g., 囗, early form of 丁); compare earlier forms with the Sun symbol (☉) and the Egyptian hieroglyph 𓇳.
  - **interpretation:** Early forms depicted a round sun, later marked with a central stroke or dot to prevent confusion with similar enclosed shapes. Its form closely echoes the solar symbol ☉ and parallels sun pictographs found in other ancient scripts.
- **examples:**
  - 我每天写日记(我每天寫日記)。
    - Wǒ měi tiān xiě rìjì.
    - I write in my diary every day.
  - 今天是星期日(今天是星期日)。
    - Jīntiān shì xīngqīrì.
    - Today is Sunday.
  - 旭日东升(旭日東昇)，海面一片金光(海面一片金光)。
    - Xùrì dōngshēng, hǎimiàn yí piàn jīnguāng.
    - As the rising sun ascends in the east, the sea gleams with golden light.
### 商场(商場) → 场(場) → 昜 → 丂
- **definition:** to pant; obstructed breath
- **pinyin:** kǎo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** conflation
  - **description:** Conflation of several characters.
  - **interpretation:** Not a regular pictophonetic or ideogrammic formation; scribes merged features of multiple similar-looking graphs into a single standardized form. Its attested sense relates to troubled breathing, aligning its usage with notions of breath or obstruction rather than a clear semantic-phonetic decomposition.
- **examples:**
  - 奔跑过后(奔跑過後)，他丂得厉害(他丂得厲害)。
    - Bēnpǎo guòhòu, tā kǎo de lìhai.
    - After running, he was panting badly.
  - 山路陡峭(山路陡峭)，走几步就觉得丂(走幾步就覺得丂)。
    - Shānlù dǒuqiào, zǒu jǐ bù jiù juéde kǎo.
    - The mountain path is steep; after a few steps one feels out of breath.
  - 医生问他是否有丂和胸闷的症状(醫生問他是否有丂和胸悶的症狀)。
    - Yīshēng wèn tā shìfǒu yǒu kǎo hé xiōngmèn de zhèngzhuàng.
    - The doctor asked whether he had symptoms of panting and chest tightness.

## continent; river island
### zhōu
---
- **definition:** continent; river island
- **pinyin:** zhōu
- **components:**
  - 水
    - shuǐ
    - water
  - 州
    - zhōu
    - islet; state
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 水 ‘water’ + phonetic: 州
  - **interpretation:** Water element signals a relation to bodies of water. 州 provides the sound zhōu and originally referred to a river islet or sandbank, aligning with the meaning ‘river island’ and later extending to ‘continent.’
- **examples:**
  - 亚洲是世界上人口最多的洲(亞洲是世界上人口最多的洲)。
    - Yàzhōu shì shìjiè shàng rénkǒu zuì duō de zhōu.
    - Asia is one of the most populous continents in the world.
  - 这条大江中间有一座沙洲(這條大江中間有一座沙洲)。
    - Zhè tiáo dàjiāng zhōngjiān yǒu yī zuò shāzhōu.
    - There is a sandbar island in the middle of this great river.
  - 洲际航班需要飞很多小时(洲際航班需要飛很多小時)。
    - Zhōujì hángbān xūyào fēi hěn duō xiǎoshí.
    - Intercontinental flights take many hours.
### 洲 → 水
- **definition:** water
- **pinyin:** shuǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram of water flowing; sometimes written as the variant 氺; next to a character it is compressed and stylized into 氵 (unrelated to 冫).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts flowing water with a main stream and side droplets. In compound characters it condenses to the left-side form 氵 to signal a water-related meaning, distinct from 冫 which indicates ice or cold.
- **examples:**
  - 我想喝一杯水(我想喝一杯水)。
    - Wǒ xiǎng hē yì bēi shuǐ.
    - I want to drink a glass of water.
  - 城市的自来水很干净(城市的自來水很乾淨)。
    - Chéngshì de zìláishuǐ hěn gānjìng.
    - The tap water in the city is very clean.
  - 旱季来了(旱季來了)，我们要节约用水(我們要節約用水)。
    - Hànjì lái le, wǒmen yào jiéyuē yòngshuǐ.
    - The dry season has arrived; we should conserve water.
### 洲 → 州
- **definition:** islet; state
- **pinyin:** zhōu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** islet in a river
  - **interpretation:** Depicts small islets amid flowing water; early forms sketched sandbanks separated by channels. The meaning was later extended to administrative “states/prefectures,” while the water-marked form 洲 took over the literal “river islet” sense.
- **examples:**
  - 美国有五十个州(美國有五十個州)，每个州都有自己的法律(每個州都有自己的法律)。
    - Měiguó yǒu wǔshí gè zhōu, měi gè zhōu dōu yǒu zìjǐ de fǎlǜ.
    - The United States has fifty states, and each state has its own laws.
  - 我们开车穿过加利福尼亚州(我們開車穿過加利福尼亞州)。
    - Wǒmen kāichē chuānguò Jiālìfúníyà Zhōu.
    - We drove across the state of California.
  - 我们计划游历澳大利亚的几个州(我們計劃遊歷澳大利亞的幾個州)。
    - Wǒmen jìhuà yóulì Àodàlìyà de jǐ gè zhōu.
    - We plan to travel through several states in Australia.

## 声(聲)
---
## sound; voice
### shēng
---
- **definition:** sound; voice
- **pinyin:** shēng
- **components:**
  - 耳
    - ěr
    - ear
  - 殸
    - qìng
    - stone chime; to sound (archaic)
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** phonetic 殸 + semantic 耳 (‘ear’).
  - **interpretation:** Combines 耳 “ear,” signaling a meaning related to hearing, with 殸 as the sound component guiding pronunciation. The graphic thus links the idea of hearing with a phonetic cue from the 殸 series, yielding the sense of sound/voice.
  - **simplification:** In simplification, the semantic ear 耳 was dropped and the graph was streamlined by adopting a reduced form of the phonetic component, yielding 声 with fewer strokes.
- **examples:**
  - 我听见奇怪的声响(我聽見奇怪的聲響)。
    - Wǒ tīngjiàn qíguài de shēngxiǎng.
    - I heard a strange sound.
  - 她的声音很温柔(她的聲音很溫柔)。
    - Tā de shēngyīn hěn wēnróu.
    - Her voice is very gentle.
  - 请小声一点(請小聲一點)。
    - Qǐng xiǎo shēng yīdiǎn.
    - Please lower your voice.
### 声(聲) → 耳
- **definition:** ear
- **pinyin:** ěr
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: an ear
  - **interpretation:** Sketches the side view of a human ear: the vertical stroke outlines the rim while shorter strokes suggest inner folds. Early forms were more curved and naturalistic; later writing regularized the lines but the image remains recognizable.
- **examples:**
  - 他耳朵疼(他耳朵疼)。
    - Tā ěrduo téng.
    - His ear hurts.
  - 戴上耳机(戴上耳機)，听音乐(聽音樂)。
    - Dài shàng ěrjī, tīng yīnyuè.
    - Put on headphones and listen to music.
  - 医生检查他的左耳(醫生檢查他的左耳)。
    - Yīshēng jiǎnchá tā de zuǒ ěr.
    - The doctor examined his left ear.
### 声(聲) → 殸
- **definition:** stone chime; to sound (archaic)
- **pinyin:** qìng
- **components:**
  - 声(聲)
    - shēng
    - sound; voice
  - 殳
    - shū
    - weapon; club; to strike
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 声 ‘stone chime’ + semantic: 殳 ‘hand holding a hammer/mallet’ — a stone chime being struck.
  - **interpretation:** Combines the graph for a stone chime with a hand holding a striking tool to depict striking a lithophone. By extension it names both the instrument and the resonant sound produced when it is hit, paralleling forms like 鼓 where a drum is shown being beaten.
- **examples:**
  - 博物馆藏一件汉代殸(博物館藏一件漢代殸)。
    - Bówùguǎn cáng yī jiàn Hàn dài qìng.
    - The museum houses a Han-dynasty stone chime.
  - 祀典开始时，乐工以木槌击殸(祀典開始時，樂工以木槌擊殸)。
    - Sìdiǎn kāishǐ shí, yuègōng yǐ mùchuí jī qìng.
    - At the start of the rite, the musicians strike the stone chime with wooden mallets.
### 声(聲) → 殸 → 殳
- **definition:** weapon; club; to strike
- **pinyin:** shū
- **components:**
  - 又
    - yòu
    - again; right hand
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram or ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** 𠘧 + 又 — a hand holding a tool similar to a hammer; associated with striking/activity; later borrowed phonetically for a bamboo halberd.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a hand grasping a striking implement, conveying the idea of hitting or manual action. The graph was later reassigned by phonetic loan to name a bamboo halberd, while the original ‘strike/tool’ sense remains visible in its use as a radical.
- **examples:**
  - 殳姓很少见(殳姓很少見)。
    - Shū xìng hěn shǎo jiàn.
    - The surname Shu is very rare.
  - 古书中殳指一种竹制的戟(古書中殳指一種竹製的戟)。
    - Gǔshū zhōng shū zhǐ yī zhǒng zhúzhì de jǐ.
    - In ancient texts, 殳 refers to a kind of bamboo halberd.
  - 在甲骨文里，殳像手持工具的形状(在甲骨文裡，殳像手持工具的形狀)。
    - Zài jiǎgǔwén lǐ, shū xiàng shǒuchí gōngjù de xíngzhuàng.
    - In oracle bone script, 殳 looks like a hand holding a tool.
### 声(聲) → 殸 → 殳 → 又
- **definition:** again; right hand
- **pinyin:** yòu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – a right hand; original form of 右; unrelated to 𠬤 (> 译). Often written as 彐 in many modern characters (e.g., 事, 聿, 雪, 急, 爭, 尹, 建).
  - **interpretation:** Early graphs depict a right hand, which later gave rise to 右 ‘right (side)’. The adverbial sense ‘again’ developed later by semantic extension. In many compounds a similar shape is written as 彐, but that is a graphic convention rather than a direct historical component here.
- **examples:**
  - 他又来了(他又來了)。
    - Tā yòu lái le.
    - He came again.
  - 请向右转(請向右轉)。
    - Qǐng xiàng yòu zhuǎn.
    - Please turn right.
  - 她又买了一本书(她又買了一本書)。
    - Tā yòu mǎi le yī běn shū.
    - She bought another book.

## household; door
### hù
---
- **definition:** household; door
- **pinyin:** hù
- **components:**
  - 门(門)
    - mén
    - gate; door
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: one-half of 門 (“gate”); original form similar to 𠁣.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a single leaf of a gate or door, evoking the entrance to a dwelling. The sense broadened from the physical door panel to the notion of a household as a unit.
  - **simplification:** Adopted a long-used clerical/cursive variant with fewer strokes, streamlining 戶 to 户 for easier writing while preserving the door-leaf outline.
- **examples:**
  - 小区有一千多户居民(小區有一千多戶居民)。
    - Xiǎoqū yǒu yīqiān duō hù jūmín.

  - 每户都按时缴费(每戶都按時繳費)。
    - Měi hù dōu ànshí jiǎofèi.
    - Each household pays on time.
  - 他把户口迁到了上海(他把戶口遷到了上海)。
    - Tā bǎ hùkǒu qiān dào le Shànghǎi.
    - He transferred his household registration to Shanghai.
### 户(戶) → 门(門)
- **definition:** gate; door
- **pinyin:** mén
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a gate; compare 戶 “(one) door”, half of the character.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a pair of swinging doors within a frame, representing a gate or entrance. Traditional 門 shows two door leaves; simplified 门 keeps the frame and a central stroke, preserving the concept of an opening.
  - **simplification:** Reduced stroke count by collapsing the inner leaves to a single vertical line and straightening the frame; standardized as the common radical form in simplified characters.
- **examples:**
  - 请把门关上(請把門關上)。
    - Qǐng bǎ mén guān shàng.
    - Please close the door.
  - 他选了三门课程(他選了三門課程)。
    - Tā xuǎn le sān mén kèchéng.
    - He chose three courses.
  - 我在门口等你(我在門口等你)。
    - Wǒ zài ménkǒu děng nǐ.
    - I'll wait for you at the entrance.
