## beet
### tiáncài
---
- **definition:** beet
- **pinyin:** tiáncài
- **components:**
  - 甜
    - tián
    - sweet; sugary; honeyed; pleasing
  - 菜
    - cài
    - vegetable; dish; cuisine; greens
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 甜(sweet) + 菜(vegetable/edible plant) = beet/sugar beet.
  - **interpretation:** Literally “sweet vegetable,” naming the beet—especially the sugar beet—because of its high sugar content; in food contexts it can also refer to beetroot (often 甜菜根/紅甜菜).
- **examples:**
  - 甜菜主要用来制糖(甜菜主要用來製糖)，在北方种植广泛(在北方種植廣泛)。
    - Tiáncài zhǔyào yònglái zhìtáng, zài Běifāng zhòngzhí guǎngfàn.
    - Beets (especially sugar beets) are mainly used for sugar production and are widely cultivated in the north.
  - 我们把甜菜根切片做沙拉(我們把甜菜根切片做沙拉)。
    - Wǒmen bǎ tiáncài gēn qiēpiàn zuò shālā.
    - We slice beetroot to make a salad.
  - 红甜菜颜色鲜红(紅甜菜顏色鮮紅)，味道微甜(味道微甜)。
    - Hóng tiáncài yánsè xiānhóng, wèidào wēitián.
    - Red beets are bright red and mildly sweet.
### 甜菜 → 甜
- **definition:** sweet; sugary; honeyed; pleasing
- **pinyin:** tián
- **components:**
  - 舌
    - shé
    - tongue
  - 甘
    - gān
    - sweet
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogrammic compound (會意/会意)
  - **description:** semantic: 舌 ‘tongue’ + 甘 ‘sweet’; rearrangement of 甛.
  - **interpretation:** Combines the ideas of a tongue and sweetness, evoking the tongue sensing a sweet taste. The earlier form 甛 was visually rearranged into the modern layout 甜.
- **examples:**
  - 这茶很甜，不需要加糖(這茶很甜，不需要加糖)。
    - Zhè chá hěn tián, bù xūyào jiā táng.
    - This tea is sweet; no sugar is needed.
  - 孩子的笑容很甜，让人感到温暖(孩子的笑容很甜，讓人感到溫暖)。
    - Háizi de xiàoróng hěn tián, ràng rén gǎndào wēnnuǎn.
    - The child’s smile is sweet and makes people feel warm.
  - 这个蛋糕太甜了，我更喜欢清淡一点的口味(這個蛋糕太甜了，我更喜歡清淡一點的口味)。
    - Zhège dàngāo tài tián le, wǒ gèng xǐhuan qīngdàn yìdiǎn de kǒuwèi.
    - This cake is too sweet; I prefer a lighter flavor.
### 甜菜 → 甜 → 舌
- **definition:** tongue
- **pinyin:** shé
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a forked tongue emerging upwards from a mouth (口)
  - **interpretation:** Graph depicts a tongue sticking up from an open mouth, with the fork hinting at the split tip. Later forms stylized the drawing, but the mouth element remains visible at the bottom; it is unrelated to 舍.
- **examples:**
  - 医生让他伸出舌头检查(醫生讓他伸出舌頭檢查)。
    - Yīshēng ràng tā shēnchū shétou jiǎnchá.
    - The doctor asked him to stick out his tongue for an exam.
  - 辣得我舌头发麻(辣得我舌頭發麻)。
    - Là de wǒ shétou fā má.
    - It’s so spicy that my tongue is numb.
  - 紧张得他舌头打结了(緊張得他舌頭打結了)。
    - Jǐnzhāng de tā shétou dǎjié le.
    - He was so nervous that his tongue got tied.
### 甜菜 → 甜 → 舌 → 口
- **definition:** mouth
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 甜菜 → 甜 → 甘
- **definition:** sweet
- **pinyin:** gān
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogram (指事)
  - **description:** Something sweet in an open mouth; original drawing 𠁿; original form of 含.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts an open mouth tasting sweetness, which directly yields the sense ‘sweet’. The early form 𠁿 later developed into 含 ‘to contain/hold in the mouth’, reflecting the same mouth-centered idea.
- **examples:**
  - 这水很甘甜(這水很甘甜)。
    - Zhè shuǐ hěn gāntián.
    - This water is very sweet.
  - 我们在田里种了甘蔗(我們在田裡種了甘蔗)。
    - Wǒmen zài tián lǐ zhòng le gānzhè.
    - We planted sugarcane in the field.
  - 他甘心为家人付出(他甘心為家人付出)。
    - Tā gānxīn wèi jiārén fùchū.
    - He is willing to make sacrifices for his family.
### 甜菜 → 菜
- **definition:** vegetable; dish; cuisine; greens
- **pinyin:** cài
- **components:**
  - 采
    - cǎi
    - to pick; gather
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 艹 (“grass; plant”) + phonetic: 采.
  - **interpretation:** The grass/plant radical signals a meaning related to vegetation and edible greens. 采 supplies the sound for cài and also hints at the idea of picking or gathering plants.
- **examples:**
  - 我去市场买菜(我去市場買菜)。
    - Wǒ qù shìchǎng mǎi cài.
    - I’m going to the market to buy vegetables.
  - 这道菜很辣(這道菜很辣)。
    - Zhè dào cài hěn là.
    - This dish is very spicy.
  - 我喜欢川菜(我喜歡川菜)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan Chuāncài.
    - I like Sichuan cuisine.
### 甜菜 → 菜 → 采
- **definition:** to pick; gather
- **pinyin:** cǎi
- **components:**
  - 爪
    - zhǎo
    - claw; hand
  - 木
    - mù
    - wood; tree
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (会意)
  - **description:** semantic: 爫 ‘hand’ + 木 ‘tree’ (hand picking from a tree); current form reflects composition 2.
  - **interpretation:** A hand reaching down over a tree conveys the act of plucking fruit or leaves. The form standardized as 爫 over 木, preserving the idea of gathering by hand.
  - **simplification:** Traditional for this sense is 採; PRC simplified 採 → 采 by dropping the hand radical 扌, reusing the older base form and reducing strokes.
- **examples:**
  - 春天农民到茶园采茶叶(春天農民到茶園採茶葉)。
    - Chūntiān nóngmín dào cháyuán cǎi cháyè.
    - In spring, farmers go to the tea gardens to pick tea leaves.
  - 孩子们在树林里采蘑菇(孩子們在樹林裡採蘑菇)。
    - Háizimen zài shùlín lǐ cǎi mógu.
    - The children gather mushrooms in the woods.
  - 她清晨去山上采野花(她清晨去山上採野花)。
    - Tā qīngchén qù shān shang cǎi yěhuā.
    - She goes to the mountains at dawn to pick wildflowers.
### 甜菜 → 菜 → 采 → 爪
- **definition:** claw; hand
- **pinyin:** zhǎo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – a hand grabbing from above (earlier forms from the side); compare 手, 寸, 九.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts an overhead view of fingers curved downward in a grasping motion, originally representing a human hand. The sense broadened to include animal claws, which is why it now names claws/talons and functions as the ‘claw’ radical in many compounds.
- **examples:**
  - 猫的爪子很锋利(貓的爪子很鋒利)。
    - Māo de zhuǎzi hěn fēnglì.
    - A cat’s claws are very sharp.
  - 我买了一包鸡爪当小吃(我買了一包雞爪當小吃)。
    - Wǒ mǎile yī bāo jīzhuǎ dāng xiǎochī.
    - I bought a bag of chicken feet as a snack.
  - 地上有一串小狗的爪印(地上有一串小狗的爪印)。
    - Dì shàng yǒu yī chuàn xiǎogǒu de zhuǎyìn.
    - There is a trail of puppy paw prints on the ground.
### 甜菜 → 菜 → 采 → 木
- **definition:** wood; tree
- **pinyin:** mù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram (象形)
  - **description:** a tree: branches on top, roots on the bottom (more visible in earlier forms).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a tree with spreading branches above and roots below, as seen clearly in early scripts. The vertical stroke is the trunk, while the short horizontal strokes became stylized limbs and roots in the regular form.
- **examples:**
  - 这张桌子是木头做的(這張桌子是木頭做的)。
    - Zhè zhāng zhuōzi shì mùtou zuò de.
    - This table is made of wood.
  - 山上长满了树木(山上長滿了樹木)。
    - Shān shang zhǎng mǎn le shùmù.
    - The mountainside is covered with trees.
  - 木材被运到工厂加工(木材被運到工廠加工)。
    - Mùcái bèi yùn dào gōngchǎng jiāgōng.
    - The timber was transported to the factory for processing.

## 红菜头(紅菜頭)

## beetroot
### hóngcàitóu
---
- **definition:** beetroot
- **pinyin:** hóngcàitóu
- **components:**
  - 红(紅)
    - hóng
    - red; popular; revolutionary; blush
  - 菜
    - cài
    - vegetable; dish; cuisine; greens
  - 头(頭)
    - tóu
    - head; top; first; end
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 红 + 菜 + 头 = red + vegetable + head (bulb/root).
  - **interpretation:** Literally ‘red vegetable head,’ highlighting the beet’s deep‑red, bulbous root. 头 here functions as a colloquial suffix for a rounded/root part of a plant.
  - **simplification:** Standard character simplifications to reduce strokes: 紅→红 (糸→纟), 頭→头; 菜 unchanged.
- **examples:**
  - 我买了两个红菜头(我買了兩個紅菜頭)。
    - Wǒ mǎi le liǎng gè hóngcàitóu.
    - I bought two beetroots.
  - 红菜头汁颜色很浓(紅菜頭汁顏色很濃)，味道甜中带土香(味道甜中帶土香)。
    - Hóngcàitóu zhī yánsè hěn nóng, wèidào tián zhōng dài tǔ xiāng.
    - Beetroot juice has a deep color and tastes sweet with an earthy aroma.
  - 我们用红菜头做沙拉(我們用紅菜頭做沙拉)，也可以炖汤(也可以燉湯)。
    - Wǒmen yòng hóngcàitóu zuò shālā, yě kěyǐ dùn tāng.
    - We make salad with beetroot, and it can also be stewed in soup.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 红(紅)
- **definition:** red; popular; revolutionary; blush
- **pinyin:** hóng
- **components:**
  - 糸
    - mì
    - silk
  - 工
    - gōng
    - work
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 糸 (silk) + phonetic: 工
  - **interpretation:** Combines the silk component 糸 with 工 as the phonetic, pointing to a reading similar to gōng in Old Chinese and associating the meaning with textiles. The color sense likely came from the hue of dyed silk, later extending to figurative uses like popularity and revolutionary connotations.
  - **simplification:** Simplified from 紅 by reducing 糹 to 纟 to lower stroke count and standardize the silk radical in simplified characters.
- **examples:**
  - 她脸红了(她臉紅了)。
    - Tā liǎn hóng le.
    - Her face turned red.
  - 这部电影很红(這部電影很紅)。
    - Zhè bù diànyǐng hěn hóng.
    - This movie is very popular.
  - 他在网上走红(他在網上走紅)。
    - Tā zài wǎngshàng zǒu hóng.
    - He went viral online.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 红(紅) → 糸
- **definition:** silk
- **pinyin:** mì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** a skein of silk.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a bundle of silk threads tied in the middle, with strands hanging above and below. The stylized sketch highlights twisted filaments, which later served as the standard radical for thread- and textile-related characters.
  - **simplification:** In Simplified Chinese the silk radical was streamlined to 纟 to reduce strokes and speed writing; 糸 is rarely used independently, but 纟 replaces it as a left-side component.
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢丝绸(我喜歡絲綢)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan sīchóu.
    - I like silk fabrics.
  - 这件衣服是用蚕丝做的(這件衣服是用蠶絲做的)。
    - Zhè jiàn yīfu shì yòng cánsī zuò de.
    - This piece of clothing is made from silkworm silk.
  - 丝线很细(絲線很細)。
    - Sīxiàn hěn xì.
    - Silk thread is very thin.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 红(紅) → 工
- **definition:** work
- **pinyin:** gōng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a bladed tool to plow and mark a border; alternatively a carpenter’s square (cf. original meaning of 巨).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a tool used to prepare the ground and set boundaries, naturally extending to the idea of labor and work. Some traditions instead see a carpenter’s square, connecting it with making and constructing, and with early senses linked to 巨.
- **examples:**
  - 我在工厂工作(我在工廠工作)。
    - Wǒ zài gōngchǎng gōngzuò.
    - I work in a factory.
  - 这些工人正在劳动(這些工人正在勞動)。
    - Zhèxiē gōngrén zhèngzài láodòng.
    - These workers are laboring now.
  - 他的工钱很高(他的工錢很高)。
    - Tā de gōngqián hěn gāo.
    - His wages are high.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 菜
- **definition:** vegetable; dish; cuisine; greens
- **pinyin:** cài
- **components:**
  - 采
    - cǎi
    - to pick; gather
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 艹 (“grass; plant”) + phonetic: 采.
  - **interpretation:** The grass/plant radical signals a meaning related to vegetation and edible greens. 采 supplies the sound for cài and also hints at the idea of picking or gathering plants.
- **examples:**
  - 我去市场买菜(我去市場買菜)。
    - Wǒ qù shìchǎng mǎi cài.
    - I’m going to the market to buy vegetables.
  - 这道菜很辣(這道菜很辣)。
    - Zhè dào cài hěn là.
    - This dish is very spicy.
  - 我喜欢川菜(我喜歡川菜)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuan Chuāncài.
    - I like Sichuan cuisine.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 菜 → 采
- **definition:** to pick; gather
- **pinyin:** cǎi
- **components:**
  - 爪
    - zhǎo
    - claw; hand
  - 木
    - mù
    - wood; tree
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound (会意)
  - **description:** semantic: 爫 ‘hand’ + 木 ‘tree’ (hand picking from a tree); current form reflects composition 2.
  - **interpretation:** A hand reaching down over a tree conveys the act of plucking fruit or leaves. The form standardized as 爫 over 木, preserving the idea of gathering by hand.
  - **simplification:** Traditional for this sense is 採; PRC simplified 採 → 采 by dropping the hand radical 扌, reusing the older base form and reducing strokes.
- **examples:**
  - 春天农民到茶园采茶叶(春天農民到茶園採茶葉)。
    - Chūntiān nóngmín dào cháyuán cǎi cháyè.
    - In spring, farmers go to the tea gardens to pick tea leaves.
  - 孩子们在树林里采蘑菇(孩子們在樹林裡採蘑菇)。
    - Háizimen zài shùlín lǐ cǎi mógu.
    - The children gather mushrooms in the woods.
  - 她清晨去山上采野花(她清晨去山上採野花)。
    - Tā qīngchén qù shān shang cǎi yěhuā.
    - She goes to the mountains at dawn to pick wildflowers.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 菜 → 采 → 爪
- **definition:** claw; hand
- **pinyin:** zhǎo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram – a hand grabbing from above (earlier forms from the side); compare 手, 寸, 九.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts an overhead view of fingers curved downward in a grasping motion, originally representing a human hand. The sense broadened to include animal claws, which is why it now names claws/talons and functions as the ‘claw’ radical in many compounds.
- **examples:**
  - 猫的爪子很锋利(貓的爪子很鋒利)。
    - Māo de zhuǎzi hěn fēnglì.
    - A cat’s claws are very sharp.
  - 我买了一包鸡爪当小吃(我買了一包雞爪當小吃)。
    - Wǒ mǎile yī bāo jīzhuǎ dāng xiǎochī.
    - I bought a bag of chicken feet as a snack.
  - 地上有一串小狗的爪印(地上有一串小狗的爪印)。
    - Dì shàng yǒu yī chuàn xiǎogǒu de zhuǎyìn.
    - There is a trail of puppy paw prints on the ground.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 菜 → 采 → 木
- **definition:** wood; tree
- **pinyin:** mù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram (象形)
  - **description:** a tree: branches on top, roots on the bottom (more visible in earlier forms).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a tree with spreading branches above and roots below, as seen clearly in early scripts. The vertical stroke is the trunk, while the short horizontal strokes became stylized limbs and roots in the regular form.
- **examples:**
  - 这张桌子是木头做的(這張桌子是木頭做的)。
    - Zhè zhāng zhuōzi shì mùtou zuò de.
    - This table is made of wood.
  - 山上长满了树木(山上長滿了樹木)。
    - Shān shang zhǎng mǎn le shùmù.
    - The mountainside is covered with trees.
  - 木材被运到工厂加工(木材被運到工廠加工)。
    - Mùcái bèi yùn dào gōngchǎng jiāgōng.
    - The timber was transported to the factory for processing.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 头(頭)
- **definition:** head; top; first; end
- **pinyin:** tóu
- **components:**
  - 大
    - dà
    - big; great
  - 页(頁)
    - yè
    - page; leaf
  - 豆
    - dòu
    - bean
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** simplified from cursive form of 頭
  - **description:** Simplified from 頭: 豆 (phonetic) → ⺀; 頁/页 (semantic “head”) → 大. Traditional 頭 is phono-semantic: semantic 頁 + phonetic 豆.
  - **interpretation:** A cursive abbreviation of 頭 where the original phonetic 豆 was reduced to a dot-like stroke and the semantic 頁/页 was streamlined to 大. The simplification preserves overall silhouette while dropping the original phonetic-semantic clarity.
  - **simplification:** Cursive-derived stroke reduction to ease writing: 豆 → ⺀ and 頁/页 → 大; merges and streamlines parts of 頭.
- **examples:**
  - 我头疼了(我頭疼了)。
    - Wǒ tóu téng le.
    - My head aches.
  - 他站在队伍的最前头(他站在隊伍的最前頭)。
    - Tā zhàn zài duìwu de zuì qián tou.
    - He is standing at the very front of the line.
  - 这条路的尽头是海边(這條路的盡頭是海邊)。
    - Zhè tiáo lù de jìntóu shì hǎibiān.
    - At the end of this road is the seaside.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 头(頭) → 大
- **definition:** big; great
- **pinyin:** dà
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a person facing forward; original form of 夫, later phonetically borrowed for “big”.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicts a human figure viewed from the front, not necessarily with exaggerated outstretched arms. The graph was later borrowed to write the word pronounced dà ‘big’, while 夫 specialized for ‘man’. The modern shape still evokes a torso with two legs and an arm stroke.
- **examples:**
  - 这个房间很大(這個房間很大)。
    - Zhège fángjiān hěn dà.
    - This room is very big.
  - 他是我们家最大的孩子(他是我們家最大的孩子)。
    - Tā shì wǒmen jiā zuì dà de háizi.
    - He is the eldest child in our family.
  - 大学开学了(大學開學了)。
    - Dàxué kāixué le.
    - The university term has begun.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 头(頭) → 页(頁)
- **definition:** page; leaf
- **pinyin:** yè
- **components:**
  - 首
    - shǒu
    - head; first
  - 卩
    - jié
    - seal; kneeling person
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形): 首 + 卩 – head of a kneeling person, emphasising “head”.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a kneeling figure with the head highlighted, conveying the idea of 'head'. Later it was borrowed to write 'page/sheet' (via the popular form of 葉), while the original 'head' sense survives mainly in the radical and historical usage.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by adopting the cursive-derived graph 页 from 頁, reducing strokes for easier writing; meaning remained the same.
- **examples:**
  - 请翻到第三页(請翻到第三頁)。
    - Qǐng fān dào dì sān yè.
    - Please turn to page three.
  - 这本书的页码印错了(這本書的頁碼印錯了)。
    - Zhè běn shū de yèmǎ yìn cuò le.
    - The page numbers in this book were misprinted.
  - 这个网页打不开(這個網頁打不開)。
    - Zhège wǎngyè dǎ bù kāi.
    - This webpage won’t open.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 头(頭) → 页(頁) → 首
- **definition:** head; first
- **pinyin:** shǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram of an animal head with a long mouth and horns; later standardized from 𩠐 with hair 巛 simplified to 丷.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a head seen from the front, with hair or mane on top and a protruding snout, which motivated the meaning ‘head’. As writing was regularized, the hair lines were reduced from 巛 to two dots 丷, and the sense broadened to ‘first’ in the sense of the foremost or leader.
- **examples:**
  - 她在比赛中夺得首位(她在比賽中奪得首位)。
    - Tā zài bǐsài zhōng duó dé shǒuwèi.
    - She took first place in the competition.
  - 首都北京历史悠久(首都北京歷史悠久)。
    - Shǒudū Běijīng lìshǐ yōujiǔ.
    - The capital, Beijing, has a long history.
  - 为了安全，首要任务是撤离(為了安全，首要任務是撤離)。
    - Wèile ānquán, shǒuyào rènwù shì chèlí.
    - For safety, the primary task is to evacuate.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 头(頭) → 页(頁) → 卩
- **definition:** seal; kneeling person
- **pinyin:** jié
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a kneeling person from side view; similar but unrelated to 欠 and 女; see also 即; unrelated to 报.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person kneeling in profile, with the bent leg and upright torso stylized into the compact form. As a component it often signals the seal/kneeling-person radical in right-side positions, without implying any relation to look-alikes such as 欠 or 女.
- **examples:**
  - 古文字里，"卩"像侧身跪着的人(古文字裡，"卩"像側身跪著的人)。
    - Gǔ wénzì lǐ, "卩" xiàng cèshēn guìzhe de rén.
    - In ancient scripts, "卩" looks like a person kneeling in profile.
  - 在现代汉字中，卩多作部首，常放在字的右侧(在現代漢字中，卩多作部首，常放在字的右側)。
    - Zài xiàndài hànzì zhōng, jié duō zuò bùshǒu, cháng fàng zài zì de yòucè.
    - In modern Chinese characters, 卩 mostly functions as a radical, often placed on the right side.
  - 例如，即、却等字都含有卩(例如，即、卻等字都含有卩)。
    - Lìrú, jí, què děng zì dōu hányǒu jié.
    - For example, characters like 即 and 却 contain 卩.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 头(頭) → 豆
- **definition:** bean
- **pinyin:** dòu
- **components:**
  - 二
    - èr
    - two
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth; opening
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: some kind of container; later borrowed phonetically for ‘bean’; displaced Old Chinese 菽 (shū); unrelated to the bottom of 豊.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicted a lidded vessel or ceremonial container. Its sound was later borrowed to write the word for beans/legumes, supplanting the older term 菽, while the pictorial container form remained.
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢吃黄豆和黑豆(我喜歡吃黃豆和黑豆)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuān chī huángdòu hé hēidòu.
    - I like to eat soybeans and black beans.
  - 这道甜品是用红豆煮成的(這道甜品是用紅豆煮成的)。
    - Zhè dào tiánpǐn shì yòng hóngdòu zhǔ chéng de.
    - This dessert is made with red beans.
  - 豆类富含蛋白质，对素食者很重要(豆類富含蛋白質，對素食者很重要)。
    - Dòulèi fùhán dànbáizhì, duì sùshízhě hěn zhòngyào.
    - Legumes are rich in protein and are important for vegetarians.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 头(頭) → 豆 → 二
- **definition:** two
- **pinyin:** èr
- **components:**
  - 一
    - yī
    - one
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** ideogram: two parallel strokes; duplication of 一.
  - **interpretation:** Two horizontal lines directly depict the quantity ‘two’ as simple tally marks. It parallels 一 and 三 as incremental strokes, with historical 亖 for four, emphasizing straightforward counting by repetition.
- **examples:**
  - 今天是二月二日(今天是二月二日)。
    - Jīntiān shì èr yuè èr rì.
    - Today is February 2nd.
  - 我住在二楼(我住在二樓)。
    - Wǒ zhù zài èr lóu.
    - I live on the second floor.
  - 二加二等于四(二加二等於四)。
    - Èr jiā èr děngyú sì.
    - Two plus two equals four.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 头(頭) → 豆 → 二 → 一
- **definition:** one
- **pinyin:** yī
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** a horizontal stroke, indicating the number 'one'.
  - **interpretation:** A single horizontal line visually represents the concept of oneness. As the simplest numeral, it set the pattern for 二 and 三 by repeating the stroke to show increasing quantity.
- **examples:**
  - 我只有一本书(我只有一本書)。
    - Wǒ zhǐ yǒu yì běn shū.
    - I only have one book.
  - 他一到就给我打电话(他一到就給我打電話)。
    - Tā yí dào jiù gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
    - As soon as he arrives, he calls me.
  - 一个问题都没有(一個問題都沒有)。
    - Yí gè wèntí dōu méiyǒu.
    - There isn’t a single problem.
### 红菜头(紅菜頭) → 头(頭) → 豆 → 口
- **definition:** mouth; opening
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.

### yànmàizhōu
---
- **definition:** oatmeal porridge
- **pinyin:** yànmàizhōu
- **components:**
  - 燕
    - yàn
    - swallow (bird); State of Yān (ancient); surname; northern region around Yan
  - 麦(麥)
    - mài
    - wheat; cereal grains; barley (as in 大麦); malt
  - 粥
    - zhōu
    - porridge; congee; gruel; thin cereal soup
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 燕麦 (oats) + 粥 (porridge) = oatmeal porridge
  - **interpretation:** Refers to porridge made from oats; 燕麦 names the grain, historically associated with the northern state of 燕. Emphasizes the ingredient rather than the cooking method.
  - **simplification:** Only 麥 was simplified to 麦 by reducing strokes in the grain component; 燕 and 粥 are unchanged.
- **examples:**
  - 早上喝一碗热腾腾的燕麦粥最暖胃(早上喝一碗熱騰騰的燕麥粥最暖胃)。
    - Zǎoshang hē yì wǎn rè téngténg de yànmài zhōu zuì nuǎnwèi.
    - A hot bowl of oatmeal porridge in the morning warms the stomach.
  - 用牛奶煮燕麦粥，更香更顺滑(用牛奶煮燕麥粥，更香更順滑)。
    - Yòng niúnǎi zhǔ yànmài zhōu, gèng xiāng gèng shùnhuá.
    - Cooking oatmeal porridge with milk makes it more fragrant and smoother.
  - 燕麦粥富含膳食纤维，有助于保持饱腹感(燕麥粥富含膳食纖維，有助於保持飽腹感)。
    - Yànmài zhōu fùhán shànshí xiānwéi, yǒuzhù yú bǎochí bǎofùgǎn.
    - Oatmeal porridge is rich in dietary fiber and helps maintain a feeling of fullness.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 燕
- **definition:** swallow (bird); State of Yān (ancient); surname; northern region around Yan
- **pinyin:** yàn
- **components:**
  - 廿
    - niàn
    - twenty
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
  - 北
    - běi
    - north
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a swallow
  - **interpretation:** Early forms sketched the bird with spread wings and a forked tail; later script styles stylized these features into the present structure. Its meaning broadened from the bird to the ancient State of Yān, the northern region associated with it, and a surname.
- **examples:**
  - 我看见一只燕子在屋檐下筑巢(我看見一隻燕子在屋簷下築巢)。
    - Wǒ kànjiàn yì zhī yànzi zài wūyán xià zhùcháo.
    - I saw a swallow building a nest under the eaves.
  - 战国时的燕国在今天的北京一带(戰國時的燕國在今天的北京一帶)。
    - Zhànguó shí de Yàn Guó zài jīntiān de Běijīng yídài.
    - The State of Yan in the Warring States period was in the area of present-day Beijing.
  - 他姓燕(他姓燕)。
    - Tā xìng Yàn.
    - His surname is Yan.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 燕 → 廿
- **definition:** twenty
- **pinyin:** niàn
- **components:**
  - 十
    - shí
    - ten
  - 一
    - yī
    - one
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** Two 十 (“ten”) written side by side, with a horizontal stroke at the bottom that fuses them; see also 卅. In characters such as 漢 and 黄, it represents 口, while in 度 and 席 it represents a stylized 石.
  - **interpretation:** Two tens placed together communicate the value twenty, with the bottom stroke uniting them into a single form. As a component, the shape can be borrowed to stand for a mouth (口) or a rock (石) depending on historical usage in different characters.
- **examples:**
  - 今天是农历廿一日(今天是農曆廿一日)。
    - Jīntiān shì nónglì niàn yī rì.
    - Today is the twenty-first day of the lunar month.
  - 他已经在此居住廿年(他已經在此居住廿年)。
    - Tā yǐjīng zài cǐ jūzhù niàn nián.
    - He has lived here for twenty years.
  - 会议将在本月廿五日举行(會議將在本月廿五日舉行)。
    - Huìyì jiāng zài běn yuè niàn wǔ rì jǔxíng.
    - The meeting will be held on the twenty-fifth of this month.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 燕 → 廿 → 十
- **definition:** ten
- **pinyin:** shí
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phonetic loan (rebus)
  - **description:** Originally a vertical stroke later crossed by 一; possibly a pictogram of a needle, rebus-borrowed for the word ‘ten’.
  - **interpretation:** Early forms may have depicted a needle, and that form’s sound was repurposed to write the word for “ten.” The cross shape developed when a horizontal stroke was added to the original vertical line.
- **examples:**

  - 现在是十点(現在是十點)。
    - Xiànzài shì shí diǎn.
    - It is ten o’clock now.
  - 我们十个人一起去(我們十個人一起去)。
    - Wǒmen shí ge rén yìqǐ qù.
    - Ten of us are going together.

### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 燕 → 北
- **definition:** north

- **components:**
  - 人
    - rén

- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** Two men back to back; originally meaning “back” (now written 背).
  - **interpretation:** Two figures face away from each other, conveying the notion of turning one’s back. In traditional orientation where one faces south, the ‘back’ side corresponds to the north, so the graph shifted to denote the direction.
- **examples:**
  - 我们向北走(我們向北走)。
    - Wǒmen xiàng běi zǒu.
    - We walk north.
  - 北京在中国的北部(北京在中國的北部)。
    - Běijīng zài Zhōngguó de běibù.
    - Beijing is in the north of China.
  - 冬天从北面吹来的风很冷(冬天從北面吹來的風很冷)。
    - Dōngtiān cóng běimiàn chuī lái de fēng hěn lěng.
    - In winter, winds blowing from the north are very cold.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 燕 → 北 → 人
- **definition:** person
- **pinyin:** rén
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: side view of a standing man, highlighting an arm and a leg; left-side form 亻.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person in profile, with one stroke suggesting the torso/arm and the other the leg, hence the slightly splayed shape. In compounds it often appears as the left-hand form 亻 to mark human-related meaning; not to be confused with 彳.
- **examples:**
  - 他是一个很好的人(他是一個很好的人)。
    - Tā shì yí gè hěn hǎo de rén.
    - He is a very good person.
  - 我认识很多人(我認識很多人)。
    - Wǒ rènshi hěn duō rén.
    - I know many people.
  - 这里有三个人(這裡有三個人)。
    - Zhèlǐ yǒu sān gè rén.
    - There are three people here.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 麦(麥)
- **definition:** wheat; cereal grains; barley (as in 大麦); malt
- **pinyin:** mài
- **components:**
  - 來
    - lái
    - to come
  - 夊
    - suī
    - to walk slowly
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 夊 (‘slow step’) + phonetic: 來; 來 was originally used for ‘wheat’.
  - **interpretation:** Meaning is anchored by a ‘slow step/footprint’ semantic hint that evokes reaping or drooping stalks, while 來 supplies the sound. In early usage, 來 itself denoted ‘wheat’, which explains the tight semantic link that later specialized into 麥/麦.
  - **simplification:** Simplified from 麥 by streamlining the phonetic 來 and altering its 八 component to a single horizontal stroke (per Wiktionary), reducing strokes and compressing the original phono-semantic layout into 麦.
- **examples:**
  - 我家种了很多小麦(我家種了很多小麥)。
    - Wǒ jiā zhòng le hěn duō xiǎomài.
    - My family planted a lot of wheat.
  - 啤酒的麦芽很香(啤酒的麥芽很香)。
    - Píjiǔ de màiyá hěn xiāng.
    - The malt in the beer smells fragrant.
  - 大麦和小麦都是重要的粮食作物(大麥和小麥都是重要的糧食作物)。
    - Dàmài hé xiǎomài dōu shì zhòngyào de liángshí zuòwù.
    - Barley and wheat are both important food crops.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 麦(麥) → 來
- **definition:** to come
- **pinyin:** lái
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram of wheat: middle line = ear, upward lines = leaves, downward lines = stem/roots; sometimes an extra top line. Borrowed early to mean “to come”; later additions like 止/辵 were not retained.
  - **interpretation:** Originally drew a stalk of wheat, with the central stroke as the ear and other strokes as leaves, stem, and roots. It was borrowed early to write “to come,” while 麥 later carried the grain meaning; their similar Old Chinese onsets likely facilitated the semantic shift.
  - **simplification:** Simplified to 来 by reducing and regularizing strokes, following common clerical/cursive forms to lower stroke count and ease writing.
- **examples:**
  - 请你早点来(請你早點來)。
    - Qǐng nǐ zǎodiǎn lái.
    - Please come earlier.
  - 他今天从上海来开会(他今天從上海來開會)。
    - Tā jīntiān cóng Shànghǎi lái kāihuì.
    - He came from Shanghai to attend a meeting.
  - 如果你有时间，明天再来我们家坐坐(如果你有時間，明天再來我們家坐坐)。
    - Rúguǒ nǐ yǒu shíjiān, míngtiān zài lái wǒmen jiā zuòzuo.
    - If you have time, come to our place again tomorrow for a visit.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 麦(麥) → 夊
- **definition:** to walk slowly
- **pinyin:** suī
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram—footprint (pointing down); variant of 夂. Compare 止 (leg up) and 𡕒 (toe left).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a downward-pointing footprint, evoking a trailing, unhurried step. Its orientation sets it apart from related foot forms, aligning with the sense of slow, following movement.
- **examples:**
  - 他慢慢走(他慢慢走)。
    - Tā mànman zǒu.
    - He walks slowly.
  - 她步履缓慢(她步履緩慢)。
    - Tā bùlǚ huǎnmàn.
    - Her steps are slow.
  - 孩子跟在后面，徐徐而行(孩子跟在後面，徐徐而行)。
    - Háizi gēn zài hòumiàn, xúxú ér xíng.
    - The child follows behind, moving slowly.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 粥
- **definition:** porridge; congee; gruel; thin cereal soup
- **pinyin:** zhōu
- **components:**
  - 米
    - mǐ
    - rice
  - 弓
    - gōng
    - bow
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** Reduced form of 鬻 ‘congee’ (ideogrammic compound).
  - **interpretation:** A streamlined graphic descended from 鬻, which depicted the idea of porridge through meaningful elements rather than sound. Its meaning comes from the image of rice-based gruel, not from a phonetic clue.
- **examples:**
  - 早上我喜欢喝一碗热粥(早上我喜歡喝一碗熱粥)。
    - Zǎoshang wǒ xǐhuān hē yì wǎn rè zhōu.
    - In the morning I like to drink a bowl of hot congee.
  - 生病时，他只吃白粥(生病時，他只吃白粥)。
    - Shēngbìng shí, tā zhǐ chī bái zhōu.
    - When sick, he only eats plain congee.
  - 这家店的皮蛋瘦肉粥很有名(這家店的皮蛋瘦肉粥很有名)。
    - Zhè jiā diàn de pídàn shòuròu zhōu hěn yǒumíng.
    - This shop’s century egg and lean pork congee is very famous.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 粥 → 米
- **definition:** rice
- **pinyin:** mǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: dehusked rice kernels; horizontal stroke as a bamboo sieve; cf. 粟 (with husk); unrelated to 木/禾/来.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts dehusked rice grains being sifted on a bamboo sieve, contrasting with 粟 which shows husked kernels. Despite visual resemblance, its form is not derived from 木, 禾, or 来.
- **examples:**
  - 我买了两斤米(我買了兩斤米)。
    - Wǒ mǎi le liǎng jīn mǐ.
    - I bought two jin of rice.
  - 这家店的东北米很香(這家店的東北米很香)。
    - Zhè jiā diàn de Dōngběi mǐ hěn xiāng.
    - The Northeastern rice at this shop is very fragrant.
  - 请把米洗一洗(請把米洗一洗)，再煮饭(再煮飯)。
    - Qǐng bǎ mǐ xǐ yì xǐ, zài zhǔ fàn.
    - Please rinse the rice, then cook it.
### 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) → 粥 → 弓
- **definition:** bow
- **pinyin:** gōng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a bow.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts the curved bow and its string in a simple outline. The shape evokes the bend and draw of archery and later serves as a component in characters related to pulling or shooting.
- **examples:**
  - 他拉开弓(他拉開弓)。
    - Tā lā kāi gōng.
    - He draws the bow.
  - 弓箭手瞄准目标(弓箭手瞄準目標)。
    - Gōngjiànshǒu miáozhǔn mùbiāo.
    - The archer aims at the target.
  - 这把弓很结实(這把弓很結實)。
    - Zhè bǎ gōng hěn jiēshi.
    - This bow is very sturdy.

## coconut milk
### yēnǎi
---
- **definition:** coconut milk
- **pinyin:** yēnǎi
- **components:**
  - 椰
    - yē
    - coconut; coconut palm; palm tree; coconut-related
  - 奶
    - nǎi
    - milk; breast; to breastfeed; (paternal) grandmother
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 椰(coconut) + 奶(milk) = coconut milk (liquid from coconut flesh).
  - **interpretation:** Refers to the rich white liquid expressed from grated coconut flesh, common in desserts and curries. Distinct from 椰子水, the clear liquid inside a fresh coconut.
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢喝椰奶(我喜歡喝椰奶)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuān hē yēnǎi.
    - I like to drink coconut milk.
  - 这道咖喱用椰奶增添香味(這道咖哩用椰奶增添香味)。
    - Zhè dào gālí yòng yēnǎi zēngtiān xiāngwèi.
    - This curry uses coconut milk to add aroma and flavor.
  - 别把椰奶和椰子水混淆(別把椰奶和椰子水混淆)。
    - Bié bǎ yēnǎi hé yēzi shuǐ hùnxiáo.
    - Don't confuse coconut milk with coconut water.
### 椰奶 → 椰
- **definition:** coconut; coconut palm; palm tree; coconut-related
- **pinyin:** yē
- **components:**
  - 木
    - mù
    - wood; tree
  - 耶
    - yé
    - interrogative particle; used in transliterations
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 木 ("tree") + phonetic: 耶 (OC *laː)
  - **interpretation:** 木 signals a wood/tree-related meaning, fitting a palm or coconut tree. 耶 contributes the sound; through historical shifts from its Old Chinese reading, it guides the modern pronunciation yē rather than adding meaning.
- **examples:**
  - 我买了两个椰子(我買了兩個椰子)。
    - Wǒ mǎile liǎng gè yēzi.
    - I bought two coconuts.
  - 海边的椰树在风中摇摆(海邊的椰樹在風中搖擺)。
    - Hǎibiān de yēshù zài fēng zhōng yáobǎi.
    - The palm trees by the seaside sway in the wind.
  - 这款饮料用新鲜椰奶制成(這款飲料用新鮮椰奶製成)。
    - Zhè kuǎn yǐnliào yòng xīnxiān yēnǎi zhìchéng.
    - This drink is made with fresh coconut milk.
### 椰奶 → 椰 → 木
- **definition:** wood; tree
- **pinyin:** mù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Pictogram (象形)
  - **description:** a tree: branches on top, roots on the bottom (more visible in earlier forms).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a tree with spreading branches above and roots below, as seen clearly in early scripts. The vertical stroke is the trunk, while the short horizontal strokes became stylized limbs and roots in the regular form.
- **examples:**
  - 这张桌子是木头做的(這張桌子是木頭做的)。
    - Zhè zhāng zhuōzi shì mùtou zuò de.
    - This table is made of wood.
  - 山上长满了树木(山上長滿了樹木)。
    - Shān shang zhǎng mǎn le shùmù.
    - The mountainside is covered with trees.
  - 木材被运到工厂加工(木材被運到工廠加工)。
    - Mùcái bèi yùn dào gōngchǎng jiāgōng.
    - The timber was transported to the factory for processing.
### 椰奶 → 椰 → 耶
- **definition:** interrogative particle; used in transliterations
- **pinyin:** yé
- **components:**
  - 耳
    - ěr
    - ear
  - 也
    - yě
    - also; too
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** corruption
  - **description:** Corruption of 邪 (OC *ljaː, *laː).
  - **interpretation:** A scribal corruption of 邪 that gained currency as an independent graph. It carried over a similar reading and came to serve as a sentence-final particle and as a phonetic element in transcriptions of foreign names.
- **examples:**
  - 此为何耶(此為何耶)。
    - Cǐ wèihé yé.
    - Why is this?
  - 他信奉耶稣(他信奉耶穌)。
    - Tā xìnfèng Yēsū.
    - He believes in Jesus.
  - 他们去了耶路撒冷(他們去了耶路撒冷)。
    - Tāmen qùle Yēlùsālěng.
    - They went to Jerusalem.
### 椰奶 → 椰 → 耶 → 耳
- **definition:** ear
- **pinyin:** ěr
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: an ear
  - **interpretation:** Sketches the side view of a human ear: the vertical stroke outlines the rim while shorter strokes suggest inner folds. Early forms were more curved and naturalistic; later writing regularized the lines but the image remains recognizable.
- **examples:**
  - 他耳朵疼(他耳朵疼)。
    - Tā ěrduo téng.
    - His ear hurts.
  - 戴上耳机(戴上耳機)，听音乐(聽音樂)。
    - Dài shàng ěrjī, tīng yīnyuè.
    - Put on headphones and listen to music.
  - 医生检查他的左耳(醫生檢查他的左耳)。
    - Yīshēng jiǎnchá tā de zuǒ ěr.
    - The doctor examined his left ear.
### 椰奶 → 椰 → 耶 → 也
- **definition:** also; too
- **pinyin:** yě
- **components:**
  - 子
    - zǐ
    - child; son
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a child (子) with an open mouth (口) crying; original form of 嗁 ‘to cry’. Arms were removed in bronze inscriptions and the components fused in the modern shape.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicted a crying child, combining the ideas of ‘child’ and ‘mouth’ to show wailing. Over time, the drawing simplified and the form was repurposed as a sentence-final particle and adverb meaning ‘also/too,’ while the crying sense survived in 嗁.
- **examples:**
  - 我也是学生(我也是學生)。
    - Wǒ yě shì xuéshēng.
    - I am also a student.
  - 他不去(他不去)，我也不去(我也不去)。
    - Tā bù qù, wǒ yě bù qù.
    - He isn’t going; I’m not going either.
  - 不仅她会唱歌(不僅她會唱歌)，他也会跳舞(他也會跳舞)。
    - Bùjǐn tā huì chànggē, tā yě huì tiàowǔ.
    - Not only can she sing, he can also dance.
### 椰奶 → 椰 → 耶 → 也 → 子
- **definition:** child; son
- **pinyin:** zǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: image of a baby with a large head and spread arms; legs wrapped in a blanket.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a swaddled baby with a prominent head and outstretched arms. Over time the figure was stylized into the modern form while still evoking an infant.
- **examples:**
  - 他是我唯一的儿子(他是我唯一的兒子)。
    - Tā shì wǒ wéiyī de érzi.
    - He is my only son.
  - 她抱起孩子(她抱起孩子)。
    - Tā bào qǐ háizi.
    - She picked up the child.
  - 这个孩子三岁了(這個孩子三歲了)。
    - Zhège háizi sān suì le.
    - This child is three years old.
### 椰奶 → 椰 → 耶 → 也 → 口
- **definition:** mouth
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 椰奶 → 奶
- **definition:** milk; breast; to breastfeed; (paternal) grandmother
- **pinyin:** nǎi
- **components:**
  - 女
    - nǚ
    - woman; female
  - 乃
    - nǎi
    - thus; then
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 女 + phonetic: 乃
  - **interpretation:** Combines the 'woman/female' semantic element with the sound value of 乃, pointing to meanings linked to mothers, breasts, and by extension milk or a nanny. The pronunciation follows 乃 while the 女 component anchors the maternal/feminine semantic field.
- **examples:**
  - 我早上常喝牛奶(我早上常喝牛奶)。
    - Wǒ zǎoshang cháng hē niúnǎi.
    - I often drink milk in the morning.
  - 孩子在吃奶，哭声渐小(孩子在吃奶，哭聲漸小)。
    - Háizi zài chī nǎi, kūshēng jiàn xiǎo.
    - The baby is nursing, and the crying is gradually fading.
  - 周末我们去看奶奶(週末我們去看奶奶)。
    - Zhōumò wǒmen qù kàn nǎinai.
    - We’re going to visit Grandma this weekend.
### 椰奶 → 奶 → 女
- **definition:** woman; female
- **pinyin:** nǚ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a woman with breasts kneeling or standing; modern form reversed from oracle forms, with the enclosed area as the remnant of the right breast and the left breast lost.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a female figure with a curved torso and a remaining breast, historically shown kneeling and later flipped to face right in standard script. Graphically related to 母 and 毋, which retain more breast/nipple detail, while the similar-looking 卩 is unrelated.
- **examples:**
  - 她是一个勇敢的女人(她是一個勇敢的女人)。
    - Tā shì yí gè yǒnggǎn de nǚrén.
    - She is a brave woman.
  - 他们有一个可爱的女儿(他們有一個可愛的女兒)，正在上小学(正在上小學)。
    - Tāmen yǒu yí gè kě'ài de nǚ'ér, zhèngzài shàng xiǎoxué.
    - They have a lovely daughter who is in primary school.
  - 这家公司的女员工很多(這家公司的女員工很多)，工作表现很出色(工作表現很出色)。
    - Zhè jiā gōngsī de nǚ yuángōng hěn duō, gōngzuò biǎoxiàn hěn chūsè.
    - This company has many female employees, and their work performance is outstanding.
### 椰奶 → 奶 → 乃
- **definition:** thus; then
- **pinyin:** nǎi
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** unknown
  - **description:** Original form 𠄎; origin uncertain; various theories; unrelated to 廴.
  - **interpretation:** Earliest forms show a simple curved graph written as 𠄎, but scholars disagree on what it was intended to depict. Despite visual similarity, it is not derived from 廴, and no consensus formation analysis has been established.
- **examples:**
  - 他思索再三，乃作决定(他思索再三，乃作決定)。
    - Tā sīsuǒ zàisān, nǎi zuò juédìng.
    - After much deliberation, he then made a decision.
  - 事已至此，乃下令撤退(事已至此，乃下令撤退)。
    - Shì yǐ zhì cǐ, nǎi xiàlìng chètuì.
    - Now that matters had come to this point, he then gave the order to retreat.
  - 君臣同心，乃能安邦(君臣同心，乃能安邦)。
    - Jūn chén tóngxīn, nǎi néng ān bāng.
    - Only when ruler and ministers are of one mind can the state be stabilized.

## 蚝油(蠔油)
---
## oyster sauce
### háoyóu
---
- **definition:** oyster sauce
- **pinyin:** háoyóu
- **components:**
  - 蚝(蠔)
    - háo
    - oyster; oyster meat; edible bivalve; dried oyster
  - 油
    - yóu
    - oil; grease; petroleum; sauce
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 蚝(蠔) ‘oyster’ + 油 ‘oil/sauce’ = oyster sauce.
  - **interpretation:** Names a condiment made from oysters and seasonings, widely used to enhance umami in stir-fries and marinades. Often refers specifically to the bottled sauce in Chinese cooking.
  - **simplification:** 蠔 was simplified to 蚝 by replacing the phonetic component 豪 with the simpler 号 under the 虫 radical, reducing strokes; 油 remained unchanged.
- **examples:**
  - 我喜欢用蚝油(我喜歡用蠔油)。
    - Wǒ xǐhuān yòng háoyóu.
    - I like to use oyster sauce.
  - 这道菜加一点蚝油更鲜(這道菜加一點蠔油更鮮)。
    - Zhè dào cài jiā yìdiǎn háoyóu gèng xiān.
    - This dish is tastier with a bit of oyster sauce.
  - 用蚝油炒青菜最方便(用蠔油炒青菜最方便)。
    - Yòng háoyóu chǎo qīngcài zuì fāngbiàn.
    - Using oyster sauce to stir-fry greens is very convenient.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔)
- **definition:** oyster; oyster meat; edible bivalve; dried oyster
- **pinyin:** háo
- **components:**
  - 虫(蟲)
    - chóng
    - insect; bug; worm
  - 豪
    - háo
    - grand; extravagant; heroic
  - 号(號)
    - hào
    - number; mark; to call
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic 虫 + phonetic 豪 (OC *ɡaːw).
  - **interpretation:** 虫 marks it as a creature in the invertebrate realm, which in Chinese script extends to shellfish and similar animals. 豪 provides the sound háo; the simplified form uses 号 as a streamlined phonetic while preserving a similar pronunciation.
  - **simplification:** Right-side phonetic simplified from 豪/號 to 号 to reduce strokes while keeping the háo sound; this aligns with earlier variant usage (e.g., 𧐢) and 20th‑century standardization.
- **examples:**
  - 我爱吃生蚝(我愛吃生蠔)。
    - Wǒ ài chī shēngháo.
    - I love eating raw oysters.
  - 炒菜放点蚝油更鲜(炒菜放點蠔油更鮮)。
    - Chǎocài fàng diǎn háoyóu gèng xiān.
    - Adding a bit of oyster sauce makes stir-fries tastier.
  - 过年会买些蚝干煲汤(過年會買些蠔乾煲湯)。
    - Guònián huì mǎi xiē háogān bāo tāng.
    - We buy some dried oysters to make soup for the New Year.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 虫(蟲)
- **definition:** insect; bug; worm
- **pinyin:** chóng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a snake; later borrowed for 蟲/虫 (worms, insects). Traditional 蟲: ideogrammic compound, triplication of 虫.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicting a snake, the graph was later repurposed to write ‘insect/bug/worm’, while the traditional form 蟲 triples 虫 to suggest many small crawlies. The original snake sense was reassigned to 虺.
  - **simplification:** Borrowing and stroke reduction: simplified Chinese replaced 蟲 with the older, simpler 虫 to reduce strokes and standardize usage; the snake meaning moved to 虺.
- **examples:**
  - 我怕虫子(我怕蟲子)。
    - Wǒ pà chóngzi.
    - I’m afraid of bugs.
  - 这只虫在叶子上爬(這隻蟲在葉子上爬)。
    - Zhè zhī chóng zài yèzi shàng pá.
    - This bug is crawling on a leaf.
  - 夏天蚊虫很多(夏天蚊蟲很多)。
    - Xiàtiān wénchóng hěn duō.
    - There are many mosquitoes and insects in summer.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 豪
- **definition:** grand; extravagant; heroic
- **pinyin:** háo
- **components:**
  - 高
    - gāo
    - high; tall
  - 豕
    - shǐ
    - pig; boar
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** abbreviated phonetic 高 + semantic 豕 (pig, boar)
  - **interpretation:** High 高 supplies the sound háo, while 豕 ‘boar’ contributes a semantic cue linked to boar bristles and vigor. Over time the sense broadened from associations of strength and prominence to ideas of grandeur, extravagance, and heroic spirit.
- **examples:**
  - 这家酒店很豪华(這家酒店很豪華)。
    - Zhè jiā jiǔdiàn hěn háohuá.
    - This hotel is very luxurious.
  - 他说话很豪气(他說話很豪氣)。
    - Tā shuōhuà hěn háoqì.
    - He speaks with a bold, heroic air.
  - 他们出手大方(他們出手大方)，十分豪迈(十分豪邁)。
    - Tāmen chūshǒu dàfāng, shífēn háomài.
    - They are generous and very bold-spirited.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 豪 → 高
- **definition:** high; tall
- **pinyin:** gāo
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth; opening
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a tall building (compare 京).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a multi-storied structure with roof and interior floors, evoking vertical height. The concrete image extended to abstract senses like tall/high and by extension eminent or expensive.
- **examples:**
  - 这座塔很高(這座塔很高)。
    - Zhè zuò tǎ hěn gāo.
    - This tower is very tall.
  - 物价太高(物價太高)，很多人负担不起(很多人負擔不起)。
    - Wùjià tài gāo, hěn duō rén fùdān bù qǐ.
    - Prices are too high, and many people can’t afford them.
  - 他地位很高(他地位很高)，但为人谦虚(但為人謙虛)。
    - Tā dìwèi hěn gāo, dàn wéi rén qiānxū.
    - His status is high, but he is humble.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 豪 → 高 → 口
- **definition:** mouth; opening
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 豪 → 豕
- **definition:** pig; boar
- **pinyin:** shǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram (象形): a pig; compare 亥, 𢑓 ‘male pig’, and 豖 ‘castrated male pig’.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a pig in profile with head, body, and legs. Related forms differentiate types of pigs; in 㒸, the pig element serves as a phonetic.
- **examples:**
  - 古书中常以“豕”指代猪(古書中常以「豕」指代豬)。
    - Gǔshū zhōng cháng yǐ “shǐ” zhǐdài zhū.
    - In ancient texts, “豕” refers to a pig.
  - 在甲骨文里，豕的形状清晰可见(在甲骨文裡，豕的形狀清晰可見)。
    - Zài jiǎgǔwén lǐ, shǐ de xíngzhuàng qīngxī kějiàn.
    - In oracle bone inscriptions, the form of 豕 is clearly visible.
  - 成语“豕突狼奔”中的“豕”意为猪(成語「豕突狼奔」中的「豕」意為豬)。
    - Chéngyǔ “shǐ tū láng bēn” zhōng de “shǐ” yìwéi zhū.
    - In the idiom “豕突狼奔,” “豕” means pig.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 号(號)
- **definition:** number; mark; to call
- **pinyin:** hào
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
  - 丂
    - kǎo
    - exhaled air; a cry
  - 虎
    - hǔ
    - tiger
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Ideogrammic compound (号); phono-semantic compound (號)
  - **description:** 号: 口 “mouth” + 丂 “exhaled air; a tiger’s cry”. 號: semantic 虎 “tiger” + phonetic 号 (OC *ɦlaːws).
  - **interpretation:** Mouth plus a breath/cry mark evokes someone shouting, yielding senses like to cry out or call. The traditional form adds “tiger” as the semantic element for roaring while using 号 as the sound component, which later extended to meanings such as mark and number.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by adopting the phonetic component 号 as the full form and dropping the semantic 虎, reducing strokes while preserving pronunciation and core ‘call/cry’ sense.
- **examples:**
  - 我的房间号是305(我的房間號是305)。
    - Wǒ de fángjiān hào shì sān líng wǔ.
    - My room number is 305.
  - 门上有个红色的记号(門上有個紅色的記號)。
    - Mén shàng yǒu gè hóngsè de jìhào.
    - There is a red mark on the door.
  - 领队发出集合的号召(領隊發出集合的號召)。
    - Lǐngduì fāchū jíhé de hàozhào.
    - The team leader issued a call to assemble.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 号(號) → 丂
- **definition:** exhaled air; a cry
- **pinyin:** kǎo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** conflation
  - **description:** Conflation of several characters.
  - **interpretation:** Not a regular pictophonetic or ideogrammic formation; scribes merged features of multiple similar-looking graphs into a single standardized form. Its attested sense relates to troubled breathing, aligning its usage with notions of breath or obstruction rather than a clear semantic-phonetic decomposition.
- **examples:**
  - 奔跑过后(奔跑過後)，他丂得厉害(他丂得厲害)。
    - Bēnpǎo guòhòu, tā kǎo de lìhai.
    - After running, he was panting badly.
  - 山路陡峭(山路陡峭)，走几步就觉得丂(走幾步就覺得丂)。
    - Shānlù dǒuqiào, zǒu jǐ bù jiù juéde kǎo.
    - The mountain path is steep; after a few steps one feels out of breath.
  - 医生问他是否有丂和胸闷的症状(醫生問他是否有丂和胸悶的症狀)。
    - Yīshēng wèn tā shìfǒu yǒu kǎo hé xiōngmèn de zhèngzhuàng.
    - The doctor asked whether he had symptoms of panting and chest tightness.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 号(號) → 虎
- **definition:** tiger
- **pinyin:** hǔ
- **components:**
  - 儿(兒)
    - ér
    - child; noun suffix
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: 虍 represents the tiger’s head; the torso disappeared; the legs and tail became 人 in small seal, later 儿 in clerical.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a tiger’s head with simplified limbs, reduced through script evolution. The body was dropped, leaving the head element (虍) and the legs/tail streamlined to 儿.
- **examples:**
  - 老虎在山林里咆哮(老虎在山林裡咆哮)。
    - Lǎohǔ zài shānlín lǐ páoxiào.
    - The tiger roars in the forest.
  - 中国人常说“如虎添翼”(中國人常說「如虎添翼」)。
    - Zhōngguó rén cháng shuō “rú hǔ tiān yì”.
    - Chinese people often say “like adding wings to a tiger,” meaning to greatly strengthen something.
  - 他属虎，今年运势不错(他屬虎，今年運勢不錯)。
    - Tā shǔ hǔ, jīnnián yùnshì búcuò.
    - He was born in the Year of the Tiger, and his fortune is good this year.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 号(號) → 虎 → 儿(兒)
- **definition:** child; noun suffix
- **pinyin:** ér
- **components:**
  - 人
    - rén
    - person
  - 臼
    - jiù
    - mortar
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a standing person; radical form of 人; also simplified from 兒 by eliminating 臼
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person standing on two legs, which is why it doubles as the person radical form. In traditional 兒, an added 臼 element evoked a baby’s soft skull, but simplification removed that part, leaving only the person/legs shape.
  - **simplification:** Stroke reduction by dropping 臼 from 兒 and reusing the existing person-radical form 儿.
- **examples:**
  - 我儿子在学校(我兒子在學校)。
    - Wǒ érzi zài xuéxiào.
    - My son is at school.
  - 她是我的女儿(她是我的女兒)。
    - Tā shì wǒ de nǚ'ér.
    - She is my daughter.
  - 这些电影很适合儿童观看(這些電影很適合兒童觀看)。
    - Zhèxiē diànyǐng hěn shìhé értóng guānkàn.
    - These movies are very suitable for children to watch.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 号(號) → 虎 → 儿(兒) → 人
- **definition:** person
- **pinyin:** rén
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: side view of a standing man, highlighting an arm and a leg; left-side form 亻.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person in profile, with one stroke suggesting the torso/arm and the other the leg, hence the slightly splayed shape. In compounds it often appears as the left-hand form 亻 to mark human-related meaning; not to be confused with 彳.
- **examples:**
  - 他是一个很好的人(他是一個很好的人)。
    - Tā shì yí gè hěn hǎo de rén.
    - He is a very good person.
  - 我认识很多人(我認識很多人)。
    - Wǒ rènshi hěn duō rén.
    - I know many people.
  - 这里有三个人(這裡有三個人)。
    - Zhèlǐ yǒu sān gè rén.
    - There are three people here.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 蚝(蠔) → 号(號) → 虎 → 儿(兒) → 臼
- **definition:** mortar
- **pinyin:** jiù
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a mortar. See the original version of 舂, in which a pestle is visible on top.
  - **interpretation:** A direct drawing of a mortar, showing the bowl used for pounding. Connection to 舂 (to pound) is historical, where a pestle appears above. Similar shapes seen in 學、兒、䳔、鼠、叟 are coincidental and unrelated.
- **examples:**
  - 他用杵在臼里舂米(他用杵在臼裡舂米)。
    - Tā yòng chǔ zài jiù lǐ chōng mǐ.
    - He uses a pestle to pound rice in the mortar.
  - 这个石臼很重(這個石臼很重)。
    - Zhège shíjiù hěn zhòng.
    - This stone mortar is very heavy.
  - 实验室里常用研钵和研杵(實驗室裡常用研鉢和研杵)。
    - Shíyànshì lǐ cháng yòng yánbō hé yánchǔ.
    - In laboratories, a mortar and pestle are commonly used.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 油
- **definition:** oil; grease; petroleum; sauce
- **pinyin:** yóu
- **components:**
  - 由
    - yóu
    - from; due to; reason; through
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 氵 (“water”) + phonetic: 由
  - **interpretation:** Combines the water radical to signal a liquid with 由 to suggest the sound yóu. The sense narrows to oily liquids and sauces, fitting the water-semantic category while borrowing pronunciation from 由.
- **examples:**
  - 这道菜油太多(這道菜油太多)。
    - Zhè dào cài yóu tài duō.
    - This dish is too greasy.
  - 我在加油站加油(我在加油站加油)。
    - Wǒ zài jiāyóuzhàn jiā yóu.
    - I refuel at the gas station.
  - 全球石油价格上涨(全球石油價格上漲)。
    - Quánqiú shíyóu jiàgé shàngzhǎng.
    - Global oil prices are rising.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 油 → 由
- **definition:** from; due to; reason; through
- **pinyin:** yóu
- **components:**
  - 十
    - shí
    - ten
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** phonetic 十 + semantic 口 ("mouth"); a container with a needle on top to indicate the sound; compare the bottom of the original 缶. Alt. view: a helmet (less likely).
  - **interpretation:** Graph suggests an opening or container (口) with a needle-like element on top, where 十 provides the sound and 口 contributes the idea of an opening or vessel. The notion of an opening or passage aligns with uses meaning “from/by way of,” while the phonetic element guided its reading.
- **examples:**
  - 由这条路走得更快(由這條路走得更快)。
    - Yóu zhè tiáo lù zǒu de gèng kuài.
    - It’s faster by/through this road.
  - 事故是由刹车失灵引起的(事故是由剎車失靈引起的)。
    - Shìgù shì yóu shāchē shīlíng yǐnqǐ de.
    - The accident was caused by brake failure.
  - 这项决定由他来做(這項決定由他來做)。
    - Zhè xiàng juédìng yóu tā lái zuò.
    - This decision is to be made by him.
### 蚝油(蠔油) → 油 → 由 → 十
- **definition:** ten
- **pinyin:** shí
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phonetic loan (rebus)
  - **description:** Originally a vertical stroke later crossed by 一; possibly a pictogram of a needle, rebus-borrowed for the word ‘ten’.
  - **interpretation:** Early forms may have depicted a needle, and that form’s sound was repurposed to write the word for “ten.” The cross shape developed when a horizontal stroke was added to the original vertical line.
- **examples:**
  - 我有十个苹果(我有十個蘋果)。
    - Wǒ yǒu shí ge píngguǒ.
    - I have ten apples.
  - 现在是十点(現在是十點)。
    - Xiànzài shì shí diǎn.
    - It is ten o’clock now.
  - 我们十个人一起去(我們十個人一起去)。
    - Wǒmen shí ge rén yìqǐ qù.
    - Ten of us are going together.

### 粥 → 米
- **definition:** rice
- **pinyin:** mǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: dehusked rice kernels; horizontal stroke as a bamboo sieve; cf. 粟 (with husk); unrelated to 木/禾/来.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts dehusked rice grains being sifted on a bamboo sieve, contrasting with 粟 which shows husked kernels. Despite visual resemblance, its form is not derived from 木, 禾, or 来.
- **examples:**
  - 我买了两斤米(我買了兩斤米)。

  - 请把米洗一洗(請把米洗一洗)，再煮饭(再煮飯)。
    - Qǐng bǎ mǐ xǐ yì xǐ, zài zhǔ fàn.

### 粥 → 弓
- **definition:** bow
- **pinyin:** gōng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a bow.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts the curved bow and its string in a simple outline. The shape evokes the bend and draw of archery and later serves as a component in characters related to pulling or shooting.
- **examples:**
  - 他拉开弓(他拉開弓)。

  - 这把弓很结实(這把弓很結實)。
    - Zhè bǎ gōng hěn jiēshi.
    - This bow is very sturdy.

## Dihua Street, Taipei
### Díhuà Jiē
---
- **definition:** Dihua Street, Taipei
- **pinyin:** Díhuà Jiē
- **components:**
  - 迪
    - dí
    - enlighten; guide; proceed; pursue
  - 化
    - huà
    - transform; change; convert; -ization
  - 街
    - jiē
    - street; road; thoroughfare; neighborhood
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** Toponym 迪化 + 街 ‘street’ = ‘Dihua Street’.
  - **interpretation:** Proper-noun compound naming the historic commercial street in Dadaocheng, Taipei. The post-1945 name likely commemorates 迪化 (now Ürümqi), while the morphemes 迪 ‘guide’ and 化 ‘transform’ give an auspicious tone.
- **examples:**

### 迪化街 → 迪

### 迪化街 → 迪 → 由

The notion of an opening or passage aligns with uses meaning “from/by way of,” while the phonetic element guided its reading.

### 迪化街 → 迪 → 由 → 十

### 迪化街 → 迪 → 由 → 口

- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**

  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.

### 迪化街 → 化 → 人

  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。

### 橙汁 → 汁

### 橙汁 → 汁 → 水
- **definition:** water
- **pinyin:** shuǐ
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram of water flowing; sometimes written as the variant 氺; next to a character it is compressed and stylized into 氵 (unrelated to 冫).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts flowing water with a main stream and side droplets. In compound characters it condenses to the left-side form 氵 to signal a water-related meaning, distinct from 冫 which indicates ice or cold.
- **examples:**

### 橙汁 → 汁 → 十
- **definition:** ten

## overseas Chinese
### huáqiáo
---
- **definition:** overseas Chinese
- **pinyin:** huáqiáo
- **components:**
  - 华(華)
    - huá
    - Chinese; China; splendid; flowery
  - 侨(僑)
    - qiáo
    - sojourn; reside abroad; temporary; overseas (in compounds)
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 华(華 ‘Chinese; splendid’) + 侨(僑 ‘sojourn; reside abroad’) = overseas Chinese.
  - **interpretation:** Refers to Chinese nationals or ethnic Chinese residing outside China, often with continuing ties to the homeland. In stricter usage, it denotes citizens living abroad, contrasted with 华人 for ethnic Chinese who have taken foreign nationality.
  - **simplification:** 華 → 华 by adopting an older variant/cursive form with fewer strokes; 僑 → 侨 by simplifying the phonetic 喬 to 乔 under the person radical 亻 to reduce strokes.
- **examples:**
  - 他说自己是华侨(他說自己是華僑)，在国外工作多年(在國外工作多年)。
    - Tā shuō zìjǐ shì huáqiáo, zài guówài gōngzuò duō nián.
    - He says he is an overseas Chinese and has worked abroad for many years.
  - 许多华侨在春节回乡探亲(許多華僑在春節回鄉探親)。
    - Xǔduō huáqiáo zài Chūnjié huíxiāng tànqīn.
    - Many overseas Chinese return home to visit relatives during the Spring Festival.
  - 政府设有华侨事务办公室(政府設有華僑事務辦公室)，服务海外同胞(服務海外同胞)。
    - Zhèngfǔ shè yǒu huáqiáo shìwù bàngōngshì, fúwù hǎiwài tóngbāo.
    - The government has an Overseas Chinese affairs office to serve compatriots overseas.
### 华侨(華僑) → 华(華)
- **definition:** Chinese; China; splendid; flowery
- **pinyin:** huá
- **components:**
  - 化
    - huà
    - to transform; change
  - 十
    - shí
    - ten; cross
  - 于
    - yú
    - in; at; from
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** phonetic: 化 + semantic: 十 (“stalk and leaves”). Traditional 華 was originally a pictogram of a flowering plant, later also analyzed as phono-semantic with 于 (phonetic) + 艸 (semantic).
  - **interpretation:** In the simplified form, 化 supplies the sound huá, while 十 preserves a vestige of the plant imagery inherited from 華. The traditional form depicted a flower on a stalk and later gained a phonetic 于 with the plant marker 艸, linking the senses of ‘splendid/flowery’ and ‘Chinese.’
  - **simplification:** Top floral component of 華 was replaced by the phonetic 化 to reduce strokes and emphasize pronunciation; 华 was introduced in the 1956 PRC simplification and had no prior attested form.
- **examples:**
  - 我为中华文化自豪(我為中華文化自豪)。
    - Wǒ wèi Zhōnghuá wénhuà zìháo.
    - I am proud of Chinese culture.
  - 他写了一篇华丽的文章(他寫了一篇華麗的文章)。
    - Tā xiěle yì piān huálì de wénzhāng.
    - He wrote a splendid article.
  - 许多外企在华投资(許多外企在華投資)。
    - Xǔduō wàiqǐ zài Huá tóuzī.
    - Many foreign companies invest in China.
### 华侨(華僑) → 华(華) → 化
- **definition:** to transform; change
- **pinyin:** huà
- **components:**
  - 人
    - rén
    - person; human
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** Two 人: one upright (亻) and one upside down (𠤎) indicating reversal/change; Shuowen also considers 𠤎 phonetic.
  - **interpretation:** An upright person paired with an inverted person depicts reversal, conveying the idea of transformation or change. Some analyses treat 𠤎 as contributing sound, but the primary sense comes from the visual contrast.
- **examples:**
  - 我们的计划需要变化(我們的計劃需要變化)。
    - Wǒmen de jìhuà xūyào biànhuà.
    - Our plan needs to change.
  - 城市正在快速现代化(城市正在快速現代化)。
    - Chéngshì zhèngzài kuàisù xiàndàihuà.
    - The city is rapidly modernizing.
  - 把废物转化为能源(把廢物轉化為能源)。
    - Bǎ fèiwù zhuǎnhuà wéi néngyuán.
    - Convert waste into energy.
### 华侨(華僑) → 华(華) → 化 → 人
- **definition:** person; human
- **pinyin:** rén
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: side view of a standing man, highlighting an arm and a leg; left-side form 亻.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person in profile, with one stroke suggesting the torso/arm and the other the leg, hence the slightly splayed shape. In compounds it often appears as the left-hand form 亻 to mark human-related meaning; not to be confused with 彳.
- **examples:**
  - 他是一个很好的人(他是一個很好的人)。
    - Tā shì yí gè hěn hǎo de rén.
    - He is a very good person.
  - 我认识很多人(我認識很多人)。
    - Wǒ rènshi hěn duō rén.
    - I know many people.
  - 这里有三个人(這裡有三個人)。
    - Zhèlǐ yǒu sān gè rén.
    - There are three people here.
### 华侨(華僑) → 华(華) → 十
- **definition:** ten; cross
- **pinyin:** shí
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phonetic loan (rebus)
  - **description:** Originally a vertical stroke later crossed by 一; possibly a pictogram of a needle, rebus-borrowed for the word ‘ten’.
  - **interpretation:** Early forms may have depicted a needle, and that form’s sound was repurposed to write the word for “ten.” The cross shape developed when a horizontal stroke was added to the original vertical line.
- **examples:**
  - 我有十个苹果(我有十個蘋果)。
    - Wǒ yǒu shí ge píngguǒ.
    - I have ten apples.
  - 现在是十点(現在是十點)。
    - Xiànzài shì shí diǎn.
    - It is ten o’clock now.
  - 我们十个人一起去(我們十個人一起去)。
    - Wǒmen shí ge rén yìqǐ qù.
    - Ten of us are going together.
### 华侨(華僑) → 华(華) → 于
- **definition:** in; at; from
- **pinyin:** yú
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形); two possible objects of representation (see Wiktionary); unrelated to the bottom component of 得.
  - **interpretation:** An ancient pictograph whose precise referent is debated; scholars have proposed two different objects that the strokes may depict. Over time it generalized into a high-frequency coverb/preposition meaning “in/at/from,” and despite visual similarity in some fonts it is not historically connected to the lower component in 得.
  - **simplification:** Mainland Chinese adopts the older variant 于 as the simplified form of 於 to reduce strokes.
- **examples:**
  - 我们于北京见面(我們於北京見面)。
    - Wǒmen yú Běijīng jiànmiàn.
    - We will meet in Beijing.
  - 这本书写于唐代(這本書寫於唐代)。
    - Zhè běn shū xiě yú Tángdài.
    - This book was written in the Tang dynasty.
  - 他于去年从上海出发(他於去年從上海出發)。
    - Tā yú qùnián cóng Shànghǎi chūfā.
    - He departed from Shanghai last year.
### 华侨(華僑) → 侨(僑)
- **definition:** sojourn; reside abroad; temporary; overseas (in compounds)
- **pinyin:** qiáo
- **components:**
  - 人
    - rén
    - person
  - 乔(喬)
    - qiáo
    - tall; lofty
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** phono-semantic compound
  - **description:** semantic: 亻 + phonetic: 喬 → 乔 (simplified).
  - **interpretation:** The person component 亻 signals a meaning related to people or human affairs. 喬/乔 supplies the pronunciation qiáo and, while mainly phonetic here, also evokes an elevated or shifted position, fitting senses like residing abroad or being away from one’s native place.
  - **simplification:** Simplified by replacing the phonetic 喬 with its simplified form 乔 to reduce strokes while preserving pronunciation and meaning.
- **examples:**
  - 他是第三代华侨(他是第三代華僑)。
    - Tā shì dì-sān dài Huáqiáo.
    - He is a third-generation overseas Chinese.
  - 她的父母长期侨居海外(她的父母長期僑居海外)。
    - Tā de fùmǔ chángqī qiáojū hǎiwài.
    - Her parents have long resided overseas.
  - 政府为归国侨胞提供服务(政府為歸國僑胞提供服務)。
    - Zhèngfǔ wèi guīguó qiáobāo tígōng fúwù.
    - The government provides services for returned overseas compatriots.
### 华侨(華僑) → 侨(僑) → 乔(喬)
- **definition:** tall; lofty
- **pinyin:** qiáo
- **components:**
  - 高
    - gāo
    - high; tall
  - 夭
    - yāo
    - tender; young; to die young
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram (指事), differentiated form (分化字)
  - **description:** Differentiated form of 高 (“high, tall”), marked with an added element—variously a stroke, 屮, 止, 力, 九, or 夭; later Shuowen misread the 夭 form and treated it as phono-semantic.
  - **interpretation:** Originally a marked variant of 高 used to indicate the idea of height/loftiness while distinguishing it graphically with small markers. The 夭-shaped variant became standard in later scripts, which led some scholars to mistakenly analyze 夭 as a semantic component and reclassify it.
  - **simplification:** Simplified to 乔 by generalizing the later 夭-based outline and removing the complex 高 framework, reducing strokes and regularizing the shape in the PRC simplification scheme.
- **examples:**
  - 庭院里种着几株乔木(庭院裡種著幾株喬木)。
    - Tíngyuàn lǐ zhòng zhe jǐ zhū qiáomù.
    - Several tall trees are planted in the courtyard.
  - 他搬新家，亲友前来道贺，祝他乔迁之喜(他搬新家，親友前來道賀，祝他喬遷之喜)。
    - Tā bān xīnjiā, qīnyǒu qiánlái dàohè, zhù tā qiáoqiān zhī xǐ.
    - He moved to a new home, and friends and relatives came to congratulate him, wishing him joy on his relocation.
  - 此地乔木参天(此地喬木參天)。
    - Cǐ dì qiáomù cāntiān.
    - The tall trees here reach to the sky.
### 华侨(華僑) → 侨(僑) → 乔(喬) → 高
- **definition:** high; tall
- **pinyin:** gāo
- **components:**
  - 口
    - kǒu
    - mouth; opening
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** pictogram: a tall building (compare 京).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a multi-storied structure with roof and interior floors, evoking vertical height. The concrete image extended to abstract senses like tall/high and by extension eminent or expensive.
- **examples:**
  - 这座塔很高(這座塔很高)。
    - Zhè zuò tǎ hěn gāo.
    - This tower is very tall.
  - 物价太高(物價太高)，很多人负担不起(很多人負擔不起)。
    - Wùjià tài gāo, hěn duō rén fùdān bù qǐ.
    - Prices are too high, and many people can’t afford them.
  - 他地位很高(他地位很高)，但为人谦虚(但為人謙虛)。
    - Tā dìwèi hěn gāo, dàn wéi rén qiānxū.
    - His status is high, but he is humble.
### 华侨(華僑) → 侨(僑) → 乔(喬) → 高 → 口
- **definition:** mouth; opening
- **pinyin:** kǒu
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形) – resembles an open mouth.
  - **interpretation:** A simple square outlines the opening of a mouth, with the empty center representing the oral cavity. It later became a common semantic component indicating speech, sounds, or openings, and in early compounds sometimes marked abstract meanings via association or borrowing.
- **examples:**
  - 他张开口(他張開口)，说了几句(說了幾句)。
    - Tā zhāngkāi kǒu, shuō le jǐ jù.
    - He opened his mouth and said a few sentences.
  - 一家三口住在这个小城(一家三口住在這個小城)。
    - Yì jiā sān kǒu zhù zài zhège xiǎo chéng.
    - A family of three lives in this small town.
  - 她咬了一口苹果(她咬了一口蘋果)。
    - Tā yǎo le yì kǒu píngguǒ.
    - She took a bite of the apple.
### 华侨(華僑) → 侨(僑) → 乔(喬) → 夭
- **definition:** tender; young; to die young
- **pinyin:** yāo
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** Ideogram (指事): a figure leaning forward, presumably running, hence energetic and young; cf. the top of 走.
  - **interpretation:** A stylized person bent forward suggests motion and vigor, evoking the sense of youthful energy and tender growth. By extension, it also came to denote an early or premature end, as in dying young or something being cut short.
- **examples:**
  - 他年纪轻轻就夭折(他年紀輕輕就夭折)。
    - Tā niánjì qīngqīng jiù yāozhé.
    - He died young.
  - 计划因资金不足而夭折(計劃因資金不足而夭折)。
    - Jìhuà yīn zījīn bùzú ér yāozhé.
    - The plan was aborted due to insufficient funds.
  - 桃之夭夭(桃之夭夭)，灼灼其华(灼灼其華)。
    - Táo zhī yāoyāo, zhuózhuó qí huá.
    - The peach tree is luxuriant in blossom, its flowers blazing bright.

## kung fu
### gōngfu
---
- **definition:** kung fu
- **pinyin:** gōngfu
- **components:**
  - 功
    - gōng
    - achievement; merit; skill; effort
  - 夫
    - fū
    - man; husband; adult male; laborer
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** compound word
  - **description:** 功(achievement; skill) + 夫(suffix ‘man’ > nominalizer) = skill gained through effort; later narrowed to martial arts.
  - **interpretation:** Combines the idea of achievement/work with a nominal element to mean skill developed over time and effort. Via Cantonese gung1 fu1 and English, it came to denote Chinese martial arts specifically.
- **examples:**
  - 他每天练功夫(他每天練功夫)。

  - 她的功夫很高(她的功夫很高)。
    - Tā de gōngfu hěn gāo.
    - Her kung fu skills are excellent.
  - 我没功夫聊天(我沒功夫聊天)。
    - Wǒ méi gōngfu liáotiān.
    - I don’t have time to chat.
### 功夫 → 功
- **definition:** achievement; merit; skill; effort
- **pinyin:** gōng
- **components:**
  - 工
    - gōng
    - work; labor
  - 力
    - lì
    - strength; power
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** Phono-semantic compound and ideogrammic compound
  - **description:** phonetic: 工 ‘work’ + semantic: 力 ‘strength’; also analyzed as ideogrammic: 工 + 力.
  - **interpretation:** 工 gives the sound gōng and the idea of work, while 力 adds the sense of strength or applied force. Together they evoke exerting strength in work, leading to effort, skill, and meritorious results.
- **examples:**
  - 为了取得好成绩(為了取得好成績)，他下了很大功夫(他下了很大功夫)。
    - Wèile qǔdé hǎo chéngjì, tā xiàle hěn dà gōngfu.
    - To get good grades, he put in a lot of effort.
  - 这次项目成功(這次項目成功)，多亏了大家的功劳(多虧了大家的功勞)。
    - Zhè cì xiàngmù chénggōng, duōkuī le dàjiā de gōngláo.
    - The project’s success is thanks to everyone’s merit and contributions.
  - 她在书法上的功夫很深(她在書法上的功夫很深)。
    - Tā zài shūfǎ shàng de gōngfu hěn shēn.
    - Her skill in calligraphy is profound.
### 功夫 → 功 → 工
- **definition:** work; labor
- **pinyin:** gōng
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a bladed tool to plow and mark a border; alternatively a carpenter’s square (cf. original meaning of 巨).
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a tool used to prepare the ground and set boundaries, naturally extending to the idea of labor and work. Some traditions instead see a carpenter’s square, connecting it with making and constructing, and with early senses linked to 巨.
- **examples:**
  - 我在工厂工作(我在工廠工作)。
    - Wǒ zài gōngchǎng gōngzuò.
    - I work in a factory.
  - 这些工人正在劳动(這些工人正在勞動)。
    - Zhèxiē gōngrén zhèngzài láodòng.
    - These workers are laboring now.
  - 他的工钱很高(他的工錢很高)。
    - Tā de gōngqián hěn gāo.
    - His wages are high.
### 功夫 → 功 → 力
- **definition:** strength; power
- **pinyin:** lì
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram (象形): interpreted as a bent arm extending from the body, or as a wooden plough; original form 𠠲.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts an arm applying force, a concrete image that came to represent strength and effort. Some traditions also saw it as a plough, linking power with labor in the fields.
- **examples:**
  - 他力气很大(他力氣很大)。
    - Tā lìqi hěn dà.
    - He is very strong.
  - 我们要尽力完成任务(我們要盡力完成任務)。
    - Wǒmen yào jìn lì wánchéng rènwù.
    - We must do our best to finish the task.
  - 科技给人类带来巨大力量(科技給人類帶來巨大力量)。
    - Kējì gěi rénlèi dàilái jùdà lìliàng.
    - Technology brings great power to humanity.
### 功夫 → 夫
- **definition:** man; husband; adult male; laborer
- **pinyin:** fū
- **components:**
  - 大
    - dà
    - big; great
  - 一
    - yī
    - one; single
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a variant of 大 preserving the meaning ‘man’; 大 and 夫 were once interchangeable; later also used as a jiajie (phonetic loan) for ‘that’.
  - **interpretation:** Depicts a person akin to 大 with an added top stroke, later interpreted as a hairpin signifying an adult male. Meanings of 夫 and 大 diverged over time, and 夫 was also borrowed to write the demonstrative ‘that’ in Classical Chinese.
- **examples:**
  - 他是个好丈夫(他是個好丈夫)。
    - Tā shì ge hǎo zhàngfu.
    - He is a good husband.
  - 农夫在田里劳作(農夫在田裡勞作)。
    - Nóngfū zài tián lǐ láozuò.
    - The farmer works in the field.
  - 夫人请这边走(夫人請這邊走)。
    - Fūrén qǐng zhèbiān zǒu.
    - Madam, please come this way.
### 功夫 → 夫 → 大
- **definition:** big; great
- **pinyin:** dà
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** pictogram
  - **description:** Pictogram: a person facing forward; original form of 夫, later phonetically borrowed for “big”.
  - **interpretation:** Originally depicts a human figure viewed from the front, not necessarily with exaggerated outstretched arms. The graph was later borrowed to write the word pronounced dà ‘big’, while 夫 specialized for ‘man’. The modern shape still evokes a torso with two legs and an arm stroke.
- **examples:**
  - 这个房间很大(這個房間很大)。
    - Zhège fángjiān hěn dà.
    - This room is very big.
  - 他是我们家最大的孩子(他是我們家最大的孩子)。
    - Tā shì wǒmen jiā zuì dà de háizi.
    - He is the eldest child in our family.
  - 大学开学了(大學開學了)。
    - Dàxué kāixué le.
    - The university term has begun.
### 功夫 → 夫 → 一
- **definition:** one; single
- **pinyin:** yī
- **etymology:**
  - **type:** ideogram
  - **description:** a horizontal stroke, indicating the number 'one'.
  - **interpretation:** A single horizontal line visually represents the concept of oneness. As the simplest numeral, it set the pattern for 二 and 三 by repeating the stroke to show increasing quantity.
- **examples:**
  - 我只有一本书(我只有一本書)。
    - Wǒ zhǐ yǒu yì běn shū.
    - I only have one book.
  - 他一到就给我打电话(他一到就給我打電話)。
    - Tā yí dào jiù gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
    - As soon as he arrives, he calls me.
  - 一个问题都没有(一個問題都沒有)。
    - Yí gè wèntí dōu méiyǒu.
    - There isn’t a single problem.
